Summary: We stayed here one night as part of a California driving week, and this was the pre-Disney night. Paid parking. Okay check-in experience and friendly staff, although when we asked for a room not close to an elevator and then ended up right beside the elevator, it was a little mystifying. We ended up staying there anyway. Room wasn't huge but big enough. Good bed. But ultimately it was the proximity to Disney that was the reason for the stay, including Disney Downtown. Both are a 10-minute drive away, so it kept things simple. Target is across the street from the hotel, and there are lots of places to eat nearby.  So it was a decent stay. Not memorable in any sense but just average.

They have a fridge, small coffee maker, and a safe (check before you book at other hotels).  Bathroom is nice.  It is across the street from Target so you can grab some food, things you forgot to pack.  There is a shuttle, $6.00/day per person.  Also right next door -Red Robin, Outback Steakhouse, Joes Crab Shack, a pizza place (didn't go there) and Coco's.  If you want to walk to Disneyland -plan on at least 45minute walk (I am a fast walker).  Only small issue was the safe didn't work.  Called down and maintenance was there quickly and solved it. Summary: We stayed at this Sheraton in Oct 2018 and we were looking to stay again in Dec 2019. During this time frame I found out that the ARTBus no longer services the hotels near the Target, the Sheraton included. You are now offered to pay for a shuttle to Disneyland for $6 per adult and $3 per child (ages 3-9), which is more expensive than the ART bus. It also only comes every half hour and is one of the smaller shuttle buses instead of a full size ART bus. This shuttle also services multiple hotels. I dread having to wait an additional 1/2 hour for a shuttle bus because there is no room at the end of the night. The front desk staff was also snotty about the shuttle when I called and asked questions. I ended up booking a different hotel due to the shuttle problems

The outdoor pool and hot tub were in good condition and obscured from the surrounding areas by mature plants.  This was a great stay and a great value.  I would definitely stay here again.

Summary Heading: Comfortable, clean Garden Grove hotel near Disneyland Resort
Summary: I stayed at the Sheraton Garden Grove for 2 nights and was quite pleased with the hotel. My fourth floor room was away from the elevator all the way in the northeast corner (facing in Disneyland direction which is 2 miles north on S. Harbor). The king-size bed, furnishings, wi-fi, coffee maker, TV, all looked fairly new and in good working order. I needed wi-fi so was happy that Sheraton had free guest wi-fi and that it worked well on that floor, in the corner of the building!  Check-in was efficient. Check-out was a little slower since a guest apparently had some problem that occupied the one station, but two additional staff members appeared and took care of the small line that had developed. Overall I thought the front desk staff, as well as housekeeping, were all friendly

Summary: We stayed here on a 4 day trip to DisneyLand. This hotel is not within walking distance of the parks, so you'll need to get an Uber (around $7 per way). We were aware of the shuttle service, but opted for Uber for better flexibility.  Rooms were very clean and spacious - room had coffee machine which had complimentary Starbucks coffee. We did notice that there is a $10 charge (per day or per stay?) to use the fridge, which is fairly cheeky. Bathroom was huge and well lit, entire room was very well taken care of.  We didn't hear any noise from other guests. Check in and out was quick and efficient. Couldn't ask for more if visiting Disney!

Summary Heading: Clean property in a decent location
Summary: We've stayed at this hotel twice in the past couple of weeks. The first stay was just for one night, the second was three nights. Parking is self-park, at $15, but on our second stay, the front desk agent reduced the parking to $8/night, which was unexpected and truly appreciated.  Both rooms were spacious and comfortable, though our first room was much bigger. We had plenty of space to spread out in both rooms, though, so there's nothing to complain about there.  The bed was comfortable, but the pillows were way too soft for my comfort. I ended up bunching two up into a ball to provide the neck support I needed. Summary: The room was a huge double double with lots of space on the third floor facing Harbor St (surprisingly not noisy). Check your bill before checking out ~ we had used parking for one day but was charged for the whole time.  Also you cannot prepay anything on your bill until you check out i.e. pay some cash now and credit card balance later - must do it all at once at check out. There is a Disney shuttle top near the driveway entrance which we didn't use.  We walked down Harbor and picked up the ART there - just as convenient.  Target is a short walk across the street.  We didn't use the restaurant (ate at Disney).

Summary: I stayed here for a buisness conference. Rooms were clean, no refrigerator in room but they do have a cooler in the room that's good for bottled drinks and works fine. Staff was friendly and helpful. Hotel does have a shuttle, not sure of all the stops since I did not use it but it appears it goes to the Disneyland Resort area. Target across the street and different restaurants within walking distance. Will stay again at this hotel.
Manager Response: On behalf of the entire hotel team, we want to thank you for sharing your experiences with us during your recent stay at Sheraton Garden Grove - Anaheim South Hotel. It is always encouraging to hear positive feedback, particularly when it comes from those who matter the most – you!  Thank you for staying at the Sheraton Garden Grove - Anaheim South Hotel and we hope you choose to create more memories here whenever your travels bring you back to Garden Grove.  Sincerely, Steven Langevin

Summary: I unfortunately stayed for business. I am not particular when it comes to business hotels. I need a comfortable bed, a comfortable room temperature, and a usable bathroom. The bed was decently comfortable. I could not keep the room at a comfortable temperature to save my life. Because you have to choose either air conditioning or heat, in the day time it was too hot and at night it was too cold. The shower had a handle that didn’t indicate where hot was so you have to figure it out. The shower dripped constantly. The carpet in the room looks old and dirty. I used the gym and it had all the right equipment but only half of it worked.   I will say that the staff at this hotel are spectacular and the restaurant serves a great breakfast at a reasonable price.
Manager Response: We are delighted to have been your chosen hotel during your recent stay in Garden Grove. It was truly a pleasure to serve you. We appreciate your business and value your honest feedback. Your comments have been shared with the hotel team as a critical way of understanding how we can continue to improve and deliver exceptional service to guests like you. We are currently undergoing a complete renovation of our Rooms, and Lobby area along with upgraded Wifi and TV services. Once again, thank you for your valued feedback and we hope to serve you again whenever your travels bring you back to Garden Grove. Sincerely, Steven Langevin

Summary: Stayed there a few days ago while visiting my daughter and was very pleased. I arrived a bit later in the evening and check in was handled very smoothly. My room was in great shape, near the elevator and very comfortable. The hotel is near Disney, with a cluster of hotels surrounding it (and the Target right across the street) but far enough away to seem away from the resort traffic. It's an easy ride to/from SNA Airport. Only real issue was the parking gate was a tad wonky, but nothing serious.
Manager Response: We appreciate the generous score and kind words. We do love our location near shopping and many national restaurants, and the ease to get to several freeways, all while being close enough to the parks.  Much thanks,  The team at Garden Grove

Summary: We had a group of 29 for a high school mock trial trip to Orange County and could not have been happier with the service. From Luis and Natalie at the front desk to Bernard in Food/Bev, everyone was very helpful and accommodating of our needs. Hotel is close to everything and rooms were decent (great bathrooms!) Had a great visit!
Manager Response: This is great to hear! Thank you so much for staying with us. We appreciate the excellent review and will certainly congratulate the team members who made the stay memorable.  We look forward to seeing you again!  The team at Garden Grove

Summary Heading: Perfect Hotel for the Disney Area!
Summary: Price is right, service is excellent (Issack at the Front Desk is the nicest person you'll ever meet), and amenities are just right for us!  Room was clean and fresh.  Lobby was clean and slightly elegant.  Price was perfect.  We had a rental car, so it made going to and from the parks a snap, although parking can be tight when they're busy.  Highly recommended!
Manager Response: We thank you so much for this review and will certainly congratulate Isaack on his customer service. We hope to be of service again and again. Very best, The team at Garden Grove

Summary: The hotel has a great location across the street from Target. Plenty of restaurants close by and a nice lounge. The staff are friendly and helpful. Many locations to explore nearby and relatively peaceful and quiet.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Clean, Quiet Room, Comfortable Bed, Safe area, courteous staff
Summary: Check in and check out was quick. Staff was helpful. Property was clean. Shuttle bus to Disneyland was on time and convenient ($6 daily for adult $3 for child).  The room (with a king sized bed) located at the end of the hall (room 457) was clean and spacious. The bed was comfortable.  Great water pressure in the shower (no bathtub).  The room was quiet, the only time I heard anything from outside my room was when a guest talked in the hall way or the low boom of fireworks in the distance (there was no street noise or sounds from rooms above or next to mine).  There is a Target store right across the street from the hotel, perfect for picking up affordable travel items, beverages, and snacks (same $1 bottle of smart water at Target cost $4 at Disneyland). The hotel employees
Manager Response: none

Summary: I've stayed here 3x but this will be my last. As an SPG credit card holder, wi-fi is free. (Yes, they still charge for it here, but that's another issue.) At check-in the front desk told me to accept the internet charges and they'd remove it, but upon checkout they still billed me and refused to honor this. The best part is the manager who told me, "Well we didn't charge you for parking, but since we have your credit card on file and you technically accepted all fees, we can charge you for that now." Petty and not trustworthy customer support. Sad that other reviewers - SPG Platinum members, so at an even higher tier than myself - are also getting weak service. With the range of hotel choices in Anaheim, you can go elsewhere.
Manager Response: We apologize for the misunderstanding. SPG members do get complimentary internet when the reservation is booked through the SPG channels, however not when booked through a 3rd party.  We'll do some training to better explain these benefits. We would love to have you back to restore your confidence, as we are completing a multi-million dollar renovation of the hotel which will include 5X faster internet speeds.  Best,  The Sheraton team

Summary Heading: Great service and a cheap Uber ride to Disneyland
Summary: I booked this hotel thru Hotwire and was never treated that way.  The girls at the front desk are so friendly and personable.  What a great start to my stay!  The room was clean, the beds were comfy and the bathroom was well appointed, spacious and clean!  The only thing wrong was the carpet was wet.  Maybe they just shampooed it?    I kept my shoes on the entire stay.
Manager Response: none

Summary: It is very easy to reach from Google maps.  We were lucky as we visited on new year's Eve so they waivered the parking fees for us. (YES!)  the staff is friendly and very helpful.  The room we asked for was standard and it is very spacious, it had coffee machine and Starbucks coffee sachets. It is clean and they provide good amount of towels. However we were located on the 2nd floor so our view was the roof so it was a bummer for us, also we had constant crying kids in the room next to us and the walls are so thin we could hear everything. But because we didn't spend much time in the room we tried not to let that bother us. The Starbucks cafe in the ground floor had the coffee machine broken. They didn't have breakfast buffet, so we ordered breakfast: the food and coffee were
Manager Response: Well we certainly appreciate the recommendation and look forward to being of service again!  We'll work on the issues mentioned and will make the necessary changes to improve as needed.  All the best,  The team at Garden Grove

Summary Heading: Spacious Rooms, Comfortable Bed, Great Water Pressure, Friendly Staff
Summary: I stayed here for business and really liked this hotel. At this price point it's hard to beat, and I found myself liking this hotel better than some of the other local SPG offerings at higher price points. Great water pressure, nice room size, easy parking (remember to bring your hotel key with you to both enter and leave the parking lot), and overall a solid choice at a great price point.
Manager Response: This is terrific news. We are thankful to receive such high praise, and look forward to many more visits.  All the best from the Sheraton team!

Summary Heading: What you expect from a Sheraton - Value and Clean Rooms
Summary: My family stayed at the Sheraton Garden Grove - Anaheim South in October 2017. It was basically what we expected from a Sheraton - not overly luxurious, but a clean, quiet and safe hotel room. We were visiting the area to go to Disneyland. The hotel is about a mile down the road from one of the entrances - just far enough to make waking not a great choice. The hotel has a shuttle, but Uber's were about $7 each way so we opted to do that. All in all a good experience at the Sheraton.
Manager Response: We appreciate the review and recommendation for other travelers. We do enjoy our location, within walking distance to Target, and many national restaurants including Outback and Joe's Crab Shack. Look forward to being of service again, The team at Garden Grove

Summary: Meets all the criteria of an SPG category 3. Check in and checkout was a breeze. Clean room and bathroom.Maria from housekeeping for the 6th floor was awesome(Thank you for the Candy canes , the kids enjoyed them) Good basic free breakfast at the club lounge. In the morning there is hot chocolate by the front desk and yummy cookies in the afternoon. Very kid freely. There is a target right across the street and ample restaurants within walking distance.  Would recommend for those going to Disney.
Manager Response: none

Summary: My wife and I stayed here using points with family. We had two rooms.  The property was ok. A bit dated, but to be expected, and not unreasonably so. The club bfast was nice. But the parking was horrendous. They charge for parking and It was a challenge to find a spot, and the stalls  are TINY. We were in a standard minivan and had trouble finding then firing in an empty stall.   It’s convenient to Disneyland, and there is a Super Target just across the street.
Manager Response: We certainly appreciate the rating despite the parking challenges. Sometime during the holiday weekends when we have company holiday parties there are many more cars to park, and we apologize that the valet and bellman weren't able to assist. As for being 'a bit dated' we are planning a renovation this Spring and will have more news to come on that.  We hope in the meantime that the customer service continues to bring guests back as it has. All the best from the team at Garden Grove,  Chris

Summary Heading: A Terrible hotel with a horrible GM Chris
Summary: I have been a platinum member with SPG for 6 years, and I guarantee this is the worst SPG hotel ever I have lived.The service was bad, the room was terrible. The worst was I got food poison after I had the breakfast from the hotel, and I had to go to hospital for two days which ruined my holidays with my family.   I reported back to my ambassador, and the hotel started to look into this for couple weeks.They had no report, no communication, no outside investments, and by the time I almost forgot this, they wrote an email back saying I got sick from something else...And I asked them what have I had for the breakfast, and they didnt even know. Even worse, their general manager wrote an email to me saying they would not honor any of mine future booking or reservation, and asked me
Manager Response: This review is from a stay in August of 2016. We completed an investigation into this claim of food poisoning and found that the illness must have come from somewhere else. The breakfast burritos came from our food distributor frozen and 100 other guests ate the same food yet no one else got sick. Food poisoning generally takes 10 hours to 2 days to set in, not 1 hour. Starwood hotels corporate office agreed with us.

Summary: Its a very decent hotel. Staff is super friendly. Good for business travelers. Roams need updating. Location is good if you want Disney only but far from LA and most attractions in SoCal. They need to improve their breakfast options.
Manager Response: Thank you for the review! We do pride ourselves on service, and do realize we could use some updating. We are planning some upgrades this winter that we're sure will improve the experience. Best, The Sheraton team

Summary: I brought my wife to California for her birthday since she has never been on the west coast and this is the hotel that we found. I will start with the negatives. As a hotel guest, I find it laughable that for the rate we paid, we would still have to pay a daily parking charge of $8.If there are those of you that like to exercise, if your room is located on the opposite end from the elevators, it's gonna be quite a hike. Also, be aware that there are no plugs/outlets in the immediate area of the bed, if you would like to sit and read on your tablet, you would need a 10' cord.......the immediate outlet is located at the head of the bed (the mattress can't go flush against the wall). We had a "cooler" in our room with fridges available to rent for $10.   There were some positives
Manager Response: Thank you for the review!  We appreciate the honest feedback. We are planning some improvements upcoming, such as bedside charging ports. As for the parking, yes most hotels in this area charge for parking or have a resort fee or other so best to check ahead. Our guests do like the convenience of parking here and taking the shuttle right to the front entrance to Disneyland, and skip the even higher parking rates there. We do love our location too, close to all the major freeways and walking distance to shopping and some great restaurants! Thanks again from the team at Garden Grove

Summary Heading: Worst hotel I ever saw in my life
Summary: Well I am Marriott elite member and Marriott hotel charge parking per day in this area. I call Sheraton and ask the deal and she said if you upgrade to club floor breakfast is free and parking also free. When I reach the desk scenario change they said no I have to pay parking then I call reservation and said same thing and said is our agent mistake I must pay parking.  Second major thing is outside hotel is clean and nice however once you get in is worst then Motel 8 very dirty corridor and your room carpet and chair have alot of stain, bed sheet also dirty.   I don't recommend any one to stay in this hotel specially with kids. The rate is same as Marriott.   I didn't check the review however I saw trip advisory print hotel which is hanging inside the frame once you get in.   I
Manager Response: none

Summary: This is our second stay at the hotel and the property is really nice. The rooms are larger than your standard hotel (I think some of that is because there is not a built in closet, but a large armoire) In addition the hotel has been very well kept since its opening. I cannot say enough about the staff at the hotel. They have always been so hospitable while staying. They were very understanding and helpful with a late check out request on this visit.  The hotel offers a shuttle for a nominal fee which I believe runs continuously to Disneyland. My wife and I normally just used Uber as it is more flexible. About $8-11 one way from the hotel, and about a 5-8 minute ride. I cannot speak to the hotels Food and Beverage as we have never used it. Will definitely look to stay here again
Manager Response: Well we certainly appreciate the excellent review and recommendation. Most of our rooms are very spacious, however we appreciate the comments about the staff most of all. We look forward to many returns, The Sheraton team

Summary Heading: DIRTY & Front desk rude. Don't stay here if you care about having a good experience before Disneyland
Summary: I actually cried to see a family who probably spent their savings to bring their kids to Disneyland to be treated so poorly by the hotel front desk. If you are going to be a hotel by "one of the happiest places on earth" where people travel from far away, HIRE STAFF that is happy and accommodating, compassionate. These people look and act like they are working in a prison and are the prison guards.   I did not feel at all like a Starwood platinum guest. I could care less, I was here for business, but people that had spent a lot of money to be here, and upgraded to have VIP lounge privileges, faced a VERY dirty, closes early, garbage overflowing, dirty carpets,  no water stocked, no snacks, and employees of the VIP lounge (evening staff, not morning staff) that are irresponsible
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Very Clean and Excellent Room Prices Too
Summary: I have stayed at this property five times, and they always deliver a very friendly and helpful staff, super clean and well appointed rooms and public space, and an outstanding value (cash or points for the SPG faithful) too. These are generally the most important check marks for me with hotels, and will return again when in the area.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This was our first time staying at Sheraton Garden Grove. We were warmly greeted upon arrival which is always a plus. The hotel was clean and we do not have any complaints. Good price for a good room. It's within walk-able distance to several restaurants and Target is across the street, which is very convenient. Away from the crowds which are closer to Disney -- you can drive ~5 mins and will get to Disney. We would stay here again.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Solid stay in close proximity to Disneyland
Summary: While in the area on vacation, we spent three nights at the Sheraton Garden Grove.  Given the close proximity to Disneyland, a friendly staff, and nearby shops and restaurants, we had a very pleasant stay.   We were treated quite well as SPG Platinum.  As others have noted, the Club Level breakfast and evening offerings were unremarkable, but they served the purpose.  The frequent shuttle to the theme parks ($6 per person/day with unlimited daily rides) made having a car unnecessary.  The hotel was an easy 15 minute rideshare ride from John Wayne Airport (SNA).  I've stayed previously at the Sheraton Park Hotel at the Anaheim Resort (see review).  While that property is closer to the theme parks, I much preferred my stay here.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed here for 3 nights, the hotel was really really old. The carpet in the hallway was dirty and there's a lot of stain. Our room is OK and the carpet is dirty. They have a Shuttle to Disneyland that runs every 30 minutes which is very convenience to my family. A special thanks to Reniel who help us a lot of times from our Bags to our trip to Universal studios. He help us with the tickets and transportation to universal studios. Service is good but the hotel is old.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Good for a non-Disney related trip
Summary: I was in the area for a sporting event and was pleased with this hotel.  The location is good and, while it is close to Disney and probably very convenient for those going to the park, it was not so close that you're choked by traffic getting to and from the hotel.  The rooms were nice, the exercise room well-equipped and there is a Target right across the street.  Some restaurants are in walking distance, too.  The parking was a bit of a pain but would not deter me from staying again in the future.  I will say this...there's probably no room you can get that will have a pleasant view; you're either looking on the main road or the back of another resort.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This hotel is a good location, 40 minute walk to Disney parks (they do offer a shuttle) and right across from Target.  Staff are very friendly and efficient, rooms are a good size and if you have access to the club lounge, the breakfast and dinner buffet selections are very good.  Even the small gift shop has some inexpensive Disney souvenirs that are unique.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Stayed for 4 nights in early August!  Stayed in the club level rooms which were clean and quiet! The complimentary bottles of water were a helpful touch especially with the summer heat and visits to Disneyland.  The club lounge wasn't very exciting, the food was very basic and not the most appetising! The club lounge drinks were again very basic but convenient.  The pool was very plain. Gym was pretty good.   Overall a convenient and clean stay with helpful and friendly staff but I wouldn't rate it too highly as a hotel overall.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Outstanding 3.5 Star hotel with a 5 Star Service
Summary: I stayed at this hotel with a colleague for 5 days. I am Spg Gold, they recognized it and gave me a nice quiet corner room with club access. They went above and beyond and also comped Club for my colleague as he was with me.  A+ service during check-in.   Club Level breakfast and evening hors d'oeuvres were outstanding. Hot breakfast everyday with eggs, hash potatoes with peppers and onions. They also had waffles, fresh cut fruit and a full accompaniment of continental breakfast. Starbucks coffee and Cappuccino maker were a plus. Evening hors d'oeuvres were equally impressive. Staff at the Club is extremely hardworking and works to keep things stocked. One suggestion for the Club Level - they should serve beer and wine, cash off course!  Dinner at the bar was good, nothing
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: One of the worst experiences of my life
Summary: We have stayed at this hotel 12 times this year and until now were prepared to ignore most of the problems with the hotel because the location was convenient for business and the price fitted our budget.  However the last stay caused us to reach the end of our tether, particularly in relation to a surly and vexatious staff member who should be sacked for the poor way in which she handled our complaints.  The ongoing issues for us were; - Ongoing property maintenance issues over the last 6 months, including broken and noisy elevators, air conditioning and leaks. - Slow Internet - Incorrect charges on our room account - Failure to recognize regular guests - Housekeeping, particularly in relation to the sheets not covering the entire mattress leaving an uncovered gap at the end of
Manager Response: We appreciate the feedback and as always we work to correct mistakes and service issues however when any guest becomes threatening to our staff we cannot continue to have them stay in the hotel.

Summary: Very accessible to Disneyland by car or shuttle, parking is $15 and you use your room key to access the gate. Target is right across the street. Huge shoutout to IRVING at the desk for helping us find the right room we wanted: clean, quiet and with a refrigerator. It would not have been the same experience with out his genuine assistance.
Manager Response: We appreciate the kind words. We do love our location with easy access to the Parks, shopping, dining and the freeways. We'll be sure to recognize Irving too! Best regards, The Sheraton team

Summary: This hotel is fine for sleeping.  Not really set up for dining or bar.  Kind of a boring atmosphere to be honest.  Nothing wrong with the room or pool but nothing too exciting to report though.   Easy-to-use shuttle service to Disney that was nice.  Once you're in Anaheim/Garden Grove access to everything is pretty easy from here.   Noise level was low over 3 nights.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We had a situation with the Air BnB where we were staying. I booked a room using Hotwire, and ended up getting this Sheraton.The bed was very comfortable. We used the paid shuttle ($6/person$ to ride theto Disney, the shuttle was very convenient. All of our drivers were very friendly. Coco's restaurant/bakery was right across the street which was good for breakfast and late night eating after being at Disney all day. My only gripe was the $15 dollar/night parking. If not for the parking fee I would have given it a 4 star.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Manager is rude and was unhelpeful
Summary: I had a problem with the hotel, asked for the manager, and she was so rude, she treated me and my family really bad. Im a SPG gold member we go to Disneyland every 2 months and we never had a problem. First time having a problem in 3 years. Bad manager, and hotels should be careful with the people they hire
Manager Response: none

Summary: Major glitch during my check-in. My family ended up waiting outside our assigned room that was changed twice for half an hour because the room was not ready and the door was broken. But the time flew by because of two Sheraton Associates who went above and beyond. Rein and Fermin made what could have been a hellish wait into a pleasant delay.
Manager Response: We are happy that our staff were able to make up for a glitch with the door. We appreciate the review and look forward to your return. The Sheraton team

Summary: Super clean and very comfortable. Desk staff was extremely friendly. Fairly close to Downtown Disney... $5 Uber ride. Only downside was the posted parking rate was less that the rate charged... only $3, but still. Will stay again!
Manager Response: none

Summary: I called the hotel directly and was told they have a resort size pool, you can see the fireworks from Disney from the hotel and they have free wifi. All lies! None of this is true. I prepaid for my stay and was told they'd charge a $50 incidental fee. Ok, I budgeted for that when I arrived I asked what exactly will be charged. $50-$100 ok it was $300 that was charged! Very rude staff no compensation for the lies I was told. Only sarcastic remarks! Nothing like the pictures either!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Definitely a great place to stay!
Summary: I'm ultra picky when it comes to hotels when I'm traveling.  I have MS and need to make sure the bed is comfortable so I can get the sleep I need to function, need a clean room, a quiet room, etc.  Not only did this hotel meet expectations on all levels, but the staff were excellent.  I called with a couple of questions prior to booking my stay and spoke to a lovely young woman named Sophia.  She was incredibly friendly, but she truly understands the sacrifices some families make to go on vacation and did an excellent job at making sure I knew my business was appreciated.  I would hire her in a minute for my company if I could!  She's a natural at sales, but actually delivers on her word.  I am an annual pass holder, but live in Utah...I travel to Disneyland frequently and have
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Hotel is conveniently located, but was average
Summary: All of the staff were extra friendly, which my family and I appreciated on our vacation for 3 days here. Parking was on the lower end of cost $15 each night. The rooms were average and could have smelled better in the hallways. Our air unit had a weird smell come out of it for a short period of time, which I am unsure if it was the filter that needed changing? The pool and hot tub were decent, but we loved that it was 24 hours because we utilized it late at night after a long day of being out and about. Overall was an ok stay.
Manager Response: none

Summary: 2 years ago this was one of the best. Several problems since then. Well over a dozen stays here in the last year. Trend has been downhill. But most importantly the GM DOESN'T RESPOND. That's the mark of a poor hotel. Problems happen. Failure to respond is inexcusable. Chris Halderson, you've lost my business and my company's business.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: "Great location if you are going to Disneyland"
Summary: Room is very spacious and clean! Great location if you plan to go to Disneyland. They offered a shuttle and it is cheaper to take the shuttle then pay for parking fees  at Disneyland. The shuttle runs every 30 min and you may purchase your Disneyland Tickets at the front desk.    Food and Beverages were priced reasonably.  We enjoyed the pool and Hot tub. The only thing I would have liked to have had was a refrigerator in our room...  Would defiantly return..
Manager Response: Dear Beachbumb911-  We were thrilled to read your review and thank you so much for the recommendation. We will certainly share your comments with the team.  Our guests do like to take the shuttle and avoid the huge parking lots (where you have to take another shuttle) at the parks. We are happy you enjoyed our 24 hour pool and hot tub- the fitness center is open 24hours too!  Very best,  The Sheraton Garden Grove team

Summary: Room was spacious and clean, Maria at the Front Desk was very fast and helpful! the only bad thing i will say is that the hot tub was not hot only luke warm, very gald the pool is open 24 hours. Over all we would stay here again.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Clean great size rooms and great customer service.
Summary: Great location and rooms were very nice, great housekeepers! We were on the club level which was nice a breakfast in the morning then off to Disneyland for the day and then back in the evening for snacks, it was very convenient. My daughters and I were allergic to strawberries and their staff went down and made special french toast for my daughters and myself, they went above and beyond. Their front desk was great and we bought our Disneyland tickets very easy process. Great hotel and staff with many conveniences! They need air conditioning in their laundry room and better machines.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Hotel is down the road from Disneyland and offers shuttle service, which is comfortable and faster than taking your car. Hotel rooms are not the newest and could do with a bit of remodeling. Pool is small for a hotel this size.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Hotel is situated about 5mins drive away from Disneyland. Parking is available at a nominal fee within the hotel compound. There is also a scheduled disney shuttle that comes by to the hotel throughout the day, ask the reception for more details. If you do not wish to wait for the shuttle, uber is always available and cost approximately $6 - $8 depending on the time of the day. The overall service by the staffs were great and we would definitely stay here again on our next visit.
Manager Response: none

Summary: As SPG loyalists, we stay at this hotel every time we go to Disneyland, which in sum, totals more than 10 times. We have never had an issue with the staff, our room or any of the services offered. It's a very nice hotel.  The good: great location, the shuttle to Disneyland is a convenient service, the rooms are nice and spacious, the staff is always responsive and courteous, parking is easy and plentiful.  The bad: the location is a bit too far to walk to Disneyland, but just across the street from Target (so that's actually a plus!). The shuttle costs $6 per person, less for kids I believe; depending on how many in your party, driving may just be cheaper and more convenient. There is a daily fee for parking, but that's nothing unique to this property, but it's nice to know
Manager Response: none

Summary: Me and my family check in at Sheraton Garden Grove around March. The rooms are nice and clean and we enjoyed staying there. I also want to mentioned your staff Rein he was very helpful and friendly and also all the staff.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Lovely atmosphere , lovely staff :) Rooms are big and clean , outdoor spa and pool , indoor gym . Close to Disneyland ;) Free Wifi and parking  I will love to come back !!!!!!! Traveled in January 2016
Manager Response: none

Summary: We crashed here after an Angels game so we could hit Disneyland the next day. Hotel was average - clean, looks like recently updated. Every hotel staff member we came across was super friendly. We stayed on the second floor, and there was a pretty off-putting smell in the hallway the entire time we were there (mixture of stale curry and really old crayons). Happy to report there was no smell in the room. Overall, this was a perfectly fine place to crash for a night. I heard their pool was 24 hours which is great for a family vacationing at Disneyland and I'm pretty sure there was a Disneyland shuttle.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Came here for a seminar; it's the third time I've stayed here. The hotel is very clean and the staff are very helpful. Very close to a variety of restaurants and close to Disneyland. The Grill has a fairly small daily menu with salads priced at $14 and up.  The only downsides are minor; a plastic bottle of water for $4.50 is egregious. The large flat screen is nice, but the analog picture takes up only half the screen and is so dark it's difficult to see the program.  I'd definitely return but they could do a little better.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I am normally pretty easy going when it comes to staying in a hotel but there are some fundamentals that I expect: 1.  Free internet - Not here. 2.  Free Parking - Not here and on top of that my troubles with the paid parking automated machines were dismissed, not taken seriously.  It wasn't until others complained that the machine was serviced.   3.  Servicing of the room in a timely manner -  It still wasn't completed by 3:30 pm with the staff leaving at 4:30.   4.  They pre-charge you the full amount plus an additional deposit.  In my case they charged 423.00 up front for a two night stay.  The actual stay costs 330.00 on the final bill. It will take 3 to 5 business days to refund the difference.     I would have thought a hotel who was relatively close to Disneyland would
Manager Response: none

Summary: Property about mile south of Disney with less than 5 minute was to restaurants and across the street from a Target. Good value property of visiting the theme parks with families.  The staff was friendly and offered good service. Rooms were an average Sheraton but nothing special. The room was clean, wifi was spotty and the lounge was what to expect from this hotel.  Overall a good family choice for the theme parks and you can make use of their shuttle for $6

Summary: This was a great Hotel for trip to Disneyland. The shuttle was absolutely on time and available. The rooms were nice, plenty of parking, my husband says the best workout room ever. The only complaint and it was major was that rather than asking you to keep your towels or not change your bed linens frequently they really want you to choose not to have your room cleaned and they offer some bonuses if you choose not to. We did not want those offers and we did want the room cleaned but in spite of that 2 days out of the five we were here they did not clean the room which meant no clean towels, no more toiletries, no extra bottle of water.  Oops was all they could say and they gave us the credits that we didn't want.
Manager Response: We appreciate the feedback and will certainly review the housekeeping and make a green choice program. Best regards, The Sheraton team

Summary Heading: Picked a WINNER for our kids first Disneyland/CDA Trip!!!!!
Summary: Where do I start?!?!?!? This hotel was beautiful and quite the bargain for the price. My wife and I brought our 3 kids down for their first Disney trip and boy were we a happy family. The room we were in was very nice, updated, modern and clean. We all had plenty of room and slept like babies after a long day in the parks. The grounds were very well maintained. The pool looked nice, but we didn't get a chance to use it. The breakfast was a hit with my family. It had a little bit of everything for everyone. The staff was very friendly and helpful. If I ever find this hotel for the same deal I paid, I will definitely be back. Matter of fact, I would pay a little more to come back.
Manager Response: This is terrific to hear! We love having families here to experience the parks. We are a short shuttle ride to them, far enough away to avoid the crowds, and sleep comfortably at night. Best, The Sheraton team

Summary: This hotel has the weird rules that if you put the Do not disturb sign out, your Green choice option will be auto waived, you'll not receive the 500 points. I have stayed at many SPG properties and no one have ever told me about this rule. It would be great if the hotel inform me about this rule when I checked in. when I asked for the 500 points I was told no, after all the arguments I then was told they will still offer me the points for courtesy... from the front desk to the hotel manager, they should improve their communication skills with their guests. if the manger told me he will still offer me the points as a courtesy, I wouldn't argue to make myself look bad. a little disappointed, the 1st time at a SPG property. I guess they probably don't care because they have
Manager Response: Well we are certainly disappointed in the Make a Green Choice confusion. We'll definitely do some re-training on the process and we're sorry it was such a hassle this trip. Our apologies, The Sheraton team

Summary: The front desk staff were very helpful and friendly upon check-in. The room was clean, quiet, and the beds were very comfortable. The provided toiletries were actually very nice, which made a quick overnight stay easy. The room service menu was really good and very reasonably priced, which is great after a long day. Parking was an additional $12, there is a shuttle that will take you to Disneyland the passes are $3/day for adults children 9 and under are free. The hotel is about 2 miles from the main gate of Disneyland, we've comfortably walked it before when kiddos fell asleep in the stroller and we didn't want to wake them up to fold the stroller up to get on the shuttle, or we simply didn't want to wait for the shuttle. Target is conveniently located across the street for any
Manager Response: We truly appreciate the excellent review, feedback and recommendations. We do love our location, far enough from the crowds, yet close enough for a short shuttle to the parks, convenient to the freeways, with plenty of restaurants and shopping nearby.  All the best from Garden Grove

Summary: For the price near Disneyland, this was a great hotel.  It is only 1.9 miles down the same road as Disney so although there was a shuttle, we only took it to the park and enjoyed a leisurely stroll home afterward.  Safe area.  Pool was nice although could use better ambiance/foliage around as you see the parking lot to one side and the street on the other side.  But hot tub/pool was clean and always empty.  Front desk staff were great and very helpful.  Target is right across the street.  The rooms were LARGE!  More than enough room for a roll away if you have an extra person.  I can't think of a real complaint actually.   Safe area too.   And close to pollo loco.  :)
Manager Response: This is great to hear! We certainly appreciate the high praise and look forward to many return trips.  All the best,  The team at Garden Grove

Summary Heading: Not one of the better Sheraton properties
Summary: Check out my other reviews and you will see that I have been at 1 star & 5 star properties. Normally you get what you pay for, but this time customer service and accommodations did not match the price paid.  Because of its location, this property would probably be good for vacationers.  This particular trip involved my wife & 9 yr old son who were attending a 2 day business seminar.  Again we usually overlook most things when on vacation in order to stay relaxed, but for time sensitive meetings and scheduling its better when the hotel works with you and not against you.  After driving 6 hours from Sacramento and arriving at property around 130AM, my wife was told that even though she paid for parking she would have to go find a parking space  on her own maybe even at the back of
Manager Response: none

Summary: I stayed at this hotel beginning of April for a convention nearby. What marked me the most was the staff. They were very friendly and knew how to deliver good customer service. It was well appreciated.  I was able to enjoy some fireworks every night. My room's window was right in front of it. And the view! I would never get tired of seeing mountains from afar every day.   Staff - 5/5 Keep on the beautiful smiles :)  Room - 5/5 Super clean, well furnished. First thing I checked was the bathroom. Great shower pressure, clean and modern looking. Lacked a bit of counter space (hey, I'm a woman who needs her counter space in a bathroom!), but apart from that, everything was top notch.  The bed is SUPER comfortable. I had no trouble sleeping at all. Room temperature was just perfect,
Manager Response: Terrific! This is great news for the team here in Garden Grove. We appreciate the detailed review and excellent recommendation and look forward to many more trips. Best regards, The Sheraton team

Summary: We came to the Disney so choose to stay here because of the location, it is about 10 minutes drive to the park so really great, but you know still need a long way to park the car and get into the park(for more than 30 minutes). The hotel is standard Sheraton, room is kind of small but ok, clean and comfortable. Considering the price this would be a valuable choice.
Manager Response: We appreciate the review and look forward to seeing you again! We also have a shuttle to the parks that runs every 30 minutes for a nominal fee. Best regards, The Sheraton team

Summary Heading: Some front counter staff was more then below average
Summary: When I checked in the person beside me was having a heated argument with the front desk staff. I was quite puzzled as the front desk staff that helped me was amazing. Then the next day I found out why. Some of the front desk staff have trouble counting money. She couldn't give me change from a $6 bus ticket from a $20 and had to wait for a computer to be free to use the calculator to figure out she needs to give me back $14. And she also counted the change wrong. And when i checked out I found out she added the $6 charge to my room. It took forever to have this problem fixed and I almost missed my bus. I have a few other problems with the billing and it seems to be the most simple thing yet they make it into a nightmare.... Now i understand why the day i checked in the other
Manager Response: We appreciate the feedback and will certainly do some more training with the staff here. Our customer service is ranked among the top 25% of all Sheraton's in North America so our apologies that it didn't show this trip. Best, The Sheraton team

Summary Heading: Excellent customer service and great stay!
Summary: Can't even begin to say enough great things about this hotel. Nice, clean hotel. Our original plan was to stay 5 nights but due to our flight being canceled we were there an extra 3 nights. Staff was more than accommodating in extending our reservations and did so in a fair cost effective way. They were always very helpful and friendly. We will certainly be back again to this hotel.  One day the shuttle for early entrance to Disneyland did not show up. They had a bellman  out at the shuttle area quickly and ended up calling cabs (and paying for them) for all of us waiting. They very easily could have just had us continue to wait. They were awesome. We will be back to Disneyland within a year or two and this will for sure be our hotel. Thank you Sheraton staff!!
Manager Response: This is terrific to hear! We certainly appreciate the excellent recommendation and look forward to many return visits.  Very best,  The team at Garden grove

Summary: Personal service was top notch. We felt at home and everyone was friendly and very professional. Even the issues we had with the parking, they worked on resolving it, although I had to ask twice for it, but it was all taken care of professionally. Also, don't get an adjoining room, unless you need it at this hotel since the walls/doors are thin. It's on my SPG profile that I do not get an adjoining room, but somehow got it. It really wasn't an issue until our first night when the family next door was up and were having a very loud discussion at 11:30 pm. After I called, the hotel took care of that and we slept soundly the rest of our stay. We also left the phone charger in our room to which housekeeping found, and the hotel is shipping back to us. This hotel is highly
Manager Response: This is so nice to hear! We appreciate the acknowledgement of the team here and will be certain to recognize them publicly. Very best, The Sheraton team

Summary: We Stay at this hotel 2 a year. Every time we come, we are given the best customer service possible. Danny from the front desk helped us with special requests we had and had all set up before we even arrived. Fernando helped us with changing rooms the second night. Very Positive and Great Attitude.
Manager Response: We love seeing these reviews. Much thanks for the excellent score! Best, The Sheraton team

Summary Heading: Great hotel next to disneyland and convention center
Summary: I was here to attend a conference at Anaheim convention center.  The room was very spacious with good access to the convention center.  They have shuttle to get you to disneyland with a fee.  The swimming pool is tiny, so did not spend anytime there.  As for parking, the property provides many spots but you have to pay.  There are plenty of restaurants within walking distance.
Manager Response: We appreciate the recommendation and look forward to having you back. Very best, The Sheraton team

Summary: Wonderful Experience . All personal was great,they answer all questions very professional. Enjoyed the visit. Thank you. I will be visiting again.. My family really enjoy everything. Your service was top notch. You are a ten star  organization. I really love being there. I certainly will. Visit again. And suggested it to others. I had no problems with anything or anything. Love it, really loved it. Your employees should be commended daily. I would love to employee. All of them.
Manager Response: This is certainly terrific to hear! We do pride ourselves on our customer service and we are happy it showed with your visit. We'll be sure to pass this along to our team and look forward to seeing you again.  Very best,  The Sheraton team at Garden Grove

Summary: This was just a wonderful stay! First of all: What an exceptionally friendly and helpful staff! We had a wonderful stay at the Sheraton- modern, clean rooms, very good amenities, great location - a perfect place to stay if visiting Disneyland.
Manager Response: We do love our location, however are more pleased when our staff is recognized. We appreciate the kind review and will be sure to pass along the kudos to the team. Very best, The Sheraton team

Summary Heading: Nice large room, but otherwise average
Summary: I stayed at the hotel for one night for the Expo West.  It is about 1.5 miles away from the Convention Center. The staff was friendly, but a bit slow at check in. The room was large and nice with Wifi included. The rate also included breakfast at the Club Level.  It was a bit confusing to find the breakfast room, it was small and no seating left when I arrived for breakfast.  The breakfast had cereal, toast and juice and rather boring. Overall the hotel felt slightly dated.
Manager Response: We apologize for the difficulties you encountered on our Club level. We typically receive very high marks for our full hot American breakfast. We do appreciate the review and will certainly make changes as necessary. Best, The Sheraton team

Summary Heading: Good Service, Nice Room, AWEFUL smell
Summary: We really enjoyed our stay here. The staff was friendly and the location was perfect for us. The room we were given was fantastic and huge! BUT, as we got off the elevator and walked to our room all we could smell was a cross between sweaty feet and quesadillas. The hallway smelled that way during the length of our 2 night stay. I'd stay here again, but something needs to be done about that hallway smell.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I recently stayed here for business.  It was a little drive, but was worth the wait as a Platinum member.  The hotel is a bit dated in furniture and decor, that it's because (I think) the hotel want to cater to both Disneyland and business guests.  My bathroom was pretty updated per Sheraton standards.  Regardless of the decor, the sleep experience met my expectations.  During the week, there was no issues of noise or large crowds in the lounge.    The front desk was okay.  They were your typical behind-the-desk greeters.  The young valet guy was very helpful in the morning, both behind and away from the desk.  I would recommend this hotel to all SPG members and business travel needs.
Manager Response: We sure do appreciate the recommendation and, especially from one of our most frequent travelers. We do feel like we have a good mix of corporate and leisure travelers, unlike those hotels so close to the parks that they have double the traffic, congestion, and guests. Best, The Sheraton team

Summary: Since it was Sheraton and expensive, I expected more. It seemed worn down. Carpet stains, etc. Had to pay for parking and internet. My TV remote didn't work, but I was too tired to call someone. Gym was adequate. 24 hour Heated Pool was nice. But I went at 6:30am and of course, there were no towels. The staff was EXCELLENT-very helpful.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Excellent location and worth every dollar paid. The staff never gets tired answering our queries. Also very accommodating!  We were allowed a late check out in one of the 2 rooms we had.  Housekeeping did a good job in cleaning our rooms.  We will cime back! Thank you
Manager Response: We look forward to having you back! Much thanks for the excellent review and comments about the staff here- they are what make the hotel great. Very best, The Garden Grove team

Summary: I was in Orange County for business and The Sheraton Garden Grove was good and convenient. The hotel provides USA Today and Wall Street Journal, the room was big and clean. Indeed not fancy but comfy. The hotel room service food didn't impress me, but there are many restaurants within walking distance. The front desk staff were very helpful and they were able to arrange transportation to airport since the hotel doesn't have shuttle to and from airport. Overall the hotel is very good.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Spent 4 nights here and found the property to be serviceable. The location was good for me as it was near dining options and other hotels. The location was good as it was a bit further out from Disneyland so I avoid some of the traffic and congestion. It is walking distance to the convention center but it was 15-20 minutes.    The room was nice. Not fancy but roomy and comfortable. Workout room was good. Machines and weights were clean and seemed to be cared for. Sometimes these workout spaces are pretty gross, but here it was receiving attention like the lobby and rooms. The pool was ok but small for any swimming per se. Hot tub is small but good enough. Towels on the pool deck were nice.  Staff were anxious to address any issues. They took a parcel for me and contacted FedEx
Manager Response: This is great to hear. We appreciate the in depth review and recommendation. We'll be sure to review all of these items with our management team to ensure and even better experience on the next trip. Very best, The team at the Sheraton Garden Grove

Summary: We booked (3) rooms for a weekend stay to visit Disneyland.  The staff were very pleasant and always smiled and said hello or good morning.  Shuttle to Disneyland and back was easy to use.  We stayed on the Club floor and had access to breakfast in the morning.  For the (2) mornings we were there the main breakfast items were different, not the same thing each morning.  The food was good and there were choices of what to eat or drink.  Room and bathrooms were very clean.  All rooms had a refrigerator and safe.  The beds were very comfortable.  The TV's are flat screen but the operation is poor.  Changing channels is very slow and sometimes unresponsive.  One channel has low volume and the next wakes up the people in the next room.  A few channels lock up the TV and nothing
Manager Response: We appreciate the thorough review and will certainly review with the entire management team. We are looking at upgrading our TV and internet service and hope to make things even better for the next trip. Best, The Sheraton team

Summary Heading: Overnight stay after Disneyland - dirty room
Summary: We stayed in an accessible room on the top floor for one night. While the check in process was easy and the front desk staff very nice, the room was quite dirty. I had a big discount being an spg rewards member, but if I had paid full price, or been staying more than one night we would have asked to move. It was dusty, there were stains on the walls and carpet, and the bathroom fixtures  were falling off. The drain in the bath was completely out. We won't stay there again and I would recommend looking at other area hotels.
Manager Response: We are certainly sorry that this room wasn't in the best shape. We regularly perform preventative maintenance and shampoo the carpets in all the rooms. Our scores for cleanliness are typically above 95% so we are sorry to hear that this experience wasn't the best. We do hope we're given another opportunity in the future. The team at Garden Grove

Summary: Very nice staff in the front desk , everything was nice and professional. I got a nice upgraded room wit ha nice and green views ,with access to their modest lounge  If you go for business of conference this is a good option
Manager Response: We do think our location is perfect for business travelers and leisure guests alike. We are far enough away from the parks to avoid the crowds, yet a short shuttle ride away. Best, The Sheraton team

Summary: We stayed at Sheraton Garden Grove for 3 nights for the convenience of visiting Disneyland Park. There are choices of restaurants nearby, for instance, Joe's Crab Shack, Outback Steakhouse, Oggi's (pub, pizza), Coco's (bakery cafe). The reception staff was very friendly. Check-in and check-out were processed efficiently. Our room was spacious, so as the bathroom although the water pressure of the shower was a bit weak. Wifi was charged at USD9.95/day. The shuttle pass to Disneyland Park at USD3 available for sale at the hotel reception is an advantage.
Manager Response: We appreciate the excellent comments and recommendation. We do love our location, walking distance to many national restaurant chains, and a short shuttle ride to the parks. Best regards, The team at Garden Grove

Summary Heading: One of my favorite Sheratons, great service
Summary: This place always treats its guests great and especially their SPG regulars. Rooms are excellent, comfy beds and well maintained. I've never had a maintenance issue or had to make a request in more than 5 stays here. Excellent location for business to jump on a highway in any direction quickly. Nice walk to Angel Stadium if you're up for some exercise (5 miles).
Manager Response: Well this certainly makes our day! Much obliged for the kind words. We do love our location, a short walk to many local restaurants, shopping and attractions. Our staff is what we're most proud of however, with service scores in the top 25% of all Sheraton's in North America.  Very best,  The team at Garden Grove

Summary Heading: This was the fourth time we stayed at this hotel, mostly for leisure.
Summary: The facility was well kept, comfortable, located in a safe area. The security measures of the hotel was more than adequate. We felt safe and secured at all time. The front desk staff was pleasant, polite, efficient, helpful and friendly. The suite and amenities were very clean and well maintained. All equipments (AC, TV...) were properly functional. We stayed at this hotel four times in the last 12 months and thoroughly enjoyed it.
Manager Response: This is terrific to hear. We will certainly pass these comments along to the team and many thanks for taking the time to prepare this wonderful recommendation.  We look forward to many returns, The team at the Sheraton Garden Grove

Summary: This hotel is in the perfect location for Disney, restaurants, and Target! Price is phenomenal and customer service at this hotel was even better. Parking was safe w/24 HR security and hotel is brand new!
Manager Response: We sure do love our location, a short shuttle away from the parks and the crowds, but close to shopping and many restaurants. We do pride ourselves on our service, which is currently ranked among the top Sheraton hotels in North America. Very best, The Sheraton Team

Summary: The hotel was clean and the staff was very friendly. What we found odd was that even though they came each day and cleaned the room, they would frequently forget to restock items. We had to ask for more shampoo, conditioner, soap, toilet paper and glasses many times.
Manager Response: We apologize for the missed items when cleaning the room, which we have addresses with the team, and appreciate the feedback. Best, The Sheraton tea.

Summary Heading: Perfect hotel for the price near Disney
Summary: This hotel is not the closest to Disney but they offer free parking and a free shuttle to the parks, which is very efficient and convenient.  The view options are either roofs, street view, or empty lot view, but I didn't find this to be a problem since we didn't spend that much time in the room. The room was modern-looking and very clean.  My girlfriend just fell in love with the comforter and I have now been given the task of finding one for the house.  The check in was quick and easy, and the lady in the front desk was very helpful and professional.  The hotel has a small pool and jacuzzi that are not fancy but are clean and well-kept. I would definitely recommend this hotel.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Visiting in December made it all that much more special, arriving in reception was definitely amazing with all the lights and the grandness of all the glass etc.  We had a kids suite with the separate adjoining room with bunk beds. The room was great, it had no opening windows, which I would have preferred. Courtesy bus to disneyland worked really well, leaving every 30 mins.  Breakfast options at starbucks worked well and also there is a Target and shops right opposite for any food needs.  Would stay again.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Worst  Exprience  ( sheratons are usually great ) but not this time
Summary: One of the worst customer service ever, i am not surprised for the bad rating they are just after your money, front desk team are very unhelpful adding to that a manager by the name of luis we were trying to get a room with a balcony or any room that have at least window for fresh air due to my health condition but he wouldnt help and i even went up to check the room they offered but i could not stay for 2 mins i went down the manager lied about us being up there for 20 mins when he wasnt even there when we walked in. Really a bad place to stay . And we took a pic of the name tags to refer to after we went to the room i got a call from luis threatening to kick us out if we dont delete the pic i told him i ll bring this up to sheraton corporate and he really didnt care much.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Hotel was great, rooms were clean, nice and comfortable. Club level food was nice, and there were always drinks available. Only stayed a night, but was a nice hotel with a lot of nearby eateries. Would recommend to families. Thanks!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Stayed here for one night. The Hotel was great. Staff was friendly. The rooms were clean. There is a nice little bar in the lobby and a restaurant. The gym was also pretty decent for hotel gyms. Self parking was around $12 per car. Overall no complaints here. It was exactly what I expected from a Sheraton.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Our savior in times of need, a great place
Summary: We had booked one hotel in Woodland Hills and found it gross, so we left, we looked for SPG options in the internet and booked it right before getting in. We arrived and received superior service. Great cleanliness standards, the room was spacious and well equipped, free water bottle and coffee, our rate had breakfast included. Would definitely stay there again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: While not as fancy as the sheratons I'm used to, the service continues to shine through. The front desk staff are quick to assist in any issue, they ensure you have everything you need and the concierge desk was extremely helpful with directions and parking options when I had to meet friends in downtown Disney.
Manager Response: We appreciate the kind words and will be sure to relay them to the team.  We look forward to being of service again. Very best, The Sheraton team

Summary: From the moment you enter this hotel you feel at home. The staff is incredibly warm and gracious. The hotel is in excellent condition. They are always cleaning whether it's the lobby or the guest rooms. Everything in the room worked perfectly. Outstanding!!!
Manager Response: We are definitely excited to read this review and thankful for the kind words. We'll be sure to pass along these comments to the team! Very best, The Sheraton team

Summary Heading: weekend trip to Disney and Knott's
Summary: Average stay.  Only one set of elevators in a horseshoe shaped hotel.  Quite a long haul when you are carrying sleeping kids.  Parking was $12/night and they offered a shuttle service to and from Disneyland Resort ($3 per person for the day).    Beds were quite comfy however there was not a tub, just a walk-in shower that was challenging to get kids washed up without getting myself and the floor soaked.
Manager Response: We are thankful for the feedback. We do have rooms with tubs so please call ahead and we'll be sure to put you in one! Best, The Sheraton team

Summary Heading: On the Outskirts of the Disneyland Area
Summary: Stayed 4 nights for a Disneyland getaway, we were one the "Club" floor, which had sizeable and well appointed rooms with single serve coffee maker and mini-fridge available for our use.  Bed was pretty good and restful after all the long days on your feet.  Wireless was also included in the rate, but we had to accept the charge when logging in and the desk "took it off" at check out.  I have to commend the staff, they were very nice considering how many Disney guests they must get.  And I will agree with other reviewers that the Breakfast room was a zoo, since it didn't seem to be limited to the "Club" floor.  We had a few major disappointments, first was the neighborhood, its a the very end of the Anaheim Resort area, and the neighboring areas are not the most enticing looking.
Manager Response: We appreciate the feedback and will surely take a look at these concerns. We do appreciate the kind words about the team. Best, The Sheraton team

Summary: Located close to Disney, they have shuttle services to Disney. Room is quite large and comfortable, good amenities. Service was friendly and polite. They have internet access at the lobby with PCs, very comfortable and convenience. Breakfast was simple but good enough.
Manager Response: We appreciate the excellent score and kind words and look forward to being of service again.  Very best,  The team at Garden Grove

Summary: Spent the night for a local fundraising event. Room was ready upon check-in. Front desk was very friendly. Good value for the money. Club lounge was a little busy Sunday morning but Sheena took care of us. I could tell she performs her job at a very professional and personal level. Would say here again.
Manager Response: This is great to hear. We'll definitely congratulate Sheena and her team.  Best, The Sheraton team

Summary: The pros - Staff was super friendly and helpful at this hotel.  Fridge and coffeemaker in room was nice to have.  The cons - Bad beds. Looked at the mattress tag and it was from 2008. You could feel the bedsprings on this mattress. Definitely time to upgrade the mattresses. TVs - the signal on the TV is horrible. Some channels are very fuzzy - think hotel TV from the 90s, others were zoomed in and looked horrible. Disney shuttle - while it's nice to have the option to have a Disney shuttle, this hotel is the last stop before Disney and was always, always packed. Get ready to stand almost on top of the bus door on your way to Disney each day. Not exactly safe.  Would love to see breakfast for SPG members.
Manager Response: We'll definitely review these comments with the management team and owners and thank you for this valuable feedback. Best, The Sheraton team

Summary Heading: Perfect hotel for a Disney trip
Summary: This hotel was the perfect place to stay for a Disneyland trip. I stayed here with my two young sons. The hotel was very clean and the staff was welcoming. We used the shuttle to and from Disneyland. It was always on time and picked us up and dropped is off right in front of the park entrance. There was no need for a car. We walked to the Target across the street to get snacks and bottled water. The only thing I wish they had was a refrigerator in the room to keep the bottled water cold, and our snacks cold. One ice bucket just did not do the trick. We did use the pool. It was small, but the hot tub was nice. The restaurant was very reasonably priced for a hotel. We ate breakfast here. The kids loved the Mickey pancakes! I would definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: This is terrific to hear. We do love our location, close to shopping, and many national restaurant chains such as Joe's Crab Shack and Outback steakhouse.  Very best,  The Sheraton team

Summary Heading: How do they find such great staff?
Summary: We stayed at this wonderful  hotel for 5 nights and we were uniformly pleased with every staff member  we encountered. How does  this hotel  get such friendly, helpful  staff? We enjoyed  the  breakfasts  and evening appetizers in the club level lounge  and  would  advise to pay for the upgrade.  Used the washers and dryer for laundry, enjoyed swimming  in the  outdoor  pool, and worked out in the  exercise room. Every amenity was clean and worked great. Highly recommend this Sheraton!
Manager Response: We apologize for the delayed response, however are thrilled with this review! We do think we have the best team around and are proud to be in the top 15% of all Sheraton's in North America for our customer service.  Very best regards,  The team at Garden Grove

Summary: I stayed here for a convention at the Anaheim Convention Center and it was very nice, especially considering some of the closer hotels (real dated and dirty). You are only about 1.5 miles from the convention center and Disney with frequent shuttle service. Traffic is bad in the area so the short ride may take you 30 minutes at times. The hotel is relatively new and in good condition. The rooms are large, comfortable, and very clean.  It is surrounded by chain restaurants (Red Robin, Outback, Oggi's, Joe's Crab Shack) and some other brand name hotels, plus a Target across the street if you forgot something. The restaurant isn't great but service was excellent. I would recommend walking to the Hyatt a short walk away and eat/ drink at the OC Brewhouse in the lobby.  Staff were
Manager Response: We do love our location walking distance to some great restaurants and shopping too! We appreciate the review and look forward to many returns. The team at Garden Grove

Summary: Back again for the 4th time at the Sheraton Garden Grove. We frequent Disneyland from San Diego and it's always a wonderful stay at this hotel!  Michaela from the front desk was very friendly and welcoming. We appreciate that! The club level room is worth it---good appetizers in the afternoon and an even better hot breakfast. Room was clean as usual with comfy beds and lots of pillows. I just wish that required SPG points stayed the same but, oh well. We'll keep coming back!
Manager Response: We love our friends to the South in San Diego! We appreciate the high praise and look forward to being of service again and again. Very best, The Sheraton team

Summary Heading: One of the better hotels in the area
Summary: The location of this hotel is good if you want to stay near Disneyland but a little further from all the crowd. There are also a few restaurants and bars around the hotel that are open fairly late so there's stuff to do here too. Here's a shuttle twice an hour to Disneyland too. The amenities are what you'd expect from a Sheraton and the rooms seem relatively new. I gave it five stars because the Sheraton club in this hotel was great and allowed me to get a bunch of work done at the workstation there while having a free breakfast.
Manager Response: This is terrific news! Many guests do like the upgrade to the Club level for the hot breakfast and the state of the art complimentary workstations there and in the lobby. And we love our location too, close to many restaurants, Target and a short shuttle ride to the parks. Best regards,  The Sheraton team

Summary: Stayed a Friday night. The rooms were nice size and clean. The hallways though look like they need to be updated, felt like it was 1993 all over again.   The staff was good, Sheena from the restaurant was the only one that really stood out to me. Seemed like she was busy, but still served me in a timely fashion and was very friendly and always smiling.
Manager Response: We appreciate the review and will certainly praise Sheena for her excellent service. We do expect to update the hotel in 2016. Best regards, The Sheraton team

Summary: This is a great hotel, easily walkable to Disneyland. Food options in the area abound, staff is friendly, and the hotel is easy to access. When using your GPS to find it, be sure to verify the address as there is another hotel with similar name that could get you there instead. A great experience! We'll be back.
Manager Response: We apologize for not replying sooner, and appreciate the high praise. Best regards, The team at Garden Grove

Summary: The food was amazing! I had breakfast lunch and dinner. Prices were on point as well.  First family vacation went smooth because of this hotel.  The 2 queen room as amazing!  My wife walked in and said it was huge, roomy, and clean.  It's hard to impress her lol.  There is a laundry room to do your own laundry.  Very quick process as I went to the gym in the next room.  The water dispenser wasn't working and the engineer came within 5 minutes to fix it.  The level or service is amazing.  You get your bang for your buck here.  The pull was busy and the lobby was flowing.  If you need amenities there is a Target across the street.  This was a perk as my kids needed some things for Disneyland the next day. I slept like a baby too :).  I will definitely come back to this property
Manager Response: We apologize for the delayed response, however greatly appreciate this amazing review of the hotel. We pride ourselves on service- we are currently ranked in the top 10% of all Sheraton's in North America. Best regards, The team at Garden Grove

Summary: The room was spacious, clean, and updated, the bed was comfortable, and the staff was friendly.  The main feature of this property is the location.  It is close to a lot of chain restaurants, has a shuttle to Disneyland, and is what you would expect from Sheraton.  Our stay was short, so I didn't get to try all the amenities, but I would highly recommend this property for anyone visiting Disneyland.  The only complaint I had was the cost of parking, when it is in an open lot, and far from secure or in good condition.  I would rather pay for covered parking.
Manager Response: We appreciate the recommendation! Most of the hotels in the area charge a parking fee or resort fee so be sure to check before booking. Typically the closer to the parks the higher the cost. Best regards, The Sheraton team

Summary: My first stay at a Sheraton and I must admit it was pretty decent.  Typically I stay at Marriotts because I have platinum elite status there, but this was a work event so I had no control.  The rooms and bathrooms were very spacious with comfortable beds.  The fitness center was also bigger than most and the included breakfast was surprisingly very good.  While I wouldn’t put it on par with a regular Marriott, it was much nicer than a courtyard, springhill, residence, etc. and any of the Hilton equivalents.   If your traveling thru or going to Disney, this is a nice place and very reasonable.  My only complaints would be dim lighting and there isn’t an outlet next to the bed to plug in a cell phone.
Manager Response: We sure appreciate the thorough review and recommendation! We're planning a remodel next year and will certainly take a look at the lighting and outlets. Best regards, The team at Garden Grove

Summary: To be fair, I want it to be known that this was a 3rd party booking (H**wire). I have had about 20 reservations through this 3rd party with exceeded expectations almost every time. I suppose that it is the law of averages that I would finally get "H**wired" (being treated as less important than guests that booked directly with the hotel). We booked two rooms with 6 guests and were given two rooms that each had single king beds. Yes, that is two beds for 6 guests. H**wire promises to provide a room that can accommodate the number of guests listed, although the type of room and type of bed is not guaranteed. If Sheraton agrees to do business through this 3rd party, it is reasonable to assume that they agree to abide by that promise. An item to note is that these rooms are smaller
Manager Response: We are sorry we couldn't accommodate the room type on this occasion. 95% of the time we can, except over high demand periods.
