Manager Response: This is great to hear! We appreciate the kind words. Best regards, The team at Garden Grove

Summary: My husband and I traveled to southern CA to attend our son's wedding. We stayed 3 nights and had a very nice stay. It was centrally located near stores to pick up last minutes things. The room was very nice and comfortable and clean. The staff were friendly and helpful. We got a full breakfast each morning with the price of the room and the food was good. Overall a very nice property.
Manager Response: Congratulations on this wonderful event! We're so happy to receive such high praise.  Best regards, The Sheraton team

Summary: This is a rather new hotel in the area.  It is not walking distance to Disneyland but it is not that far away.  Also for a nominal charge you can get opt for the hotel shuttle to the parks.  The rooms are fantastic, very modern, clean and enjoyable.  The staff were quick to check us in and ensured our stay was comfortable for the entire trip.  They always greeted us as we came in and out of the hotel.  If you bring a car there is a parking fee by the day - This is a normal charge in the Disney resort area and is worth the cost to ensure you get a parking spot for the night.  Overall this is a Fantastic hotel.
Manager Response: Well this is certainly great to hear! We appreciate the recommendation and kind words about the staff here. We'll make sure to post these comments for them to read. Best regards, The Sheraton team

Summary: We stayed here for 2 nights and as SPG members were given access to club lounge. The breakfast and dinner served in the club was wonderful. Our room was very comfortable with all the amenities we needed. It was clean and the bedding was very nice. The staff we encountered were very helpful and pleasant. Shuttle to Disneyland was $3 per person round-trip and ran every 30 minutes. Overall a great property and would highly recommend.
Manager Response: This is terrific news! We appreciate the kind words and recommendations. We look forward to being of service again! Best regards, The Sheraton team

Summary: We stayed here for a quick visit to Orange County.  As a Starwood member we were given a room on the members top floor.  We received the ADA unit which was huge with a wide entry and large restroom.  The room itself was quite large making the TV to the bed quite far away.  Maybe it felt that way because we just arrived from a typical small Tokyo hotel unit.  The bed was very comfortable.  The floor gets free wifi/internet.  The nice thing about the member floor is that they have AM and PM food in the community room along with computers and printers for printing boarding passes.  Mornings had eggs, sausages, potatoes, oatmeal, rolls and toast.  Evening pre-dinner snacks included chicken and cheeseburgers and a veg. and cheese plate.
Manager Response: We appreciate the detailed review and recommendation. Our guests do love our location and ease with which you can see all that the area has to offer. Best regards, The Sheraton team

Summary Heading: Good room, very friendly staff and a very welcome upgrade!
Summary: I stayed for three nights. It's a nice quick shuttle to disneyland, and as a Gold SPG member I was very grateful to be given an upgrade to a club room upon request. It made such a great difference. The room was very modern, clean and well appointed. The front desk staff were all very hospitable. My only feedback would be that the club lounge breakfast was cold by the time I ate, and it would be nice if it went beyond 930. Another comfy Sheraton bed and stay!
Manager Response: We appreciate the recommendation despite the issue with the Club breakfast, which we will address post haste. Best regards, The team at Garden Grove

Summary: Exactly what I expect from a Sheraton/Starwood property. The location is close to Disneyland but priced better than the closer hotels.  The shuttle service to the park is adequate.  The rooms were clean and comfortable.  I only give it 3 stars because the personnel were not as friendly as I've experienced with other Starwood hotels (member).  There was 1 food service member who was very nice and helpful.  Food and bar service were fair at best, the Club Room breakfast was adequate.  Wouldn't really say this is a romantic place however it was quiet and we went during Spring break and it was quite busy.  Satisfied and if we were to return to Disneyland this would be where I would choose to stay again.
Manager Response: We're sorry to hear that your experience wasn't as expected. We've had some terrific improvement in our customer service feedback so this is disappointing, however we'll certainly monitor closely and make improvements where we can. Best wishes, The Sheraton team

Summary: I was required to stay at this hotel over the past 8 months for a work seminar.  I have to say the best part of the hotel was the staff.  They were extremely nice and accommodating.    The location is ok... not much around and if you have a family going to Disney Land you will have to take the shuttle.    The rooms were clean.  Don't bother up-grading to the Club Suite.  The rooms are not any bigger and honestly breakfast and happy hour are not worth the price.  After staying there on 8 different occasions request room 513.  It is on the corner, has a fridge (not all rooms do) a safe and overall is quiet.    The breakfast buffet is not worth the price... if you eat in the restaurant just order off the menu... it will be cheaper.   I like that it is a smaller and it gives you
Manager Response: We appreciate the recommendation and comments for others to hear.  Best regards, The Sheraton team

Summary: I have stayed at this hotel twice, both times for Dinseyland. To be fair, the first time I stayed was awesome. This prompted us to come back to this hotel and the second time was worlds different. On arrival, we found a pair of mens sandals in the middle of the carpet of our room! I mean, really?? Did they even clean the floor? Its not like they were tucked under the bed! Otherwise, the first day was fine. The second day, we noticed that the beds were made and that there were towels but otherwise the floor was dirty and the bathroom had water splotches around the sink. We were tired and did not care, so we let it go. The third day, the floor was even filthier, the beds weren't made, the bathroom was still not clean, and instead of removing the old towels and replacing them with
Manager Response: We're certainly sorry to hear this as our cleanliness scores have actually improved recently. We'd like to get more feedback if we could so that we can pinpoint the team member, take corrective action, and would be grateful for a chance to make things right; our hotel manager is available any time at 714 703-8400.  Best regards, The Sheraton team

Summary Heading: Great Service and Always Ready to Help!
Summary: We were lucky enough to stay in the great facility again and due to some flight issues we were going to check in late. I called the front desk and asked them to hold me a room on the concierge (club level) rather then being moved to a different floor. (We have a 5 year old and the club lounge is a huge benefit so we always stay club level)  When I called the front desk agent was happy to accommodate us and she assured us it would be taken care of. When we check in at 9pm it was perfect! Great job again to the front desk team!!  When we are in Anaheim we will always stay here!
Manager Response: This is terrific to hear! We'll keep working to improve and appreciate the recommendation! All the best, The Sheraton team

Summary: Not much different from many other hotels this area but it does let itself down in some ways.  I don't mind paying for parking in the Disney area but paying for in room wifi is a bit much. I know the hotel offers free wifi in the lobby area but these days people want to use their tablets etc. in their own room.  The room was fine but had no "comfortable" chair to sit in. Bit of a pain.  The pool area is very small with just five or six loungers.  The bar is just a dead area that would be better served by being converted into a much needed coffee shop serving takeaway breakfast etc. I was one of many who made a morning trip to a nearby Starbucks to pick up a coffee and pastry given that the only way to get a take out breakfast in this hotel was via the on site restaurant (a
Manager Response: We appreciate the recommendations and will certainly work on those areas we can improve. We are sorry that it wasn't pointed out, but we do have a takeaway breakfast and full service Starbucks in our lounge in the mornings and apologize if that wasn't easily seen.  Best regards, The Sheraton team

Summary: My family enjoyed our stay, but we were not often in the room, as we were visitng Disneyland. The shuttle service was a bonus, but next time I would prefer to be within walking distance. The room was great. I booked a room online with a travel service. Unfortunately, the hotel was not able to extend a second night stay at the same lower price to me as the travel site and I changed hotels the next night. Other than the front desk, we never interacted with any of the staff.
Manager Response: We appreciate the recommendation. Best regards, The Sheraton team

Summary Heading: A little above average but not very good
Summary: Clean rooms, noisy hallways with all the Disney kids.  Very friendly staff.  The internet is $9.95 a day and parking is $12 a day.  The restaurant is very average at best.  Not a great bar scene.  The lobby shop is tiny.  Free Wall Street Journal and USA today.  Serves the purpose.
Manager Response: We will certainly look to improve where we can. Being in a resort area, most hotels do charge for parking and others have a 'resort fee' which includes the parking so best to call ahead when staying in this area. We do try to keep our fees lower than the rest, and do have a complimentary business center with free WIFI in the lobby. Best regards, The Sheraton team

Summary Heading: Not a bad stay... but not much else!
Summary: We have stayed in many many hotels near Disneyland over the years and I was not very impressed with this one. The room was clean and quiet, but there were absolutely no amenities we have become accustomed to enjoying when we stay... Wifi was NOT free, They charged extra for parking and the parking was terrible (too tight to drive through and too few spaces), the staff seemed minimal and not very friendly or helpful, worst of all there was no continental breakfast. Too many hotels in the area have been scooped up by Sheraton and I think they have cut their amenities and services and nickel and dime you with additional charges.
Manager Response: We appreciate the response and feedback and will work on those areas where we can improve. As a full service hotel that maintains a high quality restaurant and room service, state of the art fitness center, complimentary hi-tech business center, we do, like other full service hotels in the area, have fees for some services. Most hotels in the area do charge for parking- ours is much less than others closer to the Parks, for example. Best regards, The Sheraton team

Summary: From the front drive team to housekeeping, everyone was wonderful! My room was clean and comfy. The hot water and water pressure were beyond compare. The food was great. This is the only hotel I stay in when I visit California.
Manager Response: We are thankful for the high praise will definitely pass along these comments to the team here. Very best regards, The Sheraton team

Summary: We booked this hotel through Priceline bidding and were able to secure a rate of $90 a night over our spring break. It was a great stay compared to the other hotels we found.   Downsides were shuttle wait times (45 min one day) and paying for parking.  Most of the lot is taken up by valet service so we were forced to park in overflow parking one day.  As we were parking, some random guy was walking through the "lot" with his Target bags. It did not give us a feeling of security. Parking is $12 a day. The one day we had to wait for the Disney shuttle it was actually free because we were unable to purchase our Disney tickets from the front desk that day (there wasn't a manager around to assist us). After waiting 45 minutes we decided to drive. Apparently this hotel is the third
Manager Response: We appreciate the recommendation and will certainly look to improve where we can. We have demanded better service from our shuttle partner and they have increased the service schedule during this busier than expected Spring break.  Best regards, The Sheraton team

Summary Heading: Fine, but next time will stay closer so I can walk if necessary!
Summary: I made and paid for this reservation on Priceline, after agreeing to pay a set price for any hotel rated with at least 3 ½ stars. When it told me Sheraton (after I paid) I thought I knew which hotel it was, but turns out there are at least three Sheraton’s in the Disneyland area. This one was on Harbor across from Target - convenient if you’ve forgotten something, but a fair ways from the park. Certainly too far to walk with the six-year-old that I was traveling with.  On the plus side, at least regarding transportation, the shuttle was free – no tickets needed (the hotel issues a pass for the duration of your stay). On the bad side, as this Sheraton is pretty much the last one in the chain of hotels on Harbor, in the morning hours the shuttle must have filled up before reaching
Manager Response: We appreciate the detailed response and will certainly look to make improvements where noted. Our shuttle partner did have some difficulties that weekend, and have since added more shuttles to account for the higher Spring Break volume. Typically our guests prefer to stay farther from the crowds closer to the parks and avoid the parking fees there and long walks from parking.  The hot tub is fully repaired and inspected by the health inspector. We do apologize for the issues and appreciate the opportunity to improve. Best regards, The Sheraton team

Summary: The hotel was pretty good- the rooms very clean and tidy. We had breakfast buffet which was good as well. The only issue is the parking- they charge $12 a day for parking- there is very few self parking spots. The valet service is complimentary but there was just 1 guy working hard to get all the cars in and out and we had to wait quite a bit to get our car. I would have expected free parking in the first place but other than that a very comfortable place.
Manager Response: We appreciate the kind words and will certainly work on the parking and valet availability.  Very best, The Sheraton team

Summary: My family and I recently stay at the hotel during a weekend at Disneyland. This was our second stay at the hotel and it again far exceeded my expectation. Staff was great and the rooms were spotless. I would stay again at the hotel.
Manager Response: This is great to hear! We certainly appreciate the high praise and recommendation. The Sheraton team

Summary: Stayed here in late Feb 2014 during a 5 day visit to Disneyland. The rooms were very comfortable. Beds awesome.  Good size room. You could here noise from the ajoining room but after a day of pure walking we were all asleep in minutes. We are platinum members so the continental breakfast is a great start to the day. The pool was fun for the kids. We did purchase the shuttle to/from Disneyland. It was a bit of a disappointment in the morning. It is the last stop of 3 places so it was always full. We ended up walking 1.6 miles one morning. Which was fine for parents but the extra steps for kids was not so good. We always got on the shuttle at the end of the day but it was very crowded. The second day we tried walking to the 2nd stop to get on the shuttle there and that worked the
Manager Response: We appreciate the feedback and 4 star rating despite the trouble with the shuttle. We'll work with our shuttle partner to make improvements post haste! Best regards, The Garden Grove team

Summary: I would have rated this hotel higher had the service been better.  However, the staff lacked any sort of training.   Check in was a bit of a mess... they spoke to me as if I was a novice traveler.... if they had looked at my profile they would have seen I am a current Platinum guest and I am a lifetime Gold member with SPG.  The room was fine... comfortable, clean, and quiet... the service was amateur.  Would I stay here again?   If there was nothing else in the area or if I did not mind bad customer care.
Manager Response: We appreciate the chance to improve. Our SPG recognition has actually improved greatly this year, so this was unfortunate to hear. We have reviewed this with our management team and will work hard to do more training so this won't happen again. Best regards, The Sheraton team

Summary: After a 30 hour trip to get to Anaheim for a conference I got into the hotel a few hours before the official check in time but the front desk staff bent over backwards to get me in to my room as quickly as possible, one of my colleagues staying at the other hotel next door was told to wait four hours. I also had some parcels to send and receive by Fed Ex and yet again the front desk staff helped me out there doing all they could to check up on the progress. I was happy with my room and the price was value for money on the club floor with the added extras included, yet again my colleague next door paid more and didn't get the breakfast, drinks and internet extras included I got staying at the Sheraton. Location was fine, not too far from the convention center and plenty of
Manager Response: This is great to hear! We appreciate the kind words and will certainly commend the staff. Best regards, The team at Garden Grove

Summary: The rate and proximity to Disney, plus the shuttle service, made this an okay stay. However several things made this well below other Sheratons I've stayed at.  1. The valet station was *always* unmanned. I would have to wait 5-15 minutes for someone to assist me, after going to the front desk to ask for help. Even when I had a crying baby in my arms, the front desk person had to go behind the doors 3 times to ask the valet person to hurry up and help me.   2. I chose the "going green" option at checkin. At every other Sheraton I've stayed at, this option means the sheets and towels are not changed. At this Sheraton, it means NO room service at all. So we had trash cans overflowing, no making the bed, no vacuuming the floor, etc. I'm not sure how not having someone at least make
Manager Response: Well we certainly are sorry for the issues this stay; our customer service scores have improved greatly recently. We do appreciate the feedback and will work with the management team to make improvements where we can. As far as the Make a Green Choice program, it is a company standard that opting in means no service at all- that is why the 500 point exchange is so generous, as you would have to spend $500 to earn that many points otherwise. Best regards, The Sheraton team

Summary: I've stayed at this property 4 times in the last couple of years. Every time I come back it loses some of its luster, as the property is not being well maintained. The price however is usually the best around unless you are looking to stay in a motel. The walls and carpets have taken a beating and seem to need more and more help every time I come. The furniture also seems to be taking a beating, although it be fairly new; again not well maintained. The staff for the most part is excellent. I've only had one incident where the female manager didn't follow through as she stated, so other than her great staff. The staff, location, 24 hour pool, and of course price are what keeps us coming back. I have one big gripe with Sheraton, not specific to this hotel, they allow dogs of all
Manager Response: We appreciate the detailed review and will certainly make improvements where we can. And much thanks for commending the staff and service.  We are a pet friendly brand and do try to keep pet rooms on certain floors/areas. We are sorry there was an issue last visit; guests with pets (unless they don't tell us) sign a waiver that says they won't leave pets unattended in the rooms. Best regards, The Sheraton team

Summary: We stayed here on our trip to Disneyland.  The most accommodating front desk staff!  I believe it was Minh and Randall who were so helpful to us with a credit card issue.  My bank had put a fraud hold on my card and it made checking in so difficult.  They were so helpful in working with me to get a hold of my bank and get an authorization emailed to my husband to use his debit card.  They printed our flight itinerary for us as well.   We stayed on the Club level and I highly recommend booking a club level rate.  We loved the Club room and the unlimited water/soda available and evening snacks.  The breakfast was pretty good, as well.  We could see the Disney fireworks at night and our room was clean and comfortable.  The beds were very comfortable.  We had free internet with our
Manager Response: This is great to hear! We appreciate the recommendation and will certainly commend the staff. Best regards, The Sheraton team

Summary: My really enjoyed my stay at this Sheraton.  Staff was so welcoming when I checked in and every time I passed by the front desk I was greeted.  They have shuttle service to Disneyland which is $3 a day for each pass, but you can get a $15 a day package which includes parking, internet in room and shuttle to Disneyland.  That's a great deal especially since parking is $12 anyways.  Parking does fill up, but not a big deal as others on this site have stated since you get free valet if the lot is full.  This hotel is the last hotel in the disneyland "strip"so you don't get the crowds which is great, and you get a huge Target across the street.  The hotel and room is fairly new so it's clean and comfortable.  The washroom is huge and I love how it's just a shower, no tub.  There's
Manager Response: Terrific recommendations! Many thanks for taking the time to write about us. The team at the Sheraton Garden Grove

Summary: Booked this hotel for 3 nights. It's not a big Sheraton hotel, more like a sister hotel. In comparison...it's like a Hilton Garden Inn- not quite the Hilton, but carries the same company name.   It's clean, but noticed carpets had some dirt stains on it in my room and in the hallways. I'm fairly picky with where I stay- I prefer rooms that have an updated look, clean bathrooms and beds look comfy. This had that, although bed was a bit stiff for my comfort. Housekeeping did a good job of tidying the room. It's a no frills kind of place, more suitable for business trips. They have two arcade games and a pool, but didn't utilize either. Their gift shop has cute Disney stuff and apparently the hotel just made the list for Disneylands good neighbor hotels. Shuttle to Disneyland is
Manager Response: We appreciate the recommendations and do try to keep our fees and rates at or below our competition. And we are a Disney Good Neighbor hotel and do sell tickets here! Best regards, The Sheraton team

Summary: My family and I stayed here a little over a week ago, and were very impressed. The moment we walked in everyone had smiles on their faces and were very welcoming. Carol at the front desk assisted us and was awesome. A few days into our stay we called down for towels and they called to make sure we got our towels, I have never stayed at a hotel before that has done that. Overall our experience at the Sheraton Garden Grove was unreal. Thank you to the staff for making it very memorable. We hope to be back there soon.
Manager Response: This is great to hear! We'll certainly commend Carol and the team. Our aim is to please. Best regards and look forward to being of service again and again. The team at Garden Grove

Summary Heading: Service was above and beyond. Could not have asked for better experience.
Summary: My family of 5 just returned from Disneyland after staying at this hotel. On our last day, after we'd checked out, my daughter got sick on the bus, after my son had also gotten sick leaving the park. With 2 sick kids and a 7 hour car ride ahead of us, the situation was grim. The hotel staff, especially Luisa, went out of their way to help us. They let us back into our room to take a shower, even though housekeeping would need to clean the room twice and they were very understanding as the kids laid on the couches in the lobby, asking what they could do to help.   With the shuttle service convenience I'd stay at the hotel again. From the other reviews I was concerned about the shuttle service promptness but the shuttle turned out to be very prompt. Over 4 days we rode the shuttle
Manager Response: This is great news! We'll congratulate Luisa, the team here, and our Shuttle partner. Best regards, The Sheraton team

Summary: We arrived around 10:30 PM. Tired and hungry after a long day traveling. We asked about a place to eat we could walk to, were told all places close at11:00. Then one of the desk staff took us over to the bar just off the lobby. It closed at 11:00 as well, however, Matthew, the food and beverage manager offered us a short menu option he was wiling to provide. So, despite the fact his staff was ready to go home they made us a great bowl of tortilla soup. Great service. We stayed three nights and all the staff was very pleasant and helpful. Only complaint was pillows. I know small thing, but......cannot sleep without one. Told front desk at check out and he said, "You should have requested firmer ones!" Wow, that easy. My own fault. Easy shuttle ride to Disneyland. We will
Manager Response: We appreciate the excellent recommendation and look forward to being of service again. We'll certainly congratulate Matt and the rest of the team. Best regards, The Sheraton team

Summary: Its unfortunate that a hotel liked by so many have became poor at customer service, even with their top tiered, Platinum members.  I prefer the top floor, bed type almost matters least.  I called the hotel about 4 hours before checking in at 8:00 PM one night in February.  I was told that there's a room for me, on the top floor, with two beds.  I was by myself on business and didn't mind the bed type but it is crucial to be on the top floor.  I was happy at first after the woman over the phone assured me there's a room for me.  Too good to be true.  Once showed up at the hotel, another women at front desk (possible the same one answered the phone) told me it wasn't possible.  The room either wasn't assigned to me or was unavailable to begin with.  So why would someone at front
Manager Response: We appreciate the opportunity to improve. We'll conduct some further training with our team, as no complimentary upgrades are to be confirmed in advance. Per Starwood requirements we are never to confirm before check-in time. 95% of the time we are able to accommodate all of our Platinum guests with complimentary upgrades, however we can only confirm in advance those that pay a small fee in advance. All the guidelines can be  found on the Starwood SPG website. Best regards, The Sheraton team

Summary: I reserved this room when visiting Disneyland. Nice, clean, comfortable room and hotel at a decent price for the area.   The shuttle was a bonus. Check in/out went smoothly. Paid parking was easy. Target was across the street, making it easy to pick up a few items for Disneyland. There were other nearby (walking distance) restuarants nearby.
Manager Response: We appreciate the recommendation and look forward to many returns. Best wishes, The team at Garden Grove

Summary Heading: nice, clean property with shuttle service to DL
Summary: I stayed at this hotel while visiting the Disneyland. The hotel is very clean and well managed. They offer you a shuttle service to DL, 3$/day. During the first day, the shuttle was 30 mins late and when I complained to the front desk after I returned from the park, they apologized for the inconvenience, refunded the shuttle fee and gave me access to the club lounge. I was very pleased with the service and customer relation. Will stay again
Manager Response: We send our thanks for taking the time to recommend us here. We are grateful to be in such a great location close to restaurants and shopping, while being only a short shuttle ride to the parks. Best regards, The Sheraton team

Summary Heading: Great place to stay would absolutely stay again
Summary: First time staying here I used my Starwood points and had a wonderful time. Celebrated my daughters 16th bday at Disneyland on New Years Eve. Of course it's hectic and always expect snags of some sort, but the check in was great, parking not a problem at all. The staff was some of the nicest people I have ever encountered in my travels. The shuttle fee for Disneyland was waived for all 4 of us for 3 days that's a 36.00 savings, I didn't have to ask it was just offered to me(refreshing). Nightly parking fee was 12.00 a night which is not out of line for California standards(I've paid more at other hotels) Rooms were great with very comfy bedding and beds. Very clean and the bathroom was pretty spacious, ordered room service food was delicious & still hot. Thank you to the staff
Manager Response: We appreciate the high praise and will certainly recognize the team here. Our customer service scores have improved significantly this past year and we look to build on that in the coming year. Very best regards, The Sheraton team

Summary Heading: Excellent Staycation or alternate Disney Hotel option
Summary: GM Chris and his exception team of employees like Martha, Dennisse, and Sally just to name several are so committed to customer service. The property is newer and well maintained. The health club is nice. The outside pool and spa are maintained at great temperatures. There is a regular shuttle to Disneyland. One suggestion is to drive 8 minutes to downtown ORANGE and see a quaint downtown with loads of antique stores, nice shopping, even an authentic Soda Shop.  If you stay at this Sheraton I think you'll be very pleased with accommodation. It's a tad less money than hotels touch Disney or across the street. The property has good dining on site. You can also walk next door to Cocos, Joes or Outback. And there's even a Target across the street. So you have wonderful options.
Manager Response: We're very pleased to receive such excellent comments about the hotel here, but mostly about the staff. We'll be sure to congratulate the team and look forward to more return trips! The team at Garden Grove

Summary: I booked this hotel as this is very close to Disneyland. Hotel is very decent, clean and has all the amenities. Rooms are spacious and comfortable. Hotel offers frequent shuttle service to Disneyland at a nominal charge that makes it very convenient. Location of this hotel makes is a good choice overall.
Manager Response: We do enjoy our location, close enough to the parks, and convenient walking distance to dining and shopping.  Best regards, The Sheraton team

Summary: Stayed here while attending Disneyland. Nice, somewhat older hotel with friendly and helpful staff.  Located on Harbor Blvd. about 1.5 miles from Disneyland (also on Harbor Blvd.), their shuttles were very convenient and the drivers were very helpful and accommodating.
Manager Response: We appreciate the recommendation! Best regards, The Garden Grove team

Summary Heading: Great value, as good as a Westin
Summary: I booked this hotel on my drive from the airport. I liked the room a lot. Carpet had a few stains but that can easily be fixed. Room was spacious. Close to Disneyland, although that was not the purpose of our visit.  I Did not like that parking was a separate charge, why can't it be comp'd for hotel guests? It would help set you apart.. The excuse that all the hotels close by do the same is not a valid one.
Manager Response: Many of our guests do mistake us for a Westin as we cater to business travellers as well as leisure Theme park visitors. Our elegant lobby with marble floors, 24 hour complimentary business center, Fitness and pool are just some of the reasons a wide variety of guests enjoy the hotel. We'll review the parking fees to ensure that ours are reasonable and at or below the area averages. Due to limited parking in the area most hotels do charge for parking and even the limited service hotels are now beginning to charge as well. Best regards, The Sheraton team

Summary: This is a typical Sheraton property with friendly and efficient service.  The staff is well trained and the property appears to be safe and clean.  The rooms are very nice with comfortable beds, but my room had some stains on the comforters and carpets, and the towels were frayed on the edges.  My stay coincided with a company's holiday party, so parking was a big challenge.  There are many choices due to the close proximity to Disneyland, but this is a safe choice that you cannot go wrong with.
Manager Response: We appreciate the candor and kind words of recommendation. We'll work on the areas mentioned and look forward to a return trip.  Best regards, The team at Garden Grove

Summary: Stayed last week for 3 nights and we were very happy. Rooms are super clean, hotel looks almost brand new and the staff was pretty knowledgeable. The Disney Shuttle worked great and the drivers were very helpful. Close to food and drink and we tried a few of them. As am SPG member, I was impressed.
Manager Response: We appreciate the recommendation! We are the newest hotel in the entire area and our service scores rank very highly amongst all Sheraton's.  Best regards, The Sheraton team

Summary: This is my first stay at the Sheraton in Garden Grove as part of a conference.  One day down and two to go.  Here is a quick review of the most important items:  CHECK IN: What a breeze! I arrived a little early for checkin, and the clerk made some changes that allowed me to check in right away.  I was at the front desk for only five minutes.  The clerk was very friendly and welcoming, which is an important first step.  ELEVATORS/LOBBY/ LOBBY RESTROOMS:  The lobby restrooms were very modern and clean.  In regards to the elevators, they too were functioning and clean.  In addition, the overall cleanliness of the lobby was outstanding, and the decor was pleasant.   ROOMS:  I have a standard room with a view of the nearby businesses.  The room was exceptional; modern feel and
Manager Response: We appreciate the excellent recommendations and look forward to being of service in the future! Very best regards, The Sheraton Garden Grove team

Summary: We had the opportunity to enjoy another three night stay at this hotel for our bi monthly Disney trip from Las Vegas.  We did have a minor challenge with out late check in (10:59 pm) but a call to the front desk in the morning made it perfect thanks to Luis.  We again stayed on club level and the breakfast and amenities were perfect. The younger employee in the club level did an amazing job in making sure everything was taken care of.   We have to say that we have made this hotel our first choice anytime we visit Anaheim.  Would rather pay more to stay here then anywhere else.
Manager Response: This is certainly great to hear; we love our friends from Nevada! Thank you for the recommendation and we look forward to recognizing the staff mentioned and many returns. Best wishes for a terrific holiday, The Sheraton team

Summary: We did enjoy our stay. Disneyland is just a hop, skip and a jump away. Very kid friendly and clean. It is an officially part of the disney hotels and the staff was very friendly. Parking was a little cramped but could have just been that it was a holiday weekend. Would definitely stay there again.
Manager Response: We appreciate the recommendation and look forward to a return trip! Parking can be difficult in the Anaheim Resort area and we do our best to accommodate all our guests and will keep working to improve! Best regards, The Garden Grove team

Summary: We got to Anaheim every year and stayed at several locations around Disney.  I'll sum up: Front Desk Service:  5 stars. The guys at check in set the bar in customer service. Club Lounge: I used some points to upgrade us to the club lounge. We don't do this much, but for this trip we were satisfied with the daily hot breakfast, and drinks and snacks in the evening. 5 Stars. Maid Service: We took the green option. They gave us a $5 dollar voucher for every  day we skipped service. This paid for a lunch at the onsite restaurant.  5 stars  Shuttle Service: This is where I knock them down to a total of 4 stars on this review. The website led me to believe they had their OWN shuttle, but you paid for it. I didn't mind paying. However, the shuttle was shared with 2 other hotels.  I did
Manager Response: We appreciate the 4 star review and recommendation despite the issues with the shuttle. Many guests do enjoy the shuttle ride versus the parking fees and long walks at the parks themselves. We do share shuttle with one other hotel; otherwise it is a direct route versus the local buses which stop at every bus stop along the way.

Summary: I just spent five days at this hotel travelling down for a ball tournament.  The hotel is good I thought the front desk and restaurant staff to be very friendly. The room was spacious. It is in a very convenient location. A short shuttle ride to Disney. 5 minutes from a big out let mall. Target across the street and many restaurants within walking distance. Very quick highway access from here.
Manager Response: Many guests do enjoy the easy access to the 22 or the 5 without having to battle the Disney area traffic, in addition to walking distance restaurants such as Outback steakhouse, Joe's Crab Shack and our local favorite Oggies! Best regards, The Garden Grove team

Summary Heading: Great room but couple of areas need improving
Summary: We drove in late from Disneyland and Minh was very kind and helpful with getting us directions to the hotel. As we were driving into the parking lot, an suv with Nevada plates sped up fast behing us and drove in very fast and did donuts in the parking lot. (which has nothing to do with the hotel and was quite strange but amusing at the same time. We get checked in, but we were not asked what kind of bed we would prefer. We have 2 adults and 2 children with us. We find our room and the guests who did the donuts in the parking lot asked us if we had any beer in our room.  We find that our room has only one bed :/ We turn off the lights to go to sleep and then there is this flashing light coming into the room, about every 5 seconds. It turned out to be the smoke alarm. I didn't
Manager Response: We appreciate the recommendation despite the issues encountered. We are typically a very quiet hotel as we have a good mix of corporate and leisure guests, as we are not right next to the parks. We look forward to seeing you again, The Sheraton team

Summary: How can anyone not like this hotel? The only thing we can figure is they didn't speak to the front desk about them. This is an excellent hotel for visiting Disney or for business. Rocio and Julio at the front desk are the kindest sweetest people to deal with, even when we had an issue. They handled it immediately. Breakfast is wonderful and handled grandly by Pablo. The fitness center is excellent. It is too far to go to Disney. We will definitely be back whenever in the area.
Manager Response: We appreciate the kind words and will certainly recognize the staff mentioned. We look forward to many returns. The Sheraton team

Summary: I recently had a chance to stay at this property during a trip to Disneyland. It is excellent value, and a hidden gem. I was particularly pleased with the services offered by Minh and Luis whose customer service and alert attention made our stay very pleasurable. Will be back and strongly recommended.
Manager Response: We appreciate the recommendation and will certainly commend Luis and Minh for a job well done. Look forward to many returns! The Sheraton team

Summary: Was there for 2 nights. Got a room booked with  free continental breakfast. Little away from the happening places but as the purpose was to see the Disneyland it was okay. A paid shuttle is available at every 30 mins from morning to Disneyland. Rooms are good; neither big nor small. Breakfast was average. Bathroom amenities are good. plenty of good places to  eat outside if you explore. Take away from Pizza Hut  is walking distance. You can buy daily needs from across the road supermarket.
Manager Response: We do enjoy our location walking distance to shopping and many dining options, and do try to stay very competitive with our rates, despite being the newest hotel in the area. Best regards, The Sheraton team

Summary: We stayed 3 nights while on vacation celebrating our daughter's 3rd birthday. We were happy with the room. Lots of space, clean and pretty comfortable beds. On arrival, I mentioned that it was my daughter's birthday and on the second night, they surprised us with cake. Unfortunately, at this point she was a sleeping beauty and did not get the cake but we made arrangements for them to come back the next night. I thought that this was a very nice personal touch that should get above and beyond recognition. I liked that this was the first pick up for the shuttle and we didn't have to stand on bus. I do wish that they had breakfast included, that would have made this hotel 5 stars for me.
Manager Response: We are very glad to have made a difference and will certainly congratulate the team. Best wishes, The Garden Grove team

Summary: This Sheraton is more like a best western or holiday inn, much more simple than a Sheraton resort property. The service was good as well as the location. I can't really complain about it, I just felt that it wasn't as nice as a typical Sheraton. The pool was small as was the lobby. There was no free wifi, and breakfast was not included. Close enough to Disneyland that you can see the fireworks at night in the summer. Just not a resort.
Manager Response: Our guests do love our location, and close proximity to restaurants and shopping. While we remain the newest hotel in the area, we are built to accommodate both our leisure travellers and business travellers alike. Many guests enjoy the complimentary business center, LINK experience by Microsoft and our 24 hours Fitness center powered by Core Performance and pool/jacuzzi. Best regards, The Sheraton team

Summary Heading: Valet took my car for joyride!
Summary: I checked in around midnight on Friday, the parking lot was full so there was a mandatory valet. I never saw my car again until I checked out around noon Sunday at which time I notice something wasn't right my car had a quarter of a tank of extra gas in it as well as around a hundred extra miles on the odometer! I immediately brought this to the manager working (Martha ) who told me she was so sorry and it would be taken car of immediately and she would contact me after she reviewed cameras and interrogated the valet on staff. The following Monday I had not heard back so I called to see what was going on this time I spoke with Denise who assured me that the Sheridan was in the process of investigating the situation and would get back to me as soon as It was resolved. I was
Manager Response: We apologize that we couldn't take responsibility for this, as we could find no real proof other than the guests word. We valet thousands of cars a year and have never had an issue reported like this one. We reviewed all the cameras that we do have, time cards, and entry/exit gate records, and interviewed every staff member and there is no clear proof that this could have happened. Our staff member would have to have to have disappeared for over 2 hours with a manager on duty 24 hours. Please read all the other reviews on TripAdvisor and any other site and it is clear that this is not an issue here. Thank you and best regards, The Sheraton team

Summary: We have probably stayed at this location at least 10 times so far and each and every time they are spot on the service! From the Club level to check in they always go above and beyond to make our stay perfect!
Manager Response: Well this is certainly great to hear; we'll be sure to recognize the staff and continue to improve as we can! We look for ward to many returns. Very best regards, The entire Garden Grove team

Summary: This lovely Sheraton, in the so-called “International West Resort District” of Garden Grove, caters largely to the Disneyland tourist trade.  Therefore, among my fellow guests, the purpose of my 11 night stay in September 2013 was very unusual.  I was paying a “medical tourism” visit, having flown out from New York for rehabilitative therapy treatments under the aegis of the Whitaker Wellness Institute in Newport Beach.  Upon checking in, I apprised the desk clerk why I was visiting Orange County, and I said I would appreciate being assigned to a quiet room.  For my purposes, the one he selected — on the sixth floor — was excellent.  Not only was it surprisingly spacious, but the color scheme was just right:  pleasingly subdued and soothing.  Even the framed photo hanging in the
Manager Response: Our best wishes for a continued recovery and a bright future. We appreciate the high praise and will congratulate the team for their friendliness and service. Very best regards from the entire Garden Grove team

Summary: First, let me say we are seasoned travelers and have enjoyed many Sheratons over the years. This one however, was a huge nightmare.  With the exception of two employees this location has the most untrained and inexperienced staff we've ever seen.  Our first night, against our better judgement, we went to eat in the restaurant that had zero patrons in it. The bar tender was inexperienced and didn't know how to pour a scotch and soda, the steak meal was ordered medium rare, but was served well done, and it took over 40 minutes to get the food. The pool and spa had algae in it, the room smelled like stale smoke even though it is a non-smoking property. The gift shop was rarely open, but they did TRY to find someone that could open it for me. I wanted a newspaper and a soda. I was
Manager Response: We are certainly sorry to hear we missed the mark for this visit. Our customer service scores have actually improved dramatically this year and we are currently rated in the top third of all Sheraton's in North America, so again, we are sorry we didn't come through this time.  Our guests do enjoy the hot breakfast in the Club lounge, and we are working to improve the  hors d' oeuvres in the evening. Our appreciation for the feedback; we can't improve without it.  Very best regards, The Sheraton team

Summary Heading: Great hotel, not a fan of the restaurant
Summary: We just returned from our vacation at this hotel.  Stayed for 4 nights.  Used the shuttle to go to Disneyland which was easy enough to take both ways.  The rooms were great, staffing was always very polite, and they would valet our car for free for us when parking in normal lot was full.  Linens were very nice, and the mattress made you sleep warm.  We booked a room with two queen mattresses and we had two adults and 4 kids under the age of 12. They said they weren't allowed to bring a rollaway bed due to fire code.  I had a feeling about this so I'm glad we had an air mattress with us for my oldest daughter.  If there was anything I would discourage using at this hotel it is the restaurant.  When we went down for breakfast there was no one at the desk to seat us, and no sign
Manager Response: We certainly appreciate the excellent score despite the restaurant service. We will definitely make sure to take a look at our staffing there. Our guests do love the 'Sweet Sleeper' bed and all white bedding with comforter/duvet and high thread count sheets. See you again soon!  Best regards, The Sheraton team

Summary: Stayed a week and luckily my company discount got me access to the club level which was really nice. Room is comfortable, club lounge is nice and offers free breakfast, afternoon snacks (which can be enough for a light dinner), something to drink all day, TV, a PC. The hotel internet was average, slower than I would have hoped for the wired. Overall a great stay.
Manager Response: This is great news! We appreciate the recommendation and will take a look at that internet speed on the Club level. The Sheraton team

Summary Heading: Amazing hotel - but don't rely too heavily on the shuttle!
Summary: I absolutely loved this hotel. We took the kids (7 and 9) to Disneyland/California Adventure last week and chose this hotel because it seemed like it would be a good fit for us. We were definitely right. The rooms were exceptionally clean, the beds were comfy, it was nice and quiet, and the staff were friendly and helpful.  The one thing that did not impress me about the hotel was our experience with the shuttle.  The shuttle is advertised to leave the hotel and park every half hour (for example, it leaves the hotel at 1:15pm, 1:45pm, 2:15pm, etc. and leaves the park at 1:30pm, 2:00pm, 2:30pm, etc.)  I don't know if it was just our bad luck or what, but the shuttle kept missing scheduled time periods completely. There were a few times we arrived 10 minutes early to leave the
Manager Response: Well we certainly appreciate the high praise, even with the Shuttle issues. We are working with our Shuttle operator to ensure they meet the scheduled pick-up times regardless of traffic or other events. Best regards, The Sheraton team

Summary: Late check-in due to Disney visit. The roll-away bed was already set up in the room, and the front desk agent was fantastic!  Room was clean and comfortable. The only cons were the wallpaper had some scuffs/stains, no bathtub (nice shower with great water pressure though), and no free Wi-Fi. Normally no free wi-fi wouldn't bother me because we use our cell phones as a hotspot - but we couldn't at this location. I'm not sure if there was a scrambler or just bad cell service.  All in all - a good hotel for the price.
Manager Response: We appreciate the review! We generally do receive very high praise for our staff service here, and it shows in our dramatically improved customer service scores, now above the brand average. We don't have a scrambler, but for some reason some cell services are hard to get a signal in this area. Our apologies for this. Best regards, The Sheraton team

Summary Heading: Great hotel, stay here all the time.
Summary: We travel here on business quite often, at one time almost  every month and we always stay here. This place is great three places to eat with pretty good food. The pool and pool bar are great, they really have it going on. Only draw back is you have Disney right behind it and it gets noisy at night when they are setting off the fireworks. Of course if your there for Disney it probably wont bother you. Great place, highly recommend.
Manager Response: We appreciate the high praise, however, we believe this is for our our sister Sheraton property down the street however. The Sheraton Park hotel. Thank you for your loyalty to our brand and recommendation for this hotel. Best regards, The Sheraton team

Summary: Got a nice solid room for a great price. Room was very quiet, very clean, and new.  The bed was very plush and sleep was great.   The front desk was accommodating and helpful.  Disney is down the road if that makes a difference
Manager Response: This is great to hear! Many of our guests love the Sheraton sweet sleeper bed and all white bedding with duvet. Also our location, minutes from Disneyland, and door to door service on our shuttle is also a hit. We appreciate the recognition, The Sheraton team

Summary: Cons Carpet is stained but not smelly. Parking is $12/ night.  Pros Heated pool Kohler fixtures Beautiful showers Club level room for only 5000 spg points!  (Call to book club level) close to Disney Club level breakfast Club level free WiFi Big club level rooms Comfortable beds Target & $ store across street Valet available. Large beautiful lobby.
Manager Response: We appreciate the kind score and recommendations. We do have the carpets cleaned on a regular basis, however we'll make sure to review this again. Our location, walking distance to Target, many national restaurant chains such as Joe's Crab shack and Outback steakhouse, and one of the best Ice cream stands you're likely to find are all appealing to our return guests. Thank you! The Sheraton team

Summary: we were there this summer in a group of 7. the hotel is close disneyland, clean. the bed is comfortable. plenty towls and you can get extra from front desk. swimming pool is nice. there is a parking fee per day.
Manager Response: We do consider ourselves lucky to be the newest hotel in the area and close to shopping and restaurants, with an easy ride to Disneyland. We appreciate the kind score and review, The Garden Grove team

Summary: We had booked two rooms on our trip to DisneyLand with family. Inspite of a very busy time of September they were able to get both the rooms nearby and made sure we had very comfortable and pleasant stay. It is slightly far from Disney park, but I think it is worth the extra 0.5 mile travel. The hotel staff specially Denise was super helpful in making sure we have good and enjoyable staff.. Thank you - Denise
Manager Response: none

Summary: 3rd time to stay at the this hotel!  This is our family's favorite hotel whenever we go to Disneyland. Awesome as always! Great and friendly staff.Keep up the good work guys!  SPG points are really of great value at this hotel. It's really worth it. We'll definitely be back.Hopefully, wi-fi can be free next time....
Manager Response: Well this is certainly nice to hear and we'll be sure to recognize the staff! We are very highly rated as far as our staff goes, and we thank you for spreading the word about their efforts. We look forward to many returns. We do have free wi-fi in the lobby and have 4 complimentary computers at our business center, the LINK Experience by Microsoft that are available.  Very best regards,  The Garden Grove team

Summary Heading: Great staff & hotel, watch for hidden fees!
Summary: We had a great time on our trip to Anaheim. The Sheraton Garden Grove is on the same street as Disneyland, about 3 miles away. The hotel staff was very accommodating and helpful, even helped us get a car to take us back to the airport when our trip was complete. They were very attentive and quick to answer any questions. The rooms are big, and comfortable. There is a small fridge, but no microwave or other accessories. There is a laundry room on the main level, that does have a microwave for guests. The hotel website says there is a shuttle to Disneyland, but does not tell you the price is $3/person each day. The shuttle drivers wee courteous and also helpful. There is an extra charge for wifi and parking, as well. Parking is charged starting at half hour. Restaurants and
Manager Response: These are some great recommendations and much appreciated. There is plenty of shopping and there are many restaurants within walking distance. Our guests also love the non-stop 'door-to-door' shuttle and avoid the long walks from the large parking areas at the park itself. Most of the hotels in the area, as well as the park do charge for parking. Best regards, The Garden Grove team

Summary: We stayed here on Saturday/Sunday night. This is a typical Sheraton (in a good way). I have Gold status and was given a room on the Club floor (7th). Nice size room. Nicely decorated. Hugh bathroom that was 'smart' looking. Shower, but no tub. The shower was 2.5 feet by 5'. This is .76 meters by 1.52. meters for those interested. That's a gigantic shower. Comfortable bed and pillows. Good towels.   Breakfast in the lounge offered 2 hot dishes. One was the 'standard' scrambled eggs. The other was a baked egg dish that one day included bacon and potatoes; the next day included veggies. Cereal, juice, Starbucks coffee, cold water/sodas also available + bread and fruit.   I read the reviews here prior to posting. That's not the Sheraton we stayed at. I'd go back.  FYI, computers in
Manager Response: This is great to hear. We appreciate the recommendations and the superior review. We are the newest hotel in the area and our guests do love the complimentary LINK Experience by Microsoft business center. Also, we've all gained a few by stepping across the street to Joe's every now and then! Best regards, The Garden Grove team

Summary Heading: Great SPG Point value, good location, OK hotel
Summary: The good: Lowest Starwood points per night in the area. Location: Close to Disneyland (not a comfortable walking distance). Close (easily walk-able) to many restaurants and across the street from a Target. Room: Clean. The in room coffee is Starbucks and it is good. The beds are very nice and the TV had plenty of channels and a good picture. The bathroom has an interesting tub with a wrap around shower curtain (back and side), it was clean and had good pressure. The exercise room has plenty of good equipment The pool is not too big but kept clean. The staff is friendly and responsive. The business center is free to use the computer and print out your docs  The not so good: There is a fee for parking and for a tiny refrigerator. It seems all the hotels in the area charge for
Manager Response: We appreciate the thorough review and recommendation. We pride ourselves on our customer service, which is ever improving, our cleanliness, and ideal location, and are a favorite amongst our loyal SPG members.  Best regards, The Sheraton team

Summary Heading: Dirty carpet and the smell of mildew
Summary: The first time I stayed at this hotel I was impressed with the friendly manner of the hotel staff with the exception of the housekeeping staff.  The hotel is not well maintained.  On both stays, I had to change rooms because of the extremely dirty carpet and the smell of mildew.  This stay was more disappointing.  The housekeeping staff did not clean my room at all after I specifically requested that it be serviced.  Had to change rooms again, late at night, and the front desk manager merely offered an apology.  Again, the carpet was stained and the room smells of mildew.  And, every morning I was awakened by loud housekeeping staff screaming and clanging dishes.
Manager Response: none

Summary: First the good.  The staff was very friendly. Especially the bell staff.  The room was pleasent enough.   But this place did have two serious issues, one of which basically retroactively ruined this hotel for us . Our last night my wife opened the "fresh" toilet paper. It appeared that someone had droped it in the toilet previously and then put it back under the sink. It even had small redish bugs in it. They were prompt in replacing it and a small amount of compensation was offered in the form of SPG points. But truth be told we were both completely disgusted with the whole situation. The other issue was that the hallways of our floor were sweltering. Easily in the mid eighties.   I really wanted to leave a decent review of this place, but I find myself having difficulty
Manager Response: We definitely appreciate the recognition of the staff here as this is a frequent mention. We are sorry about the TP and will look into that, along with the corridor AC. We look forward to continuous improvement. Our customer service scores have improved every month this year and we look to keep that momentum going. Best, The Garden Grove team

Summary Heading: Sheraton should sue this knockoff hotel
Summary: This hotel must be run by some foreign company immune to US laws, as this was no Sheraton.  But seriously, Sheraton needs to follow the lead of Marriott and Hilton and put different names on their inferior properties, like Fairfield or Hampton.  Having stayed in Sheratons throughout the US and Hawaii, this property was not even close to living up to their standards.  That's not to say this is a bad hotel.  I didn't notice any bad scents.  The employees were pleasant, and the rooms were clean.  The bathtub had a 2 sided wrap-around shower curtain, the first I've seen in a hotel, so the shower felt spacious.  The property is fairly new, so at first glance it looks nice enough.  But, here's where it fails.  First, we had a club room with access to the club lounge, which costs
Manager Response: We appreciate all feedback, good and bad, as we can't improve without it. And we apologize if we weren't the right fit for this trip. Starwood has a variety of Brands all with different offerings, so we encourage the use of them all to find the right one. We are held to the same standards as all other Sheraton hotels and our customer service scores are actually in the top half of all Sheratons, so we enjoy the acknowledgement of our staff. Valet service is complimentary with paid parking; we do try to charge the same or less than similar hotels in the area, most of which do charge. The TV's are 32" in our rooms, however our upgraded rooms have 42" sets.  Best regards, The Sheraton team

Summary Heading: Nothing fancy, but overall decent hotel
Summary: I like the Sheraton brand, but you have to understand the deeper inner workings of the Starwood program to properly review their hotels - not all Sheratons are the same.  Its not like walking into a McDonalds in Chicago and finding the same fast food joint that you see in Dallas. This Sheraton is a Category 2, which means its on the basic side.  Think Holiday Inn rather than the shiny fancy high rise Sheratons that sprinkle most big downtowns.  It's only 4,000 points within the starwood program which is a STEAL.  There were some stains on the carpets here and there. It was located at the very end of the strip where Disneyland sits with all her flashy stuff bordering the rougher parts of Anaheim. BUT it was a very comfortable place to sleep & had a nice set up.  I would stay here
Manager Response: We love receiving 4 star reviews and will certainly congratulate the staff on their performance. It is the most common compliment we get. Great advice on the shuttle and more. Much appreciated. The Sheraton Garden Grove team

Summary: I stayed at this hotel for meetings being held in the area. I cannot comment on the Disney experience as we simply went to Downtown Disney one night for dinner, otherwise we were far from the park. The hotel was clean and the staff were great, overall an above average Sheraton. Room service was so slow I had to cancel my order one morning, however after sending an e-mail to the GM I received a quick response with apologies and a reasonable explanation as to why they were so behind this one day. If coming to this area again I would definitely choose this hotel!
Manager Response: We do try to take responsibility for our service, good and bad, and appreciate the opportunity to make improvements where we can.  We're grateful for the kind score and recommendation. Very best regards, The Sheraton team

Summary: The check in was good, the staff that greeted me and my kids were great. As we made our way to the 4th floor and exited the elevators, the smell described in other reviews was present. Even my 6 year old made a comment that it stunk. I also noticied that the floors were a bit dirtier than other hotels I have stayed at. The room was decent and the beds were fairly comfortable.  My first thought on day one would have been to give a great review; however, the service and quality could not be consistent and declined with each day forward. Little things like not restocking the coffee and related supplies. Not restocking the shampoo and soap. Not taking dirty glasses that had been used the day before from the room, or picking up the ones in the hallway that had been there for two or
Manager Response: We're sorry to hear about the experience this trip. Our service scores have actually improved significantly this year, but we realize we still have room to improve. We will certainly review these comments with the management team in order to make improvements where noted. Appreciate the time to write the review. Best regards, The Garden Grove team

Summary: Hotel was good. Very comfortable with wonderful beds and bedding. The floors look dirtier than normal hotels, partly because of a bad color choice for mass quantities of little children. The coffee they provided in the room was great.    The shuttle is right out side the door and is on time every half hour.    Restaurants are walking distance and there is a Target across the street.  Wish list would be a table to sit my small child up to and a microwave.  Even if they had just one a microwave per floor in a common place, it would be an improvement.   Downside: rooms are noisy.  We found that putting our luggage next to the bottom of the door it blocked some of the noise.
Manager Response: We are fortunate to be in a great location close to restaurants and shopping, and a short shuttle ride to Disneyland! These recommendations and suggestions are terrific- we're always looking to make improvements where we can. Best, The Sheraton team

Summary Heading: Excellent staff w superb customer service
Summary: Stayed there for one night, NOT disneyland related! Staff was always friendly and professional.The hotel is super busy though w disneyland guests. Parking is a bit tight at night if you come back late. Club lounge evening food is sparse but breakfast makes up for it. Martha at the front desk is wonderful and courteous. Felt like I have a royal treatment there! I would stay there again.
Manager Response: A big thank you for spreading the word about this stay. The most frequent comment we get is how friendly our staff are. We look forward to many returns and will certainly praise the staff at the next all associate meeting. Best regards, The Sheraton team

Summary Heading: Only if you get a good price....
Summary: I'm not sure to begin this review, so I'll start off by saying that most of the staff are friendly, responsive, and hardworking. Unfortunately, the rest of the staff could care less about providing quality service.  I checked into the hotel around 7:30 this past Wednesday. Check in was quick, the receptionist was pleasant and cheerful. All good signs, until I decided to grab a beer to bring to the room after a long travel day. Unfortunately, no one was behind the counter of the bar. I waited 10 minutes, then decided to go to my room and return later. I did, and upon my return found and the bar unstaffed yet again... My daughter was antsy to hit Disney, so I gave up and went to catch the shuttle. After a hectic evening at the park, I decided to try the bar again. Upon entering,
Manager Response: Well we are certainly sorry to hear about this stay. Our customer service scores have improved dramatically this year so we are disappointed and apologize that we didn't hit the mark this trip. We  promise to act swiftly and surely to remedy the items noted here! And thank all who give us the opportunity - we can't improve without feedback. Best regards, The Garden Grove team

Summary: Hotel is conveniently located close to Disneyland and provide shuttle (for a fee) to the park. Room we stayed was clean and the service staff was responsive. We paid $12 a day for gated parking. The parking lot looked secured.
Manager Response: We are always grateful to receive 4 star reviews! We do try to keep our additional fees to a minimum and consistent or lower than our competitors in the area.   Best regards,  The Sheraton team

Summary Heading: Good location, right price, close to Disneyland
Summary: This is my second stay at this hotel - one of my favorite. It's smaller Sheraton without the price tag. If you book a room on the club level 7th floor, the breakfast is included and pretty decent with eggs, bacon, sausage, hash browns and everything that comes with a continental breakfast. The rooms at this Sheraton is decent but the housekeeping service failed us 2 days in a row with lack of towels. Parking is 12 dollars including valet if you come in late at night. Added bonus, the pool is outdoors and is open 24 hrs. Theres a restaurant but we didn't use it as there are so many choices close by. I will stay here again unless they raise their prices.
Manager Response: We are thrilled with the 5 star review and will certainly work on the suggestions. Our customer service scores have improved dramatically this year and we are glad it showed through on this stay. We look forward to many returns! Very Best regards, The Sheraton team

Summary: We booked this through Priceline because my wife wanted a Four Star Experience.  I was disappointed because this hotel was no where near that rating.  Yes, it seemed new and it was not dirty but the rooms were too small.   Some items such as towel holder started to come apart in the room.  The restroom had a frosted window in the middle of the door!  We had children with us and this feature was annoying with little to no privacy for using the restroom.   Security on parking seemed strict and expensive.  No free wifi in the room this too was an extra charge.   If you are going to Disneyland do not stay here because it is simply not worth it.  I should have stayed somewhere else because it was not worth the money.
Manager Response: We are sorry we did not meet the expectations this trip. We do try to keep our costs in line or lower than the other hotels in the area, and typically receive good comments about our rooms with large beds (CA Kings or 2 Queen size), but we'll definitely pass along these recommendations to the owners. We appreciate the opportunity to improve! Best regards, The Garden Grove team

Summary: This is our family's first time staying at Sheraton Garden Grove - Anaheim South Hotel. It was exceptionally good! Very friendly front desk staff -- upgraded us to a nicer room without asked. The room were very clean and upscale, location can't be better, and pool was very clear, everything was perfect!
Manager Response: This is great to hear! We'll pass along the comments to the team, and look forward to many returns.  Best regards,  The Garden Grove team

Summary: We enjoyed this hotel, near from Disneyland, we liked the pool, the room, very nice and comfortable, clean, great pillows, staff nice and kind. The only thing I did not like the carpets outside the rooms, very, very dirty, and the smell like curry everything else very good.
Manager Response: We really enjoy hearing about our friendly staff- something we'll pass along to the entire team. We also regularly vacuum and shampoo the carpets, however will review those comments with the ownership. Appreciate the time it took to write the review, and look forward to many returns! The Sheraton team

Summary: Family trip to Disneyland took us to Anaheim and this hotel. I expected more from a Sheraton. Rooms are ok and bed was comfortable but rooms feel small and small windows in this prefab building add to sense of smallness. Lots of little problems. There are no morning papers for sale on property. Parking control unit wouldn't accept our room key and complimentary breakfast on 7th floor was a mob scene and there was no place to sit. If you can get good rate and don't plan to spend too much time at hotel then this is ok place to stay.
Manager Response: We appreciate the feedback. Yes, the summer months, particularly July, are our busiest, with nearly double the number of guests in the hotel compared to other months. We are trying to improve every day and consistently look for ways to make the summer experience as good as any the rest of the year. Best, The Sheraton team

Summary: Let me start by saying that we are SPG gold and stayed this past weekend.  We have stayed at the other Sheraton down the street on a prior Disney trip, but decided to give Sheraton Garden Grove a shot since it was only 3,000 points a night versus 10,000 at the other Sheraton hotel.  Since there was a free shuttle to Disney we figured we'd give it a try.  We checked in and the lobby was very nice.  We were given keys to floor 6 (SPG floor) and headed up the elevator.  We were immediately greeted by a horrible stench - smelled like a sweaty gym and the hallway carpet was totally soiled (like HUGE stains all over).  We went into our room and unfortunately the room also smelled like nasty sweat (think GYM smell).   We went back down and asked to be moved.  They were not overly
Manager Response: We appreciate the feedback as we are always trying to improve. Our customer service scores have actually improved greatly this year, so we are surely disappointed that and sorry about the carpets; we do clean them on a regular rotating basis. We'll also review the taxi process with the entire team. We thank you for the opportunity to improve further. Sincerely, The Sheraton team

Summary Heading: Perfect for our trip to Disneyland
Summary: The only reason I didn't rate this as excellent is because the parking is an additional fee.  (Seems to be that way everywhere we went in southern California, but why not just include it in the price?)  We had a really great experience with the Sheraton Garden Grove.  The hotel is actually very new and beautiful.  We enjoyed two meals in the hotel restaurant and everyone enjoyed the food and service.  The customer service at the front desk was great.  Everyone was very friendly and we had a lot of fun joking around with Franklin.  He was a ray of sunshine!  We purchased our Disney tickets at the hotel and had all of our questions answered about pricing and procedures, etc.  The shuttle was great - always on time and very convenient.   The rooms were beautiful and very spacious.
Manager Response: Well we sure do appreciate the kind words. We'll also be sure to recognize Franklin for his exceptional customer service- he is one of our best and coincidentally just won the employee of the month award!  Most hotels in this area do charge a fee for parking. We do try to keep our parking fee comparable to others in the area. Best regards, The Garden Grove Team

Summary Heading: Nice hotel customer service could use a review.
Summary: Paid extra for parking. Our room was far from elevator in fact the complete other side of hotel. I stayed alone with my daughters on a visit to Disneyland. It was safe but I don't even know if the had a continental breakfast because the customer service was s bit lacking:( I think the pool is open 24 hours though, so that could be nice if you pull in late and the kids are bouncing off walls:)
Manager Response: We are sorry to hear we didn't meet expectations this trip. Our customer service scores are in fact much improved this year, however we will continue to work towards 100% satisfaction. Best regards, The Sheraton team

Summary Heading: Great Experience, Great Staff, Unbeatable Hospitality
Summary: My wife and I booked The Sheraton blindly through Hotwire. It was one of those options where you don't don't which hotel you have booked until you pay. We were delighted that The Sheraton is what was given however we were not familiar with the brand as much. Before arriving I went online and joined the Starwoods rewards program/  Upon arrival the staff was upbeat, postive, smiling.. (Just as I would like my employees to look, I am a hotel manager for two large casino properties in Lake Tahoe). The young lady that checked us in was extremely pleasant. I even commented to her that I saw how often the GM responded to feedback on Tripadvisor. Another employee chimed in that they are always on top it! our agent explained all the amenities and the hotel to a tee. I tipped the front
Manager Response: It's nice to be recognized for the hard work we've been doing this year to improve our customer service, now in the top tier of all Sheratons in North America. We certainly appreciate the excellent recommendations and generous review and look forward to being of service again.   We'll be sure to share these comments with our team at our all associate luncheon this week!  Best regards,  The Entire Garden Grove team

Summary: My husband and I stayed at the Sheraton Garden Grove in May 2013. The location is great for Disneyland, if you dont have small kids with you. It is not walking distance, but there is a shuttle ($3 per day) to the park. Rooms were nice (ask for a fridge), across from Target and in the same parking lot as Joes crab shack, Red Robin, Outback and a pizza place. If you are doing other things besides Disney, the location is great, you dont have to drive through all the disney traffic to get to the freeways. They have a breakfast buffet, but it seemed a little pricey. We bought some fruit from target for some mornings, and also walked across the street to Coco's one morning.
Manager Response: We are fortunate to be the newest hotel in the area and next to so many nationally recognized restaurants and within 10 minutes of the Disney theme parks. Best wishes for a return visit! The Garden Grove team

Summary: My family and I stayed here for one night before moving onto the Disneyland property. It is a nice hotel relatively close to the theme parks.  There is a shuttle that runs between the hotel and Disneyland because it is a few blocks away. I wouldn't advise the walk because of the length and the traffic on the major streets in between.  The rooms were nice, clean, and comfortable.  The beds were very comfortable.  There is a restaurant on site that is very affordable and offers good breakfast selections.  I can't speak for lunch or dinner but it was great for two small children and didn't set me back as much as I'm used to paying at a hotel.  Overall, this was a good experience on par with other Starwood properties I have stayed at.
Manager Response: Many of our guests do confuse us with a Westin property, Starwoods upscale brand, due to the elegant lobby, sweet sleeper white bedding package and more. Appreciate the suggestions, feedback and most importantly the 4 star review! The Sheraton team

Summary Heading: A Nice Hotel with No Frills
Summary: The Garden Grove is a convenient hotel to stay in Anaheim and a good value.  It is a place to stay when you will spend most of your time in the Parks.  The $12 parking fee is not appropriate, especially with the large parking lot that they have. The rooms are nice and the Club Lounge is of very high quality.  The pool is a letdown and you will not want to spend time there.  The  front desk staff seems bored and really do not care if you are a Platinum member.  I was the only person in line to check in and they decided to let me wait 15 minutes while they finished their instruction to a new employee. And that happened in front of the Platinum line.  There was no acknowlegement and they seemed very content to me wait.  That was a big diappointment and rude.  Still it is a good
Manager Response: Well we certainly are sorry to hear about the slow check-in. Typically we receive very high scores for our customer service and will review this with our team post haste. Thank you for the honest feedback. The Sheraton team

Summary Heading: Good value for a long weekend stay.
Summary: Nice new, clean hotel with great service.  Within walking distance of Disneyland, alhough too far for young kids to walk.  Sheraon seem to be buildng more cost effective hotels and this was a prime example.  It was a breath  fresh air compared to the older Sheratn that we stayed in last time   A couple of cons.....
