In room wifi was a extra charge, and as we did not want to pay it, to the digust of or teenage kids, we all went without.  Kind of nice actually, to have had actual discussions and not been checking email/texting etc., but all the same, these days you expect to have it included in room.  There was a lounge area downstairs that you could go to.  These had computers in and you could use for 45 minutes for free.  Not sure if it was 45 mins per day or per stay.  Even
Manager Response: Appreciate the 4 star review and recommendations. We are the newest hotel in the area, and do try to keep our added costs as minimal as possible and in line with our competitors. Best, The Sheraton team

Summary: My son and I decided to visit Disneyland without my better half and of course we once again stayed at the Sheraton, or as my son calls it, the "S" hotel.  The service, the rooms, and the club level lounge are exceptional and it's a phenomenal place for families.  I have to say that we could really stay anywhere on the resort corridor, and even though the Hilton family of hotels is typically our choice, we always stay at this Sheraton.  The value is great, breakfast on the club level is exceptional, and people are always friendly.  Kudos to this hotel!!
Manager Response: We are fortunate to have found such terrific associates here and our ever improving customer service surveys are better for it.  We do offer the full hot breakfast in the Club lounge which is a definite benefit.  We look forward to many returns, The Garden Grove team

Summary: I'm giving this hotel four stars because it's a bargain if you are booking with points.  We go to DIsney a lot and have stayed at many hotels (Park Sheraton, Hojo, Park Plaza).  While this is not my favorite (I prefer the Park Sheraton), it's a really nice, clean hotel and well located though not walking distance to the park.  We did stay during the aforementioned sewer smell in the hallway, but I'm sure that has been fixed...  If you book with points it's about half as much as the Park Sheraton; however, if you are paying it's only $5-$50 dollars less, so check the price, because it might be worth the extra 5-10 to stay closer to Disney.  Here is what we liked:  The rooms are big (much bigger than Park Sheraton)and have refrigerators and coffee makers. They are nice and well
Manager Response: We always appreciate 4 star reviews. Some travelers do like being just a bit down the road from the parks in a quieter setting. Thanks for the tips for still being walking distance to shopping and restaurants, and for mentioning the sweet sleeper beds, the Core performance fitness center, and  Club level! We'll work on the other items and do hope to see you down the road. Best regards, The Garden Grove team

Summary: Stayed here for 2 nights with family. We had 3 rooms total. The rooms were a decent size. The bathrooms were spacious. No bathtubs, but big shower stalls. Spacious counter space. The flat screen TV was on the small side but it's ok. The beds were very comfortable. Room service for breakfast was fast. Parking was $12 per night. Refridgerators $10 per night.   Overall it was a good experience. I'm only giving this hotel 3 stars because of these reasons:  -The hallway had a terrible odor (BO) from the elevator all the way to our rooms. Unfortunately our rooms were a long way down the hall. We turned blue holding our breath. Going to the room and leaving the room was a dreadful experience. It smelled that way the whole time we were there.   -It took 2 calls to get a fridge brought
Manager Response: We appreciate the feedback as we constantly are looking to improve. We do have several parking options, some that are farther have more spacing. We'll review the process for responding to the calls for service- typically we receive very high marks for our staff and service. We have investigated the odor and resolved the issue- it was coming from a plumbing clog in one single room and has been repaired. Best regards, The Sheraton team

Summary Heading: One of the best Hotels near Disneyland
Summary: Stayed her about 2 years ago and the location was convenient and the place was new and clean.  I wasn't all that impressed with anything else.  When I came back this time I was really surprised to see how much more caring the service was.  It was all geared toward making the traveler comfortable.  From the housekeeping staff, front desk and club room staff, everyone was so attentive, it made me feel important and I have been traveling for work for over 10 years.  I was really impressed.  When I first checked in the staff were busy but it didn't take very long for them to get to me and when they did, they were very attentive, giving me personal attention, answering all my questions and making me feel comfortable.  I will definitely go back again.  It will be my #1 choice in the
Manager Response: We are thrilled with 5 star scores and can't wait to congratulate our team on their customer service. This year our hotel has made significant improvements in our service scores and we are happy that it showed in this stay. We look forward to many return visits! The Sheraton team

Summary: I personally like hotels that don't charge parking fee, unfortunately most do.  This was an overall good hotel to stay in anaheim, garden grove area.  Limited amenities.  Hotel is new.  Wish there were refrigerator in room for my little kids snacks
Manager Response: We appreciate the 4 star review despite the challenges. We do have fridges available on request and are sorry we didn't get one up if requested. Our full service hotel is equipped with a state of the art gym by Core Performance, complimentary business center by Microsoft, and 3 meal restaurant and room service. We do love our location with easy access to the theme parks and walking distance to shopping and nationally recognized restaruants. Best regards, The Sheraton team

Summary Heading: Great location for those without transportation
Summary: I normally stay at one of the Hilton properties when I travel to Anaheim, but I earned a free night with Sheraton so I gave them a try. I don't rent a car when I'm here so I really liked the convenience of having a very nice Target across the street as well as a few restaurants in walking distance. The staff were very nice, extremely helpful! Breakfast was good! My only criticism is that they don't have late night room service.  If you are looking for a nice clean room after a full day in Disneyland this is the place. We will be back!
Manager Response: It's sure great to keep hearing about our staff here in Garden Grove- they are our most valuable asset for sure! Sheraton's cutting edge programs like the Sweet sleeper bed with white bedding, the Core Performance Fitness and Microsoft Business center partnerships are all excellent and our guests keep coming back for them time and time again. We look forward to a swift return, The Sheraton team

Summary: The hotel is fairly new.  It was clean and modern.  Very good feel.  The room was quite large.  It did not include most of the stuff I typically look at for a family vacation: internet charge, parking charge, no free breakfast, no fridge included, etc.  However, I expected all of that up front, so no surprises.  My only real complaint was that the bathroom didn't have a towel rack.  We were pleasantly surprised by three things: (a) The Hotel's shuttle to Disneyland was remarkably on schedule.  We have stayed at 7 different Anaheim-area hotels over the years and one things is constant: the Disneyland shuttles are unpredictable and never run on schedule.  But for the first time ever, we found a shuttle that was perfectly on time every time!  It was remarkable and my wife wants to
Manager Response: We do love getting 4 star reviews and such high praise! We do enjoy our location and being the newest hotel in the area as well. Great special offers can be found through our SPG guest loyalty program as mentioned, and on the website as well. Best regards, The Sheraton team

Summary: My husband and I just recently took our children 4 and 2 to LA to visit Disneyland. This hotel was fantastic and meet all our needs.  The staff were great. Room was spacious and modern.  My husband is an SPG member so we upgraded to the club lounge. this was great because we had breakfast and pre dinner snack which was excellent.  The shuttle to Disney was excellent always prompt and only had one other drop off on way back.  Hotel is also is a great location across the road from target.  As I said Staff was so helpful. We had difficult flight times. We arrived early morning and they let us get in to our room early  and our flight departed at 11pm and they let us check out at 5pm. This was such a kind gesture with two little ones. I know that this can not be guaranteed but most
Manager Response: We are very pleased we were able to meet all the expectations and more and truly appreciate 5 star reviews! When we can, we are happy to arrange our schedule to suit the needs of our individual guests. Our close proximity to the Disney parks via shuttle, and walking distance to restaurants and shopping do make us a convenient location. To top it off, we can boast that we are the very newest hotel in the area! Best wishes, The Sheraton team

Summary Heading: Best 3.5 star hotel for under $100 a night!
Summary: Using the Canadian name your price tool on that site that starts with price and ends in line, we got this hotel for $80 a night which was a steal considering their website quotes $160 a night. The location is about 2 miles down south harbor road from Disney but worth every penny considering the top notch service this hotel brings and complimentary Starbucks coffee or tea brewed in your room. The biggest negative is that they charge $12 a night for parking however its valet service so you don't have to worry about finding a space. The service is fantastic and the rooms are spotless and incredibly comfortable. We requested two queen beds and when we arrived at midnight our room was waiting without a hitch. The bathrooms were pristine and we would recommend this hotel in a
Manager Response: We truly appreciate great feedback like this, especially when our staff are recognized! Being the newest hotel in the entire area we do often get terrific comments about the facility, however our location we think is ideal as well, within walking distance to shopping and many top-rated restaurants. We do run some fantastic sales and specials if you keep your eyes open, particularly if you are a Starwood Preferred Guest, our complimentary frequent traveler program. Best regards! The Sheraton Garden Grove Team

Summary Heading: Comfortable hotel at decent price. Redeemed points to stay for free
Summary: It's not close to Anaheim Disney, nor to the Convention Center, but it's realtively new, with comfortable and noiseless (compared to the other Anaheim Sheraton, big difference). Staff was firendly, parking lot very big. Breakfest somwhat different from what we normally have in Europe. Rather monothematic. Choose a la carte breakfast if you want to enjoy it in the morning.  I actually stayed for free as I redeemed my points earned a year earlier. Good deal! Unchallengable by any European Sheraton offers. Paid off to be SPG Card owner.
Manager Response: Thank you for the kind words and we look forward to having you return. Best, The Sheraton team

Summary: As what is expected from a Sheraton property, this location was perfect.  The front desk staff was the picture of customer service.  They were so helpful and no matter how busy they were, they greeted you with a smile and made you feel you were the only guest by their individual attention to your needs.  I dealt with Omar Romero in Sales, who helped me sooooo much.  Thank you Omar for making this trip so special for my family.  All the staff was excellent!!!
Manager Response: We just love getting 5 star reviews, especially when its related to our customer service. We have been improving in this area and are happy to be recognized for it. We've already passed along the kudos to Omar and the team! Best regards, The entire Sheraton team

Summary: Thanks to the good reviews on Trip Advisor I was able to narrow down my search for a nice hotel near Disneyland.  The hotel is very clean and the service was great, especially Luis at the front desk.  The food at the restuarant was good.  The beds and pillows were comfortable.    The hotel is not walking distance to Disneyland but shuttle service is easy to use and the drivers are all very friendly.  The cost for the shuttle is $3.00 per person over the age of 9 per day.  The $3.00 includes back and forth rides for the entire day.    We were very please with The Sheraton Garden Grove and will make this our go to hotel for our future Disneyland trips.
Manager Response: We do enjoy being the newest hotel in the entire area and are often mistaken for our more upscale brand the Westin, due to our upgraded amenities. We are happy to hear that our shuttle partner is performing well too! Great tip on the rate packages as well- we do try to offer unique packages tailored exclusively for the vacationing family. Best regards, The Sheraon Garden Grove team

Summary: Hotel service was great as is any Sheraton. Front desk was helpful and friendly. Bathroom counters were a little small, not much storage space, and the closet wasn't very big. Just an armoir in the room. Room was clean and quiet. Hotel is about 5-8 minute drive from park but they have a shuttle that comes and goes from the park every 30 minutes.
Manager Response: We love getting 4 star reviews and the helpful tips for other travelers. Many do come to our location as the quiet alternative that is still close enough to the Disney parks, and still near restaurants, shopping, and more. We'll certainly work to make other improvements where we can! Best regards, The Sheraton Garden Grove team

Summary: The was a constant noise coming from the airconditioner. It sounds like a motor running. I called a maintenacne worker he said it was the wind and there was nothing he could do to solve the problem. Really the wind blowing in Southern Cal. for tow complete night and the morning while we were in the room. Just a poor excuse. They need to so something with this big problem. Certainly let the good name of Sheraton down.
Manager Response: We are sorry we weren't able to resolve this issue while here. We do our best to respond in a timely manner and when hotel management is contacted. We'll review this issue with our maintenance team as this is rarely mentioned as a problem. Best, The Sheraton Garden Grove team

Summary Heading: Avoid this hotel until Management fixes issues
Summary: Extremely disappointed in this hotel and their staff. After our stay I don't know how anyone commented on the great staff and amenities. We had too many issues to report here from no one answering the front desk phone to waiting over 20 minutes to receive our bill after giving the waiter our card in the restaurant. Overall, the aesthetics are cheap and they nickel-and-dime ya for everything. The pool is extremely small and often crowded, the shuttle is great but not included with an already overpriced room rate, the breakfast was sub-par and not very good, and the Internet was not free (even not free in the lobby although they said it was free there).
Manager Response: We do typically receive very good feedback from our guests and are sorry we could not meet expectations this time. When we reach out to a guest via telephone and the mailbox is full, we do send email to try and resolve/recover any issues and offer appropriate compensation. When we receive no word back we assume the response was satisfactory.   The WIFI is complimentary in the lobby and we also have 4 state of the art computers in our Microsoft partnered business center that are free to use and print. We'll certainly follow up on all concerns and also re-train our food servers so that we can split checks more expediently.  Best regards, The Sheraton team

Summary: This Sheraton was a decent price for such a prime location.  Very clean and comfortable with pleasant service and great amenities like the pool and work out room.  The rooms were spacious enough and the bathrooms are a good size as well.  Shuttle service is convenient and of course  paying to park in the hotel lot is a joke, but common practice in California.  They bleed you for every penny.
Manager Response: We love hearing getting positive feedback about our clean, spacious rooms; being the newest hotel in the area we try to keep it in top notch shape! We do try to keep any additional fees such as parking, as reasonable as possible and lower than most similar hotels in the area. Appreciate the note! The Sheraton Garden Grove team

Summary: It is about a mile away from Disneyland which makes it one of those hotels that cater mostly to family with small children but I didn't see too many children running amok, so that was good & convenient for me since I was there with friends and we're single and in our thirties. The hotel, in general, is small with 7 floors only and there are only two elevators serving the guests but I never had to wait too long for one to arrive. The hallways on the 2nd floor had a lingering smell of food, which wasn't nauseating but it did hit your nostrils every time I stepped out of the elevator into the hallway; house keeping should really watch out for that and make sure there isn't an odor in the hallways. The room was quite big and the bathroom was spacious, which I loved and enjoyed. The
Manager Response: We'll be sure to congratulate the staff on exceeding the expectations, which is a common comment. Nice rooms, pool and fitness center don't matter if we can't deliver on service. And we'll work on that odor challenge on 2; not sure what the cause was that day but it has since vanished. Best regards, The Sheraton Garden Grove Team

Summary: I booked this hotel on Hotwire, where it had a 4-star rating. I am honestly not sure why it has 4 stars. The room was cute and modern, but it was worn down. Walls were dirty, the floor in our room was very stained and dirty and there was a red wine stain on the white comforter. My biggest "issue," however was simply the noise level. I could hear the gentleman next door whistling away in the bathroom as if he were standing next to me. I also could hear someone (I think) throwing up in the room above me (whatever it was, it did not sound good). The hallway noise is also extremely loud. I understand hotel noise. I travel a lot. But this was definitely on par with a much lower rated hotel. Internet was $10 a day, which is on par with a higher priced hotel (about the only thing on
Manager Response: We apologize that we did not meet the expectations on this stay. We typically receive very high marks for our service. We're pleased that the restaurant stood out and will certainly look into the other issues.  Our responses for cleanliness are generally very high as well, however during this busy Spring Break period we do miss the mark sometimes and look to improve upon our mistakes. And our thanks for commenting on the corridor wallpaper as its being replaced next week!  Best regards,  The Sheraton Garden Grove team

Summary Heading: Near Disneyland. Stay if you plan to be in the park all day.
Summary: I try to only stay at Starwoods properties. The night before I stayed at the Sheraton Anaheim and it was like staying in a castle. This hotel was like staying in the peasants' quarters. It is about 1.5 miles from the entry to Disneyland which is great. However, the cleanliness and service at the hotel left a lot to be desired. The waitstaff in the restaurant was great during breakfast while the folks at the check-in counter were clearly having a bad day because they wouldn't even acknowledge me when I came in. They were too busy checking their phone. I patiently waited and they caught an attitude with me. When I later asked about some changes for my room (attached rooms so my kids could be near my room) they said "we don't do that here." I am not sure how this place won awards
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Day 1 of 3.. so so, so far.
Summary: Checked in at 330. Sold out which is bad with a wife and 2 kids and a pipeline booking. 1 king bed. No 2 bed rooms avail. Got the floor. Fold a way 20 bucks a night. Parking 12 a day. Shuttle to Disney 3 bucks a person per day, more convenient to pay Disney 15 if I have to pay 12 and no flexibility. Asked for extra blankets and she said she had to check if any were available! Really? Didn't get them. She did give me some tips for next time. Book with Travelocity or expedite. I guess they don't like me since I used pipelines. So so, so far.
Manager Response: none

Summary: A great basic hotel near (1.2 miles) Disneyland.  The shuttle worked well and is $3 per day for an adult.  The pool and hot tub outside were warm and adequate.  I appreciated the free computer access and printer in the lobby business centre.  We did not try the restaurant.  It is more of a corporate client hotel to service the convention centre than a family one but it we made it work.  The staff were friendly.
Manager Response: Being the newest hotel in the area and offering great service we do find that our guests keep coming back again and again. We are comfortable for both business travelers and families, with a shuttle to Disney, complimentary business center, pool, state of the art fitness center and full service restaurant and lounge.  Best, The Sheraton Garden Grove team

Summary Heading: Great, friendly service and new facilities
Summary: The service at the Sheraton Garden Grove was great. Everyone of the staff members were very friendly and went out of their way to be helpful. Made you feel very at home and cared for.  Hotel is fairly new, with large, comfortable rooms. Was in Anaheim for a convention, and the free shuttle to the convention center was very convenient. Only reason that this isn't a 5 star review is that there were a few minor issues with the facilities in the bathroom (the faucet in the shower was missing a cover, as was one of the handles in the shower). Overall, a great hotel and I would return here in a heartbeat.
Manager Response: Accolades for the staff friendliness and responsiveness are always great to hear. We'll be sure to congratulate the team. We've made note of the plumbing issues and will correct those right away. Appreciate the opportunity to improve! Best, The Sheraton Garden Grove team

Summary: My wife and granddaughter made a last minute trip to Disneyland. Sheraton staff "David F." and others help them with connections to and from airport as well as Disney. The property is clean and bright... and competitively priced. Thanks for helping make memories.
Manager Response: We will pass along the kudos to the team here. Best wishes for a terrific 2012 and many happy returns! The Sheraton Garden Grove Family

Summary: Sheraton Garden Grove is a basic Sheraton Hotel conveniently located close to Disney. The hotel offer a disney shuttle for $3 fee per person. Parking is an issue and you have to use the complimentary valet if you are coming in after 9.00pm. Parking is not free costs about $15/day which probably typical for hotels in this busy area.  The rooms themselves are fairly roomy but nothing spectacular. I was at the club level and hence breakfast was included. Wifi works fine. I was traveling with family and was able to get a  connected room which was good. Amenities are all standard Sheraton, nothing to write home about. All in all a pretty decent Sheraton with an excellent location.
Manager Response: We appreciate 4 star reviews and do enjoy our location, a short shuttle to Disney without all the congestion of a Disney hotel. Parking is $12 per night with Valet being complimentary and included in this fee. We try to stay competitive with the other similar hotels in the area, who also charge for parking. Best regards, The Sheraton Grove

Summary: We really loved our stay at this hotel.  Everyone was so nice and helpful.  The rooms were clean.  The food was good.  It was close to places to eat.  Also, the hotel recommended Carlos Limo and Car service for airport pickup and drop off.  He came on time, dressed professionally and was very attentive.  You can reach him for a quote at 714-588-5452.
Manager Response: We'll certainly commend the staff for another great review. Most of our guests keep coming back for the service and also for the new, upscale accommodations, with extra large Sweet Sleeper mattresses. Best, The Sheraton Garden Grove Team

Summary: We stayed at this location from Feb 21 - 23th. When we arrived there was no place to park so I  went in and the front desk said they would valet it for us.  Once we got upstairs to our room we found it very clean and big. They bathroom was very nice & bright. I did find it  hard to sleep at night - you could hear everything in the hallway.  Internet is expensive - they charge per device so it is pricey.  They do have a few computers in the lobby that you can use and print off boarding passes which was nice! They place the bills under your door the day you check out - make sure you check it.  I was charged for room service I did not order - Went downstairs to the front desk and they fixed it very quickly and then they sent up warm cookies to my room for the inconvience. Shuttle
Manager Response: This is excellent feedback. We appreciate the time it takes to write and will work to make improvements where we can. The shuttle service does increase the size of the buses during peak periods and will also increase the number of buses; we are sorry the bus was full on this trip.   We do enjoy having the LINK Experience by Microsoft, our complimentary business center in the lobby. It's a great place to catch up and have a morning Starbucks coffee. We are looking into changing the fee for multiple internet users in the same room.  Being the newest hotel in the area, we do try to keep our rooms very clean and most guests enjoy the size and comfort. Our King beds are California King and our doubles are Queens.  Best regards, The Sheraton Garden Grove Team

Summary Heading: Our go to hotel in Orange County
Summary: We have stayed here many times and always enjoy the rooms and the staff. Cleanliness is always AAA+++. The beds are so comfortable and ensure that we are well rested. I do wish there were towel bars in the bathroom to hang our towels. We are SPG Gold members and enjoy using the club floor and the lounge. We wish the coffee machine was functioning more often. The gentleman staff member in the lounge didn't really seem to care about setting it up properly. But that was the only glich. The front desk staff are always so nice and helpful. I also alway enjoy using the exercise facilityin the early morning. Thank you to sheraton GG for making your hotel our home away from home.
Manager Response: We are honored to be a 'home away from home' for many frequent travellers and do appreciate feedback so that we can improve. We've made note and corrected the deficiency with the Club lounge espresso machine, and will congratulate the team on the great service that has been received. We look forward to being of service in the near future! The Sheraton Garden Grove team

Summary Heading: ***Do Not Stay Here If You Have Allergies!***
Summary: Allergy Sufferers:  I have slight allergies to feathers and this hotel gave my son and I an awful allergy attack.   They promptly replaced the down comforter and pillows in our room, however there was still dander and feathers all over the place.   They were on the clean towels, desk, bed sheets, and even when we moved our luggage around feathers would fly up in the air!   If you don't have allergies, this place could work but...there are still other cons: - charge for Internet use - charge for "courtesy" shuttle to Disneyland - shuttle stop was really awkward, past the parking lot, away from the hotel.  The shuttle also didn't come at the times listed, you just got lucky if it happened to show up when you were there  - no self- laundering  available - laundry service charges
Manager Response: We appreciate the kind comments about the staff here at the Sheraton Garden Grove. We typically receive very good comments about our service. We are sorry that the bedding didn't work out. Our bedding is typically one of reasons our guests come back. The Sheraton white bedding package has high thread count sheets and very high quality comforter/duvet. We do place both synthetic and down pillows in each room, but we are pleased to remove them and have only synthetic upon request- we can do this in advance if requested.  The fees associated with parking, internet and shuttle are very close to or less than similar hotels in the Anaheim area. We do try to remain a great value compared to our competitors. Best regards, The Sheraton Garden Grove team

Summary: The hotel is very nice.  Clean and very comfortable rooms.  The room was large and the beds were nice.  The staff was friendly.  The only negative was the internet which I could never get working.  Will stay there again if they can get the internet working properly.
Manager Response: We appreciate the feedback and certainly will make corrections to the internet; we did recently upgrade our wireless access points. We do receive great feedback from our guests regarding the service, rooms and convenient location and look forward to return visits! Best regards, The Sheraton Garden Grove Team

Summary: The hotel was sold out over Presidents' Day weekend.  We had no place to park our car on Sat night.  There were 5 other guests asking about parking and the front desk didn't know what to do.  They offered to valet the cars for us but we couldn't find anyone at the valet stand.  If you are going to charge for parking, make sure we can actually park our car!
Manager Response: Our apologies for the parking issues; we are working to prepare better for holiday weekends. We appreciate the comments and look forward to creating a better experience. We do have an auxiliary lot and we are sorry it wasn't pointed out. Our location to Disneyland (1 mi.) and shuttle service there make us a popular destination and typically we receive very good comments on the service and rooms; we are the newest built hotel in the area. Best regards, The Sheraton Garden Grove Team

Summary Heading: Awesome Location. Friendly Staff. Clean Rooms.
Summary: My husband and I along with our daughter are frequent visitors to Disneyland so we like to try different hotels around the area. We opted to stay overnight at this hotel since we have SPG points and we were happy to see that the hotel we picked was really clean and modern. The front desk personnel was really friendly at check-in. Parking was $12 and since I read it on Tripadvisor, that didn't shock me and I think that's reasonable around the area. The only issue we encountered was when we chose to do room service for breakfast the following day before heading to Disney. We had our room service card for our order at 10pm and we were waiting around 6:30-7:00 but no breakfast. I told my husband to check the door knob and our card was stil there to our dismay. We wanted it to be
Manager Response: We appreciate the kind words and are sorry we missed on the room service experience. This is excellent feedback for us to improve and will certainly congratulate the staff that did well. We do enjoy being the newest and more modern hotel in the Disneyland area look forward to making the next trip memorable! Best regards, The Sheraton Garden Grove team

Summary Heading: $12 parking fee per day; otherwise USUALLY a good stay
Summary: We have stayed here about 10-12 times now since we have annual passes to Disneyland and are SPG Gold members. They usually have good service and I am pretty happy with their rooms.   This one particular trip was not that great because of the service: couldn't find a room initially due to being almost at 100% capacity, wifi didn't connect, etc.  But all the other times we have stayed here, it went pretty smoothly. The service is generally nice and it is a nice location to the park. The Target across the street plus other restaurants nearby are convenient.  There is a small bar area -- haven't tried but see quite a few people at the bar during the afternoon/evening.  SPG member level for SPG members --- unless they are at capacity -- which I'm thinking they overbook or give it
Manager Response: We appreciate these comments about the hotel; we do value our SPG frequent guests very much and try to extend the maximum benefits, however there are sometimes when we are near capacity that we can't get every level in the upgraded rooms. We'll work on that! Some hotels in the area do have added charges called 'resort fees' or other, however we like to say it like it is and call a parking fee a parking fee and same for shuttle. We do try to stay fair with market prices. Appreciate the feedback as always!

Summary: Beautiful, modern hotel. Close to Disneyland. Spacious, clean rooms. Not too much more I expect from a hotel. I've stayed here a few times and service has always been great and all aspects of the hotel were exceptional. In one room, the water pressure in the shower was extremely low but other than that, everything has been good. Parking is $12 a night which is standard for the area and they charge a fee to use the shuttle to Disneyland, which is a little odd. Target is directly across the street and there are many restaurants in the area. Make sure to check out Joes Italian Ice about a quarter mile south of the hotel. Delicious desserts.
Manager Response: We here at the Sheraton Garden Grove really do appreciate that we are one of the newest hotels in the Disney area. Our rooms are spacious and modern, and we have excellent sevice to back it up. We'll be sure to review our shuttle pricing, and please do keep coming back! Best regards

Summary: For "Security" reasons they would not allow a pizza I ordered to be delivered to the room. Having change & come down to the lobby kind of defeats the purpose of delivery!   Parking for overnight guests is tacked on too!  Plenty of other places just as nice or nicer nearby.
Manager Response: We apologize for the inconvenience; we pride ourselves on being a very safe hotel and do not allow outside delivery personel up to the guest rooms because they haven't been through our screening. We do have excellent pizza made right in the hotel that can be delivered through room service however! In addition, we do have a parking fee that we monitor to ensur we are fair compared to other hotels in the area. We do that with all our rates a services. Best regards

Summary Heading: Great service, convenient, and everyone helpful!
Summary: Would stay here again. The room was a good size and clean! The only thing is they charge too much for overnight parking. It's Orange County not Downtown Los Angeles! C'mon.  It is very close to Disney and 5fwy to hop on for another destination. Target is across the street if you forgot something at home. Overall very convenient and excellent hotel!
Manager Response: We do appreciate the fact that we have California King beds and Queen beds in our double rooms, and that our rooms are expansive enough to move around them! We also love our lcation and ease of access, but truly appreciate the kudos on our service. Thank you! The parking rates are reviewed and adjusted to the going market rate and we try to stay well below many of our competitors.  Best regards

Summary Heading: Well priced central to Anaheim or anything in Northern Orange CO.
Summary: I am a slave to the Starwood brand because I love their points program and most of their properties.  I had the occasion to stay at this particular property approximately 4 times this year with each stay lasting from 1-2 nights.  It is central to anything near Disneyland but not right on top of it like the other two Sheratons nearby.  I like that it is more business travelers than tourists and a pretty quite hotel for a fair price.  I will note however that the other Sheraton nearby (Anaheim resort) has a much better hospitality lounge for its members including free booze if that is your thing.   Pros: cost, location, business crowd, hospitality suite with decent breakfast, walking distance from Outback as well as a few other chain restaurants, nice lobby bar with a friendly
Manager Response: We are grateful that we are in such a fantastic location, close enough to the entertainment but far enought away to have a nice quiet environment. We'll pass along the kudos to the beverage team and will certainly take a look at the suggestions for Club lounge, et al. Appreciate the feedback!

Summary: Knowing there a hotel that family's will use as they are close to Disney you would think they would be a bit more family happy. The room was nice and clean the bar & restaurant were pretty good as well. The let down was some of the staff. On our check inn we were told as we are only gold spg we would not get an spg floor but we could use the common room for spg members for $40 a night each. We told the guy at the front desk to forget that as there were 5 of us in two rooms it was cheaper to eat out. So to try and sweeten us up a little he said he would give us free wifi in 1 room for the 3 nights we were there and as we had ajoining rooms it would work in both which it did. On checking out the $10 a night charge was on both rooms. had to argue to get the charge taken off. Over
Manager Response: none

Summary: Stayed here two different nights on business. Both rooms were clean and simple. The location is close to disney, across from a target and within walking distance of a few chain restaurants. Both my nights included breakfast, one was in the restaurant, the other was in the Sheraton club. The club offered the same hot (excellent) breakfast, but was buffett style, which is convenient if you're on the go.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: One of the nicer Sheratons in the area
Summary: I stayed here for a single night after staying the prior night at a neighboring Sheraton.  This hotel felt much more modern than it's neighbor down the street. The room was very clean and comfortable.  The bathroom was great for a single person - there was no bath tub, so if that is a deal breaker for you, stay somewhere else. For me, it wasn't an issue. Speaking of the bathroom the water temperature and pressure was spot on.  The worst part of my stay was that I was assigned an adjoining room and the neighbors had a were a bit loud.  I truly loathe adjoining rooms - it just feels like strangers are in your room.  When staying in Anaheim again for work, I would choose to stay at this Starwood Property versus the others in the area.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I revisited in December and had a great time. I had exactly the room type I wanted and it was nice and quiet. As SPG Plat I got free internet which worked well. The shuttle to the park now runs direct and is much improved. Everyone was very helpful and had no trouble with parking. Those expecting a ST Regis will be disappointed but for a comfortable no nonsense stay at very reasonable price I really recommend. Rooms are quite spacious, very clean and everything works as it should. My only gripe is the local channels on TV are still not in HD but hey you don't come to disney to watch TV. Thoroughly recommend and I do not understand the adverse comments from some. By the way the shuttle stops by the pool as the bus is too long to clear the driveway. It is not on top of Disneyland
Manager Response: none

Summary: The room was neat and clean. Bathroom and bed were very good. Good quailty stay for a good price. Need to take a shuttle to and from Disneyland and that was not so bad the shuttle ran every 30 minutes and was always punctual.
Manager Response: none

Summary: If I am in the Anaheim area and need an only place to sleep and grab a quick bite, this is always  my choice.  This hotel is extremely clean and comfortable. Location is near several restaurants. Several shopping options are a short drive.  While I have never used this service, there is a shuttle to Disneyland.  I did notice several families staying at the hotel.  I typically stay on the club floor, where breakfast and evening appetizers are served.  Breakfast is a full breakfast ( eggs, potatoes, sausage, hot cereal) plus there are cold cereal, yogurt, and fruit offerings. Full coffee bar is available also. My only complaint, and I really don't know how the hotel could control this is that the breakfasts appear to be limited in amounts.  Several families were in the lounge for
Manager Response: none

Summary: Spent four nights here and enjoyed every night!  We arrived and a blackout just ended and the staff was extra helpful.  They quickly walked us up to our room and delivered room keys when the computers were functioning.  The room was nice, clean and spacious.    Here are a few things to consider: Walls were a little thin but not bothersome.  I could hear when neighbors ran their water. No microwave, fridge, or in room safe. A wifi fee per device - kind of too much  Otherwise, the beds were comfy, loved the target across the street, and lots of good food nearby.  The bar staff was great, we asked them to heat up leftovers for our daughter and they did it with a smile.    Overall, I really enjoyed my stay here.  I got a great deal and I plan to come back next time the family and I
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Yuck. There are better hotels within this price range that are nicer.
Summary: I booked a room here for a quick overnight to Disneyland. I knew of it because it was next to my usual hotel which is the Crowne plaza. We arrived around 7pm (it was dark) several lights were out in the parking lot and the entrance with the arm that raises and lowers when you're issued a ticket, was broken and propped open. There was no valet and parking was very limited. Before we entered the hotel we could hear a very loud party going on inside. Once inside, I wasn't impressed. The lobby is very small, there were three people behind the counter and 3 in line yet only one was being helped. I waited for about 5 minutes and during my wait, I noticed several more people in a room behind the front desk. (All these people and such slow service?) After a very long day, I wanted
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing the Sheraton Garden Grove for your recent visit to our area. I am sorry to hear that you were not happy with your arrival experience, and that you chose not to stay with us.  I have reviewed your comments, and we will address your issues accordingly. We hope that you will give another opportunity to show your our outstanding accommodations and service.   Nicole Fedorchek  General Manager

Summary: Stayed there for three nights. The rooms lacks the following : safety box and fridgerator. We had to pay for disneyland shuttle and car parking. We had to pay for the internet in the room each device used the internet the full amount. The restaurant breakfast is weak in terms of food quality n freshnes. The safety box is in the reception in which i had to go everytime there. If u lost the safety box key , u have to pay 150$. It happnd that i lost the key n then found it. when i lost it i reportd that to the guest services , they told me u have to pay 150$ in which noone told me abt it before and i didnt sign anything. I had to talk to the manager, but she didnt confes that its their mistake of not telling me abt the 150$ and sign the form. Noone even apologizd for me after i
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing the Sheraton Garden Grove Anaheim South for your recent visit to our area. I am sorry to hear that you were not completely satisfied with your stay.  Our additional fees for internet usage, parking, and shuttle service are competitive with the hotels in our area. We do offer packages that include these fees at a reduced cost.  I have addressed your concerns regarding the breakfast quality with my Food and Beverage Manager.  Generally, we do charge a $150 replacement fee if the safety deposit box key is lost. This fee is on the slip that is signed upon receiving the safe deposit box. Please be assured that this fee simply covers our cost of a service call with our locksmith. I apologize for the situation that occurred specifically regarding whether or not you were told of this fee.  I appreciate the detailed feedback regarding your stay, and we look forward to welcoming you back on your next visit to our area!  Nicole Fedorchek General Manager

Summary: The hotel is in a good location and the shuttle service to the Disney Parks is outstanding.  For example on Sunday morning a very large number of guests were waiting on the 8:30 shuttle.  Instead of running only one bus, as many hotels do, they added two other busses to handle the number of guests going to the parks.  Staff was helpful and friendly.  The hotel is a bit tired, but the rooms were large and clean.   Price was good too. Rated a Very Good +_
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing the Sheraton Garden Grove Anaheim South for your recent visit to our area. I am glad to hear you were pleased with your stay!   am pleased that our services and accommodations made your vacation memorable in such a positive way!  We look forward to welcoming you back on your next visit to our area!  Nicole Fedorchek General Manager

Summary Heading: Great stay thanks to friendly, helpful staff!
Summary: I travelled to this Sheraton with my family for a leisure trip last week, and when my wife and I decided that we needed more room for the kids, Edger and Julio bent over backwards to make sure that we had everything we needed (including connecting rooms for the duration of our stay). Thanks again, guys- you made our trip 100% better.
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing the Sheraton Garden Grove Anaheim South for your recent visit to our area. I am glad to hear you were pleased with your stay!  Julio and Edgar are outstanding team members, and I am very happy to share your feedback with them! I am pleased that they helped to make your trip memorable in such a positive way!  We look forward to welcoming you back on your next visit to our area!  Nicole Fedorchek General Manager

Summary: I had a good business stay here on 11-6-12.  The hotel was clean, parking was ample and the room was large and nicely appointed.  I would avoid the food in the lobby restaurant as it is hard to ruin a hamburger, but it was dry and boring- even when I was starving after my long ride.  The high cost of hotel parking is unavoidable due to the busy street location; and you can forget making a local business meeting at 8 am on time with the heavy congestion on Highway 5.  Allow for super terrible traffic in the area and enjoy the comfy room while you can!
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing the Sheraton Garden Grove Anaheim South for your recent visit to our area. I appreciate the detailed feedback regarding your stay!  I am glad to hear that you were pleased with our accommodations and location.  I have shared your comments regarding the restaurant with my Food and Beverage Manager, and we have taken steps to improve upon our food quality and presentation.   We look forward to welcoming you back on your next visit to our area!  Nicole Fedorchek  General Manager

Summary Heading: Newer Sheraton w too many fees
Summary: Booked this hotel for a family function andit seems this hotel is marketed for the Disney crowd but Disney is not when you consider the vast amount of other hotels within walking distance to Disney whichthis hotel is not.  It is across the street from a Target, a Cocos, a near a ton of good Vietnamese restaurants if you search on Yelp.  The room itself was roomy with a good size desk and a good size bathroom.  The bad is that now they charge $12 for parking andthere parking spaces on the side of the hotel are really tight and just asking for dents.  On our stay there it was full by nine and we had to have it valet.  With 2 kids who have there own smartphones and ipads they eacheanted wi-fi and now Sheraton has implemented a $9.95 Wi-fi per device charge.  Not per room per
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing the Sheraton Garden Grove Anaheim South for your recent visit to our area. I appreciate the feedback regarding your stay with us.  We are currently evaluating our parking situation, and identifying ways to increase spaces, and provide better flow throughout the lot. When our lot is close to full, we do offer valet-service as a convenience to our guests.  We are in the process of updating our internet service to charge 1 charge per room, instead of per device. In the meantime, please contact me directly, and I will adjust the additional internet charges off of your billing.  Thank you,  Nicole Fedorchek General Manager

Summary Heading: "Newish" regular Sheraton hotel with the feel of the 4 Points brand
Summary: I  stayed here last weekend to visit some friends in the area and to NOT visit Disneyland or any of the other tourist heavy Anaheim area attractions.  I know the area and have read the previous guest reviews, so I knew what I was getting into.  I was probably the only one at the hotel for my reason to stay.  I looks like all hotel guests do the mad rush to whatever park they are visiting from 8-10 AM, then the hotel is quiet and peaceful until the hordes of screaming children and their poor parenting guardians return between 6-8 PM.  I was not awaken by the kids shouting and screaming down the hotel hall because I was already up, but if I wasn't an early riser then it would have been a different story.  When I went to check in upon arrival, I think the front desk agent Maricella
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing the Sheraton Garden Grove Anaheim South for your recent visit to our area. I appreciate the detailed feedback regarding your stay. I will be addressing the front desk service issues with the appropriate staff. We strive to maintain a clean and well-kept environment, and we were working on addressing these issues as well.  I am sorry that you were not completely satisfied with your visit, but your feedback is very helpful for continued improvement.  Thank you,  Nicole Fedorchek General Manager

Summary Heading: Ok to stay if you get a good rate
Summary: First the positives- Check in was a breeze, the front desk staff friendly, and the rooms are BIG and in very good shape. There was pleanty of room for my family of three to stretch out. We only stayed there one night and didn't arrive till the evening so I can't talk about the ammenities.  There is a Target across the street, very handy for buying waters and snacks and several restaurants right there as well.  Negitives- if you're booking this hotel to be close to Disney, you're not. Prepare to drive there or take their shuttle. I'm a walker, but even I would not attempt this. There is a charge for the shuttle, but it's nominal, I think $3-$4 a day per person, BUT you have to pay to park your car as well, $12 a day I think.   Also, the beds did NOT feel like Sheraton Sweet
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing the Sheraton Garden Grove Anaheim South for your recent visit to our area! I appreciate the feedback regarding your stay with us.  With regards to our bedding, we are in the process of implementing the Sheraton Sweet Sleeper, and will have the bedding in all of our guest rooms in the coming months.  We look forward to welcoming you back on your next visit to our area!  Nicole Fedorchek General Manager

Summary Heading: Average Sheraton at the end of the block
Summary: Average Sheraton with nothing to write home about - the hotel is semi new which is nice and the rooms are of decent size.  The bathroom is really odd, but functional.  The bedding was fairly dirty and getting worn out which was a pity and really gross.  TV in the room is small, but it serves its purpose.  The room we were in was fairly quiet for the amount of kids running up and down the hall.  The bed is really bouncy and not to comfy, the carpet was also in need of a cleaning.  Overall the room was standard and functional.  Location wise the hotel is the last one on the block and there isn't too much to walk to near by - there are some restaurants maybe 2 blocks down and a target across the street which was nice, but the area isn't too nice.    The staff was okay, nothing
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Nice surprise in the middle of Garden Grove
Summary: We stayed at this hotel because of a wedding at the nearby Crystal Cathedral.  What a nice surprise.  The hotel is very new compared to most Sheratons, and has been very well maintained.  They do not have any suites but do have a nice club lounge for those that can get access to it.  the rooms are clean, service was friendly, and the location is central to a lot of different area attractions (Disneyland, Crystal Cathedral, Angel Stadium, The Block at Orange).
Manager Response: none

Summary: I've stayed here a couple times in the last few months and it's a very nice hotel. Friendly staff, good size rooms and close proximity to Disneyland. I would highly recommend this hotel.  Parking is $12 which I don't like but I believe it's standard for the area. They also have a shuttle to Disneyland, but I think you have to pay a few dollars. I guess it's better than parking at Disneyland but I think at other hotels, it's free.
Manager Response: none

Summary: When we got into our room I was happy to see how spacious it was! Not overly huge but a nice amount of room. The beds were comfy and there were nice fluffy pillows. The linens were clean and comfortable. Bathroom was also spacious and clean and the shower had a good spray. The hotel is in a great location also. Right across the street is a Target, Walgreens, and a Cocos restaurant. Right next door are a few restaurants including a Red Robin. We walked over for dinner one night. They also have a shuttle to Disneyland that runs every 30 min.
Manager Response: none

Summary: my trip started out bad when my wife and i booked a room at a ramada limited in buena park we got there a hour before our check in we just drove 5 hours we had tickets to a event in hollywood we had to hurry up and get to with la traffic the guy refused to check us in we could see no cars in the lot the windows curtains were open we could see clean vacant rooms so we got ready in the bathroom in the lobby we went to our event came back at one in the morning the night guy checked us in we had booked two queens their were 3 of us he gave us a king argued with us told us to take it up with hot wire not his problum we called hot wire they refunded our money but we didnt have a room we are 5 hours away from home on a limited budget  already had money on room we ended up sleeping in
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Dirty floors, toilet too close to the wall, not Sheraton quality.
Summary: Dirty floors in lobby, elevator, hallway and room. We spilled water on our flood so we placed a towel there to soak it all up. The water and dirt from the rug turned the towel brown! Shampoo carpets and vacuum twice a day people! Spa temp out of order, only hot water for one shower and got tired of cold showers. Questioned a lot when we requested extra towels but we had four to a room but three towels. Desk did have free sewing kit. Everyone at front desk nice. Twice we walked past irate guests upset with staff on desperate days. I do not recommend. Stay at the Ayres.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: They're only a pit stop for Disneyland
Summary: Upon check-in with my three grandkids, they neglected to tell me they were putting me in a room with only a King-sized bed. When I went back down to question this, they said, "Sorry, that's all we have." Okay, so I need a roll-away, I'm pretty flexible. "That'll be $20 a night." So they can't put me into a room with two queens and then want to charge me $20 more as a result? The next day the more professional and better trained staff made it right, but their evening staff is clearly not well trained. While there, we heard at least three other people get animatedly upset about different issues. Ultimately, this is just a pit stop hotel. The shuttle service to Disneyland was decent for three bucks. Easy walking distance to a few restaurants and Target. Parking was pretty crowded
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Not fit to be a Sheraton

The hotel will NOT honor confirmations especially if you're booking through a third party (Starwood, Priceline). Expect to receive additional charges on your bill. Expect to get additional charges for unknown services after you leave. Expect it to be difficult, if not impossible, to get to the charges removed. Expect an overall lack of customer service.  Here are the gory details.  We booked two rooms on the club level through Starwood.   We used existing points and purchased additional points to get the rooms.  We received confirmations from the HOTEL confirming the rooms and the rate.    On the morning of checkout, received the bill an

Summary Heading: Do not go here if you have a dog...
Summary: Do not go here if you have a dog... I stayed two nights and was charged $150.00 for my dog to stay.  (Small Dog) That is on top of the nightly rate for me to stay.  And the $12.00 for parking in an already full lot.  And $10.00 for a slow Internet.  I'm a Gold Preferred Guest with Starwood and spend 90% of my stays at Sheraton.  I will not be going back to this Sheraton again.  There are two others in Anaheim and both are better.  The most I've ever paid for my dog staying at Sheraton is $20.00 a night.  And that was at a very high-end Sheraton; where I got a dog bed and dog treats.  This Sheraton obviously does not want people to stay with their family pet.  They should just have rules about not allowing them.  Not surprise you with an exorbitant fee.  Don't go here.  Unless

Summary Heading: Great deal and excellent customer service.
Summary: Wonderful people and clean rooms. We have been watching many episodes of Hotel Impossible and Hotel Hell and knew exactly what to look for. Comfortable beds and large rooms. Great deal and a great experience!
Manager Response: none

Summary: No free Internet at room, and you have to pay $10 for service. Tried to pay for the Internet, and it never worked, and the problem could not be resolved the same day, so I had to give up keeping trying. Be careful, my rooms (I had two rooms booked) were supplied with one bottle water each. and they were NOT free. Do not make your 'safe' assumption just because the water is not marked with price. It's more like a trap to me, untill I by chance asked, the hotel told me I had been charged. Very 'nice'!
Manager Response: none

Summary: We got our hotel room through Priceline, and if we had reserved through Sheraton, it would be overpriced for what it has to offer.  Parking is over $10 per day and a charge to use Internet in room.  The room is nicely decorated but not clean as we found black stains on 2 out of the 4 pillows/pillow cases.  Hotel staff did replace the pillow promptly.  Too far from Disneyland to walk, shuttle is a must.
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing the Sheraton Garden Grove Anaheim South for your recent visit to our area! I appreciate the feedback regarding your stay!   I am sorry to hear that you encountered a problem with the pillows in your room. I am glad that our staff was able to remedy the problem in a timely and efficient manner.   Our rates, and the pricing of our additional services, are evaluated on a regular basis, and I can assure you are we are priced very competitively for our area.   We look forward to welcoming you back on your next visit to our area!   Nicole Fedorchek General Manager

Summary Heading: Quite nice once you get into the hotel
Summary: This hotel provides very good service at consistently high Sheraton levels.  The hotel guests seem to be a very odd mix of Disneyland tourists, and business people whose clients or meetings are in the Garden Grove / Anaheim / Santa Ana area.  Being at the hotel on business, it was amusing to see so many families returning to the hotel sunburned and exhausted from a day at the park.    If I had a criticism, it would be that the hotel is in a very average part of town, and there are few dining and sightseeing options close to the hotel.    Good service and consistent Sheraton quality.
Manager Response: Thank you for the feedback regarding your stay with the Sheraton Garden Grove Anaheim South! I am glad to hear that you were pleased with your stay!   Since we are located less than 2 miles from Disneyland, we do get a lot of vacationers, as well as business travelers going to the Anaheim, Garden Grove, Santa Ana, and Orange areas.   There are several unique entertainment/dining venues in the area, including The Outlets at Orange, GardenWalk, Downtown Disney, Westfield MainPlace, and of course, the Disneyland Resort. Our staff would be happy to assist you with obtaining information and directions to these venues on your next visit to our area!   Thank you, and we look forward to welcoming you back at the Sheraton Garden Grove Anaheim South!   Nicole Fedorchek General Manager

Summary: After all of the negative reviews I had read, I have to admit that I was wary about our stay at this hotel before we arrived. We had booked via a third party and heard that they were not always welcoming or happy to grant special requests. We needed 2 beds as there were 4 of us and at the recommendation of another person who had stayed there, we called the day of our arrival to request the 2 queen beds and had no trouble at all upon check-in. I cannot say enough about how friendly and accommodating the staff were to us. They brought us up extra towels and toothpaste as we ran out of both.   We found the room to be clean and spacious. The beds were comfortable. The walls were a little bit thin but our neighbours were not loud so it didn't bother us. The bathroom was tricky
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing the Sheraton Garden Grove Anaheim South for your recent visit to our area! I am glad to hear that you were pleased with your stay!   Feedback from our guests is extremely important to us, and we have recently implemented some changes to improve our service and quality. I am happy that we had a pleasant experience, and I will utilize your comments to continue our focus on enhancing our guest experience!   We look forward to welcoming you back on your next visit to our area!  Nicole Fedorchek General Manager

Summary Heading: A definite oasis after our long day at Disneyland
Summary: I don't know if it was my friendly husband's requests or just that we were tired, but we had an excellent stay at this Sheraton.  Yes, we bought online and got a great deal but my husband decided to call in the week of our trip, requested a special room for our anniversary and mentioned our Starwood membership.  The staff came through with an excellent room on the 6th floor.  The furnishings were clean and stylish.  In addition, the bathroom was luxurious (compared to home) and they even had a special treat set up for us in what they call the 'enhanced' room.  We were so ready to crash with our midnight check-in after being in a hot, humid amusement park.  I had read the reviews here and anticipated thin walls and pungent smells but we didn't hear or smell anything unacceptable.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Not horrible nor was it a fantastic stay.
Summary: I was only here at this hotel for one night before the Disneyland Cars 5k run.  Booked a two bed room and check-in was fast and easy, as was getting to our room. The room was a regular size hotel room, nothing terribly fancy. I did not try to use the internet or the business center this time as I was only there for a short period.  Pretty close to Disneyland and it IS a walkable distance but I wouldn't attempt to walk it with little children. From what I understand, there is a shuttle bus that would take you to and from the park but I drove to Disneyland since I had to be there earlier than when the shuttle time started. There is a Target right across the street also and so if you're in need of anything you forgot to bring, it's terribly convenient.  The staff was friendly and
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great stay at the Sheraton Garden Grove
Summary: Stayed 3 nights on a trip to Disneyland.  The room was spacious:  2 double beds and lots of room. Large bathroom, plenty of towels.  QUIET - didn't hear anyone except doors opening/closing.  No fridge in the room, but we had a cooler and there was an ice machine on the floor.  Paid $12 nightly for parking, but for an extra $3/day this included unlimited access to the disney shuttle, which runs every half hour and is very timely AND internet in the room. The staff were very nice and friendly.  Across the street is a Target with discounted Disney merchandise.  Had breakfast in the room:  coffee and donuts.  Wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: After having stayed 28 days in the past two month in another Sheraton I can tell you that this location is a lot better. It is worth the extra money to stay on the top floor in a club room. The nightly snack was very tasty and the breakfast was also good. There is an espresso machine for use but I don't think that it makes very good drinks. If you are going to Disney you have to pay for the shuttle which stops outside every half hour. The times did not work for us so we just drove the 1.5 miles.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Going to Disney? Unless you are a Starwood member or have older kids, not best option around.
Summary: While we had a good stay, and room was reasonably priced, we had a baby and toddler and this hotel seems much more geared towards a biz traveler than families. The pool is small. No bathtub in our room and to get a shuttle to Disney or California Adventure, you have to go out back behind hotel to wait. Why is it so hard to pick up/drop off at front lobby area?! I worked at a Starwood hotel in past and we were supposed to be very kind, helpful to guests...this hotel staff seemed pretty fair, but not gushing. The housekeepers were the nicest, though. Also, If we didn't get our upgrade to the Club level, I think we would of been disappointed. At Club level you got a free refrigerator. And breakfast and happy hour appetizers. With two small kids, free breakfast and a frig mean a
Manager Response: none

Summary: The Sheraton name used to mean quality but this is no longer the case.  Judging from the few Sheratons I've stayed in recently including Garden Grove,  the Sheraton is the runt of the litter in the Starwood family.    Customer service including the front desk, reservations office both corporate and local, and management was subpar.    The room itself was large but reeked and I had to spray the entire room including curtains, carpets and bed spreads with febreze ($4.99 at the target across  the street).   There were also hairs in the bathtub.  I did check for bed bugs and found none.   Considering this hotel was rated a 3 1/2 star property on both priceline  and hotwire, the amenities were few and far between and not worthy of this rating.   Don't believe the ratings on 3rd party
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed here for an end of summer Disney trip. I found the place to be clean, well kept, conveniently located and reasonably priced. I didn't deal with the staff much since we ate elsewhere and didn't utilize the shuttle to Disney. The beds and bathrooms were spacious and updated.  Regarding the $12 per night parking fee...people, get a clue about parking...this place is a mile from Disneyland. You will pay for hotel parking....that's just a reality with hotels in high demand areas...get over it. As for getting to and from the parks, we drove to Disney and parked in the huge garage for $15. With a large group such as ours, it made more sense than the shuttle plus more flexibility time wise. The workout facility was nice and clean. Kids enjoyed the pool area.  I would stay here
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Very good hotel, near to Disney and Target
Summary: Moved to here after disastrous stay at a 'boutique' hotel that was a cheap motel in disguise with a 24 hour pub lobby. So the difference in class and service was stark. The room is large and clean. Easily fit 2 adults and 2 children. Decent size bathroom. The area is in quiet area opposite a Target store. Free Internet in lobby. Shuttle to Disney leave every 30 mins and cost USD3 per adult per day unlimited. Children free. This is good to have as we need a rest in the afternoon to recharge. We book on the day itself at sheraton website and got a very good pay age deal. Tried a few weeks before but got higher price. We register as starwood member and got better room on 6th floor. Parking though cost USD12 per night. Swimming pool is tiny. Staff got the hotel rate wrong as they

My 10 night booking was completed through Priceline 4 months in advance.  I called the hotel directly to make my request for 2 queen size beds and my request was taken. Summary: Stayed a few weeks ago.  Had called numerous times to ask about bed type.  Was told because I booked via a third party that they could not take any special requests.  aka  price line/Expedia/hotwire customers  get cheaper rates and get cheaper crappier rooms and service.  Treated with disrespect each time I called.  I called the national 800 number and they claimed they could not do anything or even access the reservation since I booked via third party.  They left a message for the Garden Grove reservation office to call me which never happened.  They wouldn't even let me pay for an upgrade.   The room assigned to me did not meet our needs.  Room was well kept and clean.  A hotel this level should not be charging for internet even though there are other upper tier hotels in the
Manager Response: none

Summary: My husband and I stayed here during a recent trip to Disneyland.  The hotel was clean and modern, with a very attractive lobby.  As with most hotels around Disney, parking was extra; however, for $15 they offered a parking package which included wifi, valet and shuttle service to the parks.  We didn`t use the shuttle, but sounded like a nice option.  Our room was very clean and modern with attractive furnishings.  The bathroom was great, with a large glass shower.  All was appreciated after a 12 hour day at Disney.  The bed was comfortable and the linens were very nice.  It was a quick, but enjoyable stay!

Summary: When we first arrived at this hotel, I came in and it looked nice. One of the few positive things about this hotel was the lobby and business center. Then, we went to go check in... They said we wouldn't have a room for another couple hours because there were still people in our room from the night before. Unfortunately, we couldn't even use the computers because you needed a room and last name to log in. Okay, I can just use the internet on my tablet... Well, wifi cost $10 a day, what a ripoff! As we waited for our room, we all became more frustrated and tired (we woke up at 2:30am and sat on a five hour flight). After FOUR hours we finally got our room. Summary: We stayed in February 2012 and had a great time at Disneyland. The rooms were very clean and modern. The front desk was very helpful and friendly at all times.The shuttle was always on time and was so easy to take back and forth to the parks. A little heads up, this Sheraton is the furthest location from the parks, but again, the shuttle was on time and the kids loved to ride in it. This hotel is located right in front of TARGET and a few nice restaurants right next door.I will be returning...

Summary Heading: This is not a 3 star hotel. Shuttle Service is sketchy from this hotel.
Summary: I have stayed at several hotels (Hilton, Ayres, DoubleTree) near Disneyland in the past year and this is the worst one.  Unfortunately, I used to book through Hotwire and this was rated as a 3.5+ star hotel.  In my opinion it's not even a 3 star.  I had the bad fortune of ending up at this hotel twice before deciding I will never again book through Hotwire without knowing the hotel, and I will make my best efforts to avoid Sheraton.   Let's start with the good points: 1) Near Disneyland 2) Rooms are pretty clean 3) Price is okay  Bad points and the reasons why I will never stay at this Sheraton again.  1) Not the best Disneyland location 2) Rooms are small 3) Walls are thin 4) Pool is small 5) Staff seems very unprepared when you ask questions, and front desk is not as friendly

Summary Heading: Go to the Hyatt Garden Grove
Summary: I wish I could have given a lower rate. If you want good customer service and a place to be able to sleep.....do NOT stay here!!!!!!!!!!My wife and I checked out and left to the Hyatt Garden Grove which is within walking distance.  Reasons?  Walls in their small rooms are paper thin....no way to sleep ...you can hear everything...people walking in the hallway...people next to your room...etc..and if you complain the manager will make an anemic attempt to resolve the problem.  She will not provide options....and will not see you personally.  Bad customer service...Additionally if you want to spend time at the bar....you will get your wish..you have to wait until employees finish their conversations before you are attended to.  Go elsewhere people!

Summary Heading: Sheraton Garden Grove delivers a GREAT stay again!
Summary: We have stayed at this hotel several times in the past and AGAIN they deliver with superb results.    Easy check in, comfortable rooms, large bathroom, great club level, and a very polite staff.   I highly recommend this hotel!!!   We will be heading to Disneyland again in October and booking our rooms here again for sure.    Our favorite part of this hotel is the Club Level.  Breakfast is included and the Club Lounge has lots of room to spread out and relax.  Great for kids to hangout and relax too.    Stay here once and this will be your hotel choice every time you come back to this area.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I have used Priceline for years to obtain hotels wherever we are going and this is the first time I was treated as a very second-rate customer to the point that I will NEVER stay at a SHERATON again in my life. Keep in mind that this room was booked more than 2 months in advance, and there is plenty of accommodations available still on their website. The

Summary Heading: Easy to get to but not my favorite
Summary: I booked this hotel for myself and my granddaughter because the pictures made the pool look large and fun.  The pool was small, extremely dirty and the smell of the chlorine was so overwhelming, even from the parking lot, that it was unusable. The room was clean but smelled so musty that it was almost unbearable.  But one of my biggest pet peeves in a hotel room is when the air conditioner turns on and blows right in your face when you are in bed!  It was a hot weekend so we had to use the air, but every time it turned on at night it would wake me up if my face wasn't covered.  They are ceiling vents so I was unable to change the direction.  And then there's the smoke alarm - it has two extremely bright lights that flash every 10 seconds and you could see the flash even with

Summary Heading: Average stay, good price for Disneyland area
Summary: Our family of three stayed here for 3 nights.  I chose this hotel because of its proximity to Disneyland, although we only planned one very full day at Disneyland, and because it had a good rating on Trip Advisor.  We always stay at Disney hotels when going to Disney World in Florida, but in Anaheim with Disneyland, there are no well-priced resorts on property, just Deluxe resorts with Deluxe prices.   I am a Gold member of the Sheraton Starwood group, so I looked here.  We started off at this hotel at almost midnight, as we flew in from the middle of the country.  We were told that the elevators were broken and that they were giving us a fifth floor room.  We had 5-6 pieces of luggage with us....but no offer of help to get us up to that room. I had to ask! Summary Heading: Surprisingly good, better than the reviews implied.
Summary: I won this 7 day hotel stay on Priceline and was apprehensive as I read a lot of negative reviews about this hotel.  Ultimately our stay was very nice.  Our 2 rooms were well appointed, we weren't lacking anything.  We asked for a fridge when checking in and one was in our room before we got to it!  Being a 3rd party booked room i expected low quality treatment but didn't get that.  The staff was friendly and nice.  The parking is limited so each night when returning from Disney we had to be valet-parked, but it was complimentary and nice to get out right at the front door.  Their parking area is much more convenient than some of the other nearby hotels.  The bathroom has the features a bathroom should have, toilet, sink, tub & shower (some rooms have only a nice walkin shower).

Summary Heading: A Hotel Fit for Mickey Mouse
Summary: The treatment we received at the Sheraton Garden Grove could be described as farcically bad except that there was nothing at all humorous in the managers' utterly callous disregard for the well-being of a young child. Not only did they refuse to honor our reservation because their own reservation department had made a mistake shouldn’t accept vouchers, but they had us evicted by the police. Summary: Everytime i stay here the staff if very accomidating. From check in to check out everyone we come in contact with is very friendly and very helpful! The staff is professional and always willing to go above and beyond to make us happy.

Summary: Love this place.  I spent several months here on business.  They made me very much at home.  They always greeted me with a smile and by name.  The rooms are very nice and clean.  The beds are extremely comfortable and the pillows are just how I like them.  There is a club lounge on the 7th floor with a free breakfast and snacks in the evening.  If you are a platinum member this is a great place to stay because the 7th floor is devoted to you.  There are a number of restaurants close by.  The Gym is very nice and well maintained.  Room Service is pretty good.  There is a small bar.  You are only 2 miles from the entrance to Disney right on Harbor Blvd.  There is a Target and Walgreens right across the street if you need some things in a pinch.    The only negatives are that the
Manager Response: none

Summary: Prior to checking into this hotel, I specifically asked for a quiet room.  I checked in, dropped off my luggage and spent the entire day at Disneyland. When I returned to the room around 9:30 pm. (I had been in the room a total of 5 minutes), the people next door to me were exceptionally loud.  It sounded as if six or seven people were in the room.  There was a crying baby, someone kept kicking or hitting the connecting door, etc.  So..I called the front desk to ask if they could move me to another room.  They stated they could not as the hotel was sold out.  An employee knocked on my door and stated that they would tell the "neighbors" to be quiet. I told them sure you can tell them to be quiet but you cannot regulate a crying baby.  As soon as the Sheraton employee left, the
Manager Response: none
