Summary: The rooms we're always cleaned. The shuttles to Disneyland came every half hour. It was within walking distance of restaurants. Target is right across the street, in case you need to wash your clothes there is a laundry mat near target. The staff were helpful, friendly, courteous I would definitely stay here again. especially while Joe's Italian Ice is down the street. :D
Manager Response: Dear "Affordable and comfortable",  I'm so happy that you enjoyed your stay with us. Yes, very busy time for all the Hotels in the Disney Corridor & I'm gald that we made your Vacation a memorable one.   We look forward to having you & your family back the next time you visit the Anaheim/Garden Grove area.   Sincerely,  Rick B. Ross General Manager

Summary: We went to a family reunion in Anaheim and stayed at this hotel to sleep. The pillows were soft, large, comfortable and made me fall asleep fast. Average size for 2 person with a king size bed. Close to Disneyland but not walking distance. Good choice to stay if you don't want the crowds coming from Disneyland. Breakfast was just average. I don't recommend it.  Parking and WiFi are free if a Starwood Preferred guest.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Good luck to you.. Check out Yelp Reviews
Summary: Good luck to you if you stay here....  Dishonest staff. My daughter was bitten after a night at this hotel. Three bites at the top of her arm. We were put in a different room and assured they would check the room... Even told they would bring in a company to check.  When we inquired asking for the data from the company we were given the run around. We have been talking to consumer affairs with in Sheraton. We believe Sheraton garden grove lied to us, they never called the company they said they would call... Have been unable to produce a report. All that was done for us was access granted to The club level so we could get appetizers, as a goodwill gesture. Which even turned into a debacle ....  In the eve when we returned we couldn't get access to the lounge to get our kids a
Manager Response: none

Summary: Our family of 4 stayed here for 9 days last month. Highly recommended if you preferred to have a rest and hate the noise of little kids screaming. It is located at the end part of Harbor Blvd. but the every half an hour shuttle to Disneyland makes it easy. Target in front of the hotel and Starbucks downstairs. The room is a little bit outdated but clean. The bed and pillows are very comfy, staff are helpful and accommodating. We stayed in the preferred guest only floor and we love it.
Manager Response: none

Summary: but not wonderful. The parking lot was crazy!  Loved we didn't have to pay for parking or the shuttle.  We had reservations he asked if it was for one night, I told no we're til Fri, then he said your checking out Thursday. NO Friday.  Then he he stated writing the Thursday date on everything.  So once again I tell him Friday.  He the looked at me and said "you told me Thursday".  The rooms we're always cleaned.  The shuttles to Disneyland came every half hour. It was withing walking distance of restaurants.  Target is right across the street and in case you need to laundry there is a laundry mat near target.  I would stay here again if they taught the desk people to listen to the guest! P. S. The walls are thin. We could hear screaming children like they were in our room.
Manager Response: Dear "It was nice",  So sorry about the Parking Lot. Yes, during Peak Season parking spaces are at a premium here. I will definitely address your concerns with my employees at the Front Desk regarding the miscommunication. We do have a very convenient location for Target...as well as several surrounding restaurants within walking distance.   We look forward to having you back again the next time you are in the Anaheim/Garden Grove area.   Sincerely,  Rick B. Ross General Manager

Summary Heading: Fabulous hotel close enough but yet far enough
Summary: I absolutely adored this hotel.  The beds were a bit hard for my taste but overall a great stay.  Starbucks in room and at the hotel bar was fantastic way to start the day.  Several restaurants within walking distance and a Target across the street for incidentals and cheap way to stock up on water, etc for your Disney trips.  The shuttle was a perfect way to get there and back.  If you dont want to be amid the hustle and bustle of Disney but still relatively close, this is a fantastic option.
Manager Response: Dear "Fabulous hotel close enough but yet far enough",  Thank you for your kind words about your stay at the Sheraton Garden Grove/Anaheim South.   We do have the patented Sheraton Sweet Sleeper Bed so I'm a bit surprised to hear that your Bed was hard, my sincere apologies. We pride ourselves on excellence in all aspects of the Hotel....especially when it comes to our Guests getting a good night sleep.   Happy to hear that you enjoyed the Starbucks in our Bar, many Guests find this a great way to start their morning before heading to the Park. The Shuttle is an inexpensive way to get to Disneyland if you don't want to pay the $15 per day Parking Fee there, many Guests love this perk as well.   We hope to see you & your Family back very soon.   Sincerely,  Rick B. Ross General Manager

Summary: During my week long stay, the hotel staff was very friendly and professional. The lobby and hallways were modern and very clean. Rooms were comfortable and housekeeping did a great job cleaning up the room every morning. This hotel has a good size pool and hot tub and new equipment in the fitness center. I would recommend staying at this hotel.
Manager Response: Dear "Great Place to Stay",  I am very happy to hear that your interactions with my Team were so positive during your stay with us. We work very hard to make sure every Guest feels welcome & has a sense of "Family" during their stay.   I will certainly pass on your kudos to my Housekeeping Staff & Front Desk Team.  Thanks again & we hope to see you the next time you are in the Anaheim/Garden Grove area.  Sincerely,  Rick B. Ross General Manager

Summary: I am a big fan of Starwood as anyone can tell from my other reviews and I don't give out a lot of bad reviews, but I was pretty disappointed in this property.  It had very little to offer.  The pool is tiny and all that clean.  The parking is AWEFUL and they make you pay for it.  You also have to pay for the shuttle to Disneyland which is also pretty crowded.  Also don't expect a lot of help from the staff.  They are not very accommodating and acted like the hotel was always booked solid so they really didn't care.  It is a ways from the theme parks and not many places to eat within a short walking distance.  I will not be staying here again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: As a building and rooms its ok....add the employees and the hotel policies set by mgmt and ur burned ..... the problem is after i paid for the room 160.00$ online i had to pay parking fees which are 12.00 $/day .....shuttle is not free and its not a walking distance to disney....  why should you stay that far and be under the mercy of  their shuttle hours and their drivers ,some with bad attitude..... they left us a 16.9 oz  nestle water i thought was a nice gesture because on top of the water a note saying complementry or smthng like that and i got charged a dollar  for that water.......i asked about it but no use the employees of this hotel have a formula to run the business that are sent from heaven ...... i paid 160*3 nights plus 70 $ priceline share plus 12$ / day parking
Manager Response: none

Summary: Remember the time when you were a kid and your parents brought you to Disneyland?  You didn’t really care where you stayed as long you got to see Mickey and the Magic Kingdom?  This property is one step above that hotel with nicer larger rooms, and a plasma.  A definite great value for all SPG members with large families (i.e. pre-teens) that don’t want to use a lot of points for 2 adjacent rooms.  If you are looking for “fancy”, this is not it (maybe check out the Hyatt a couple blocks away).  This hotel is the furthest hotel property on Harbor Blvd (approx. 1.5 miles away from Disneyland), away from the mob of people and traffic surrounding the Disneyland proximity.  It has a few good family friendly restaurants (Joe’s Crab Shack, Outback, etc.) that are just walking distance,
Manager Response: none

Summary: This was our fifth visit to Disneyland and our first (and last) stay at the Garden Grove Sheraton. When we checked in (first thing at 3) we were told we could not have the room we booked (2 queen beds) for the entire duration of our stay. They checked us into a king room (with 5 people) and told us they would see what they could do. After several calls and complaints, we were moved into a new filthy room with 2 queen beds (with filthy hallways leading there) at 11pm! The soda machines were empty for the entire duration of our stay and upon inquiring about where to get soda, we were told to visit the gift shop. Strangely enough, they were completely out of soda as well. They gave us two (very smelly) towels and we were told they did not have anymore (despite the fact that we had
Manager Response: none

Summary: As a very frequent global traveler I spend over 150 nights a year in hotels. This has been the most disappointing stay in the last 12 months.  The rooms are updated, nice furnishings and comfortable beds.  You can tell they have invested in updating the furnishings in recent years.  Unfortunately there are other issues... Filthy floors, the carpets desperately need to be cleaned on all floors and in the rooms.  From the elevators to all the way down the halls there are stains everywhere and it continues into the rooms.  I would not want to be traveling with a toddler in this hotel as it is very obvious these carpets have not been cleaned in quite some time.  The service was another issue, total hit and miss depending on who you talked to at the front desk.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: WOW, Great hotel and better staff
Summary: Just began our stay in Anaheim and the Sheraton at Garden Grove was highly recommended by friends.  The moment we walked in the door we knew we were in for a great stay.  The room was spotless and big with great views.  We have a few special needs due to health matters and the staff wasted no time in getting these needs met and accommodated.    During our walk out of the lobby for dinner plans we were met by the General Manager, Rick Ross.  Nice to spend several minutes speaking with him and him wanting our feedback on the hotel.  First time in all my travel days that I have ever had a General Manager take the time to speak to me about my stay or any concerns.  The staff and Mr. Ross were top notch and unbelievable.  Can't wait to come back and stay here again. Great job Mr.
Manager Response: Dear "WOW, Great hotel and better staff",  It was a pleasure to meet you & your Family. I know you have many choices when staying in the Anaheim/Garden Grove area so we truly appreciate your patronage. Thank you for your feedback regarding my Team, they are quite good & strive for excellence every day....they will be happy to hear such a positive Review.   Thanks again & we hope to see you back again soon.   Safe Travels..  Sincerely,  Rick B. Ross General Manager

Summary: It pains me to write this as I have stayed here twice before with zero issues. I have stayed at tons of sheratons, and at there best you should not notice much, just stay and go and staff is friendly. But this place was a trainwreck from the start. First we were using there shuttle for disney. This seems like an after thought to them as they moved there pickup from the front of the hotel to the back by the pool. There is ZERO signage and no mention at checkin so were standing out front and missed the bus. All the while there employees stared at us in between hussling a tip from there newly created valet service.. also the dropoff location has people stepping over curbs and plants with kids to get through the parking lot. And no printed schedule for busses.  Then it gets worse,
Manager Response: Dear "Trainwreck",  Thank you for letting us take the opportunity to make it up to you during your stay.   As we discussed, these conditions were an anomoly as your previous stays with us were flawless. Unfortunately items occur outside of our control at times, hopefully our reaction time is what makes up for a bad experience.   Thanks again for meeting with me.   Sincerely,  Rick B. Ross General Manager

Summary Heading: Great Hotel in Anaheim.. no continental breakfast.... ;(
Summary: We stayed here 2 nights for a dance convention in Anaheim.  The hotel itself is beautiful.  Lobby is modern and well equipped.  Parking was 12/night (which most Anaheim hotels charge some parking fees).  The room was very big.  We stayed on the 6th floor.  Bathroom was clean and large.  Nice shampoos,lotions, loofa..  Loved the large shower!  Beds were a little warm.  I think they put "waterproof" mattress pads on the beds due to the large number of kids that stay.  Rooms had nice free standing closet, hidden refrigerator and nice touches.  Our room did have a strong musky smell.  The floor almost felt wet the whole time we were there.  Carpets may have just been cleaned?  Overall I would definitely stay there again.  Disneyland is about 1 1/2 miles away, good restaurants in
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed June 30th and July 1st-we had 2 rooms for our family vacation, and wanted  to say we love your hotel, this is the 2nd time we've stayed there. I love the location, easy access to freeways and activities.Plenty of fast food around this location, and close enough to Downtown Disney, but not in the chaos of it!  The rooms are always spotless and the beds are always luxurious. My grown kids loved the pool and hot tub being open 24 hours a day. We met the nicest people out there relaxing with drinks from the bar/lounge area. The staff was very nice. We will be back, we come to this area at least 3 to 4 times a year. Thank You so much, Kathy Bell and Steve Dismukes.
Manager Response: Dear "Love your Hotel :)",  Thank you for such positive Feedback regarding your stay & your continued Patronage !!!!  I am happy to hear that you visit several times per year & extremely happy that we are your Hotel of choice when traveling to the Anaheim/Garden Grove area.   We look forward to seeing you again soon.   Sincerely,  Rick B. Ross General Manager

Summary Heading: Nice Rooms but Beware Business Travellers
Summary: What worked:  The room was nice and comfortable The housekeeping service was excellent The front desk was responsive to all my requests Target is right across the street was very convenient  What did not work:  The business center downstairs was cramped and the computers constantly froze up The "free" lobby internet was usually down or so slow that you could not send basic messages The room internet "at cost" was also very slow so I had them take it off my bill and used the internet at the convention center
Manager Response: Dear "Nice Rooms but Beware Business Travelers",  Thank you for your great Feedback regarding the Hotel & the items that you enjoyed during your Stay.   My sincere apologies about the Internet issues that you incurred. We are currently in the process of upgrading all of our Bandwidth at the Hotel (Guestroom, The Link, Meeting Space, etc.)...This installation/Upgrade should be completed by July 15th & we are all very excited to go from 5MG's to 50MG's. Once complete, it will be the fastest Internet on Harbor.   Thanks again & we look forward to having you again soon.   Sincerely,  Rick B. Ross General Manager

Summary: First let me say we loved staying at Sheraton. We are annual Disney pass holders and frequent the area at least twenty times per year. We are normally Marriott die hards and Platinum members. We have not been happy with Marriott lately and decided to expand our vacation stay. We decided to roll the dice and go with the Sheraton Garden Grove. We are so very happy we chose this great hotel to stay. The check in was quick and easy and all of the front desk employees were very nice and professional. We arrived at 2:30 and are rom was ready. The room was very nice with two queen beds a nice armoire. The bathroom was very nice and had all the extras to make your stay nice. There were a few problems along the way, however the staff went out of there way to correct the problems. The hot
Manager Response: Dear "Great Family Vacation",  Thank you for your kind words about your stay with us, I will definitley share them with my Team Members. My apologies about the Chlorine levels, I will speak to my Chief Engineer ASAP regarding this area of concern.   I am very happy to hear that you enjoyed our Signature Sheraton Sweet Sleeper Bed, this is definitely one of the best amenities the Hotel has to offer. Be careful that you don't demagnetize your room key by placing your Cell Phone to close to the face of it, this does happen quite frequently unfortunately.   All is all, sounds like your Trip was a huge success & we look forward to having you back soon.   Sincerely,  Rick B. Ross General Manager

Summary: My friend and I only stayed one night (out of two), but I look forward to returning. Staff was very friendly and accommodating, allowing us early check-in and fulfilling room type request. Shuttle was quick, convenient and cheap ($3 RT). Plenty of parking, great room rate, Target across the street, close to Disney but not in the middle of chaos. Wish they offered parking discount for Annual Passholders as they are a "Good Neighbor" property, but that's more of a suggestion than a negative.  Thanks again Sheraton Garden Grove!
Manager Response: Dear "Great place!",  Thank you for your kind words about my Staff & the amenities you enjoyed during your stay.   As Annual Passholders, I know we will see you again soon !!!!!!!  Sincerely,  Rick B. Ross General Manager

Summary: We stayed at this Sheraton from June 17-20th. The service at the front desk was friendly and efficient, however better value and amenities along with equally good accommodations are easily available elsewhere in the area. The rooms are good sized and very comfortable. Huge bathroom! No closet or hanging space however, but instead a free standing wardrobe /amoire which limits you in closet space. Difficult when not traveling alone.  This property is more”resorty” and appears that it caters to business travelers more than families visiting Disney. There are extra charges for everything which are common at most other establishments in the area (despite what the management says) such as in room fridge and  wifi.  Items such as fridge and/or microwave are essential when traveling
Manager Response: none

Summary: I just returned from a 3-night stay at the Sheraton Garden Grove. Rooms were large - I was there by myself, but it would have been fine with my family for a few nights. The entire hotel was clean and well maintained. Staff was very friendly. The fitness room was not large, but adequately equipped with free weights, mats, exercise balls, plus treadmills, stationary bikes and ellipticals. I could see the pool, and it seemed a bit small.    The downsides for me were that there was no fridge in the room, at least not for an extra charge. There were computers in the lobby, but they could be slow. Also, there were some noise issues in the room. When my neighbors showered it was very loud, and they showered very early in the morning before I had to be awake, but awake I was. I could
Manager Response: Dear "Enjoyed my stay",  Thank you for your comments about the Sheraton Garden Grove. Yes, our Hotel is fresh, clean & only 4 years old this July. We are the newest Hotel in the Garden Grove/Anaheim area & pride ourselves on maintaining the product. Sheraton Fitness by Core Performance is one of our greatest selling points, I'm glad that you enjoyed your workout sessions.   My apologies for your room placement during your stay. The next time you stay with us, please ask for a Room facing Harbor & we will gladly accomodate your request.   Sincerely,  Rick B. Ross General Manager

Summary: It was nice to have a great room, bed, and shower after a long day at the parks.  The breakfast is good also.  I would stay there again.
Manager Response: Dear "It was great",  Thank you for your feedback, I will definitely share your comments with my Team !!!  We look forward to having you back again soon.   Sincerely,  Rick B. Ross General Manager

Summary: My family go to California at least four times a year or more.  This time we stayed June 20-22.  Location is good, close to Disneyland, all restaurants and shops, and Vietnamese town.   Room and service are just alright.  Disappointed because there were no safe, mini refrigerator, and no free Wi-Fi, in the room, but the good thing is four free computers for you to use in the lobby.  Might not stay here again next time if no changes in the rooms.
Manager Response: Dear "Not so happy customer",  My apologies for not having a Safe in your Room, but we do have Safety Deposit Boxes at the Front Desk available 24 hours per day. We also have Mini Refrigerators that can be rented for $10 per day, so sorry this was not comunicated to you upon arrival. Wi Fi is not Free unfortuntately, we do charge & are commensurate with the Market.   We look forward to having you back again soon !!!  Sincerely,  Rick B. Ross General Manager

Summary: It's a typical Sheraton, with a decent enough location to Disneyland. Pool is okay, lobby is fine, rooms fine, has a shuttle to Disneyland, for an extra fee. Location is right across from a mall, and has some good chain restaurants close by.  I'm jaded on Sheraton's and Marriot's, tired of paying ridiculous amounts for internet, breakfast, and parking. I'm changing to hotels that don't charge extra for things that cost them next to nothing.
Manager Response: Dear "Typical Sheraton",  Thank you for your kind words about the Hotel, Staff, Location & things to do in the area.   My sincere apologies for the Parking Fee, Internet Fee & Breakfast costs. We are commensurate with the market in all 3 aspects, but do understand your concerns.   We look forward to seeing you again soon.   Sincerely,  Rick B. Ross General Manager

Summary: This is a typical cookie-cutter Sheraton.  I have seen many of the exact same design.  Front desk service was ok.  Two people working check-in, but one was busy doing something else.  In my opinion, don't be at the front desk if you are not going to be checking people in.  Even though we were supposed to get a room upgrade, we were in one of the smallet rooms on the property.  Room was nice with a great shower.  Pool kind of small, but the water temperature was nice.  Target is across the street.  Some nice restaurants very close (Red Robin, Cocos, Joe's Crab Shack, etc.).  We had access to the club lounge which gave us a nice breakfast in the morning and ok snacks at night.  A little overpriced for location and amenities.  We chose to drive to the Disneyland parking lot and
Manager Response: Dear "Nice stay for Disneyland",  Thank you for your comments about the Sheraton Garden Grove. I will definitely look into the  issues that you mentioned in your Review to see how your experience may be enhanced the next time you visit the area.   Sincerely,  Rick B. Ross General Manager

Summary: Stayed June 13-15.  Received good price via on-line booking but this is not your typical Sheraton, more on the lower end of chain.  Personnel were friendly and ok.  Breakfast in restaurant was horrible experience.  No wonder nobody was in there when I ate the morning of the 15th at 7:30 AM.  Room was good size and clean.  Overall experience would take me elsewhere the next time I visit this area.
Manager Response: Dear "Good Price but not typical",  My apologies for not meeting your expectations during your stay in June. I will definitely bring your comments to the attention of my Food & Beverage Director & reach out to you personally to discuss further.   Sincerely,  Rick B. Ross General Manager

Summary: We love our SPG American express card because we use the points to book at Starwood Hotels.  This is our first stay here.  It's a great location just about 2 miles from Disney. We had 3 families here to go to a Saturday night Angels game.  The hotel looks new, the room was very clean and comfy.  The pool was small, but heated.  If you're looking for a place to stay for a long weekend this is a great hotel.   Yes Target is just across the street.  I think it's a plus.  They have Disney stuff you won't find at any other Target!
Manager Response: Dear "Another great Starwood hotel",  Thank you for such great feedback regarding your Stay, my Team will be so happy to hear these comments !!!!!!! We work extremely hard every day to make sure that all of our Guests are taken care of & have a great Trip.....so glad that you enjoyed yourself.   See you soon !!!  Sincerely,  Rick B. Ross General Manager

Summary Heading: Rocio Corona should not be employed in customer service.
Summary: A woman by the name of Rocio Corona checked me in. She appeared uninterested in customer service (lacked eye contact, never smiled once), was not clear in her communication (rambled some rehearsed lines, appeared impatient when I asked her to repeat them), and was overall, unprofessional. On my first night there, I learned that the blow dryer in my room was not working so I approached the front desk and asked for a replacement. She quickly responded, "No, we don't have extra blow dryers." I clarified I didn't need an extra one, I needed one that worked. A young woman standing next to her said she would take care of it. Similar to this incident, the rest of the staff was nice and friendly. I send over 100 of my staff here every year for conventions. After this experience, I will
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Still has some kinks to work out, but very nice
Summary: The hotel is very new, located close to Disneyland.  Very nice room.  No literature in room to help with visit.  No room service menu.  Hotel was nowhere near full and we were given a room that overlooked the air conditioning equipment on the second floor.  View was horrible.  Staff very, very nice and responded to requests quickly.  I would stay again, but ask for a different room.
Manager Response: Dear "Still has some kinks to work out, but very nice",  My sincere apologies about the Room Service Menu & other local literature. That is definitely an anomoly as every room comes equipped with both.   Sorry to hear that your view was less than expected as well. We do our best to place all of our Guests in areas that are visually appealing. Next time we can get you in a room with a view of Harbor.   Thank you for your Feedback & we hope to see you again soon.   Sincerely,  Rick B. Ross General Manager

Summary Heading: No room for customer service or a family of 5
Summary: You know when you book a room and it asks you how many children and their ages so it can provide you a room that will accomodate your family?  Well that's just for show at this hotel.  But that was just the beginning...  We booked this room through a third party hotel search company that billed the room as accommodating 5 people.  When I checked in, the front desk person told me it was a room with 2 queens.  I asked for a roll away and she said she couldn't put a roll away in that room because it was a fire hazard.  I told her that I booked a room for 5.  She said it would sleep 5 if I put one of my children on the floor.  Let me repeat that stunning recommendation..'put a child on the floor'.  I checked the sign on the door again.  This is a Sheraton, right?  In name only it
Manager Response: Dear "No room for customer service",  My sincere apologies for the experience that you had during your stay with us. Unfortunately Bed Types are not guaranteed when booked through 3rd Party Sites. I was extremely happy to see that we could accomodate your request for a Queen/Queen.....but yes, our Fire Code does not allow for there to be a Rollaway in a room with (2) Queen Beds.....so sorry. This is the standard Fire Code for all Hotels as well.   We do have Refrigerators in all of our rooms on the 6th & 7th Floors & have several that can be rented for a Daily Fee. Our Parking Fee is commensurate with the Market.....in fact less than most Hotels as they charge $13 per day & above.   Thank you for your encouraging words about the Fitness Center & Pool, so glad that you enjoyed both during your stay.   We look forward to getting another opportunity to make a 1st Impression, please call me personally to make your next Reservation.   Sincerely,  Rick B. Ross General Manager

Summary: I've been on the project down in OC since last May and had the pleasure of staying at Sheraton. I was introduced to the location by a few colleagues that were also staying. After a few weeks, it was understanding why we chose the location. Our rate was phenomenal, the service was above average, and availability was always there for us.  I would like to personally thank Rick, Jennifer, and Martha for making my stays there a good experience that I have gone to use two hotel chains and not sticking to my normal one.
Manager Response: Dear "Second Home",  We truly appreciate the fact that we can be considered your "Second Home"....that's what it's all about in the Hospitality Industry. We love having you as much as you enjoy staying here. Everyone from your Project Team has been great to work with & we look forward to a long & succesful relationship together.   Thanks again & have a great weekend !!!!!!  Sincerely,  Rick B. Ross General Manager

Summary: When we first arrived we were treated as a VIP, and asked if we required any help with our bags or  any addional help .   We got to our room, and what a wonderful room it was, the nicest King size bed, the best pillows any 5 star Hotel could offer. When we needed additional towles they were verey prompt in sending up house keeping to our every request.  The Manager Rick Ross has got to be the most amazing one yet, he made sure that everything was all set up before we arrived, and he knew how much we wanted a tub rather than a shower, and he went the extra mile.    If anyone gets the chance to visit Anaheim for family, friends or fun.  Be sure to stay at the Sheraton you will never stay anywhere else again..And we have stayed at every hotel there is on Harbor Blvd.  This is where
Manager Response: Dear "Best Stay Ever!!!",  I'm so very happy that You & your Husband enjoyed your stay at our Hotel. My Team will be very pleased to hear your feedback & positive comments.   I'm also happy to hear that you received the Tub you requested, I know that was most important for you to enjoy your stay with us.   I wish you the best of luck & look forward to seeing you again soon, take care.   Sincerely,  Rick B. Ross General Manager

Summary: I have been traveling to Orange County every week for the last 11 months straight. I have stayed in several different hotels in the area, but for the last 6 months I have stayed at the Sheraton Garden Grove simply because of the service and the people. It really is my home away from home. All of the staff is extremely helpful and nice. I have never had an issue with my reservations, my room is always immaculate, and if I ever need anything they help me right away.   The fitness center is great and I love that the pool and hot tub are 24 hours. I have stayed there long enough now that all the staff know me by name as soon as I walk in the door, I've met the general manager Rick and the director of sales Jennifer and they are both amazing at taking care of whatever their patrons
Manager Response: Dear " My Home Away From Home",  Thank you for your kind words about the Sheraton Garden Grove & the Team here !!!! I will definitely share your comments & we are so happy that you have chosen our Hotel as your "Home Away From Home".  Please don't hesitate to ask for assistance when you are here, my Team & I are here to make sure your stay is flawless. Thanks again & we look forward to another 6 months !!!!  Sincerely,  Rick B. Ross General Manager

Summary Heading: Best Sheraton in the Anaheim area
Summary: As a Non-Californian who travels to Anaheim once a month to use my Disneyland Annual Passport, I've had the opportunity to stay at each of the area starwood hotels.  Without question, this hotel is the best in the area.  The hotel is clean and modern, and (key for me) has working climate control in each room. The other two sheratons are older - one much older - and some rooms will have you sweating your way through the night otherwise.  The staff here are beyond wonderful. They recognize me by sight now for our monthly visit, and they have always done all they can to ensure we have a great stay. I'm SPG Platinum, and am used to exemplary treatment at the hotels I stay at, but the feel here is much more personalized, without a doubt.  Parking is strange here. The lot isn't setup
Manager Response: Dear "Best Sheraton in the Anaheim area",  Thank you for your kind words about our Hotel. Yes, we are the newest Sheraton in the Anaheim/Garden Grove area & have a beautiful property !!! The Hotel is very modern & does have very cold A/C Units.   So happy to hear that you are an SPG Platinum Member & get such great recognition every time you stay with us. It's definitely one of the best Loyalty Programs in the industry, hands down. I am sorry to hear that you have not experienced our Shuttle to the Park. It is very convenient, clean & always runs on time.  Thank you for the tip regarding the Elevator. This is the 1st I've heard of this & will definitely have my Chief Engineer look into this ASAP...   Thanks again for your patronage & we look forwad to seeing you again soon !!!  Sincerely,  Rick B. Ross General Manager

Summary: Our family stayed over a busy holiday weekend, and had a great time. The room was nice and big with a large window to bring in plenty of light. The breakfast we got was good, although it was hard finding seating because of the holiday weekend.   It is very close to "The Mouse" and restaurants within walking distance.   My kids spent several hours in the pool and hot tub, although since there were a lot of people visiting I think the hot tub or pool chlorine was off because my daughters hair was a little on the green side when they were done. I think it was the hot tub since there was a lot of foam in it (never seen a hot tub like that before).
Manager Response: Dear "Nice place, good location",  Thank you for sharing your feedback regarding your stay over the Holiday Weekend. Very busy one for us, I do apologize for you not getting seating during Breakfast. Unfortunately the Club Lounge does fill up quite quickly during Sold Out Weekends....especially Holidays, so sorry.   Yes !!!!! We are very close to Disneyland & many of our Guests find the surrounding area quite appealing, great Dining options (in addition to our own Rest. & Target across the street)....makes your Vacation to Disney a breeze :)  Thank you for the tip regarding the Hot Tub & level of Chlorine, I will speak with my Chief Engineer ASAP.   We look forward to having you back once again soon.   Sincerely,  Rick B. Ross General Manager

Summary: Newer Sheraton hotel, room was very nice, better than expected.  Great value and close to Disneyland.
Manager Response: Dear "Great value, better than expected",  Thank you for your kind words about our new Hotel !!!!!! Yes, only 4 years old this Summer & the Hotel looks very fresh, modern & clean. I will definitley share your comments with my entire Team & we look forward to having you back sometime soon.   Sincerely,  Rick B. Ross General Manager

Summary: Great quiet rooms, large bath, club lounge is totally worth the extra $.  Can't figure out why others feel this place isn't perfect, except maybe for the parking free ($12), but all the other hotels nearby charge the same or more anyhow, so what's the big deal.  Plus, people are always complaining about it being too far from the park and yet they have a car and complain about the parking fee. so take the car for hell's sake and skip the shuttle.  The beds there are my favorite.  At some hotels (foam mattress's like at the Marriott's and the Hilton Garden Inn with their adjustable mattress thingies) for some reason cause me to sweat like a pig in those things.  But for me the beds at the Sheraton Garden Grove are just the right amount of comfort, without going overboard with a
Manager Response: Dear "Great as ever",  Your Feedback is outstanding !!!!!!! I look forward to sharing it all with my Team & definitely hope you will be back soon.   Yes, the Club Lounge is a great daily value when vacationing or on Business & our Sheraton Sweet Sleeper Bed is one of the best in the Industry.....if not the BEST !!!!!! Great tip about Parking out by the Pool & using the side Entrance, very convenient for getting to the Elevator & your room.  My apologies for the Printer being out of Paper in the Club Lounge. This is something that our Club Lounge Attendant monitors daily & apparently had some heavy usage during your stay.   Thanks again & we look forward to seeing you soon !!  Sincerely,  Rick B. Ross General Manager

Summary: We had reservation for this facility but did not stay when we found out that their pet policy is not so friendly.  The nonrefundable cleaning fee is $150!!!!!  Yes, $150 when the room rate is only $135 so if you are traveling with a pet, just be forewarned.
Manager Response: Dear "BEWARE PET POLICY",  Please accept my sincere apologies about the experience you had regarding our Pet Deposit Fee. Unfortunately this is our standard as we are in a Resort area & tend to have Travelers with Pets quite often during their extended vacations. This Fee is utilized to deep clean the carpets & Bedding after departure to ensure the room is clean/clear of Pet Allergens for the next Guest.  Sincerely,  Rick B. Ross General Manager

Summary: I cannot say enough about this hotel. I travel all over the country and stay in many hotels and few stand out in my mind like this one. I can ALWAYS count on a good stay here. The staff is very friendly, courteous, and attentive to my needs which makes my stay always a pleasure. In fact it's the only place I will stay in Orange County. The rooms are clean, spacious, and if you are on the concierge floor, there is a great breakfast as well. It's close to Orange County Airport, Angels Stadium, and if you are traveling, close to Disneyland, California Adventure. Just a quick shuttle bus ride down the street. If you want a great hotel at a great location, for a great price, with outstanding customer service.....THIS IS FOR YOU!
Manager Response: Dear "You've Done It Again!",  Thank you very much for your patronage, loyalty & great comments on the Hotel & my Team. I will definitely share your comments with them & look forward to having you back again the next time you are in the Anaheim/Garden Grove area.   Sincerely,  Rick B. Ross General Manager

Summary Heading: one of the finest hotels in Orange County, really impressive
Summary: my girlfriend and I arrived here on business on a Wednesday night, tired and wanting nothing but to enjoy a good night of sleep. check in was fast, no lines. Rocio and Julio were very professional. We parked and got to our room and found no surprises with cleanliness. We watched a movie, went to bed and woke up the next morning to have a great breakfast in the restaurant. it was a bit busy but the servers did their best to make sure our food came out warm and fresh. I would highly recommend this hotel for business travelers, although next time I go I will be taking advantage of their disneyland connections (ie discounted tickets, shuttles, etc)  I commend Rick Ross, GM, on a job well done running this property
Manager Response: Dear "one of the finest hotels in Orange County",  I am very pleased that You & your girlfriend enjoy your stay so much that you felt compelled to write about it, that truly means a lot to me & my Team. Rocio & Julio are 2 of the best Employees we have & they will be extremely happy to hear your comments.   I'm happy to hear that your Breakfast experience was pleasant as well, I will also share your comments with my F & B Team.   Thanks again & we look forward to seeing you again soon.   Sincerely,  Rick B. Ross General Manager

Summary: Ok, full disclosure:  I have a family.  A cute family--two boys and a girl.  The girl's starting to say words like "butt" for "boat" and "buff" for "bath."  See?  Cute.  Apparently, though, this Sheraton doesn't like families.  We stayed there as Starwood gold members (still waiting for my welcome gift, btw), and the management seemed less interested in helping Disneyland goers than cocktail drinkers, so my first impression is to avoid this place if you have cute kids and / or plan on attending Disneyland.  Here's my review:  Pros:  Nice digs. Fairly close to Dland.  Updated.  Buca di Beppo's nearby.    Cons:    1.  What the what ?  You have to pay for the shuttle?  We transfered from a lesser hotel that A). Gave us a full breakfast buffet, 2). Was further from Disneyland, 3).
Manager Response: none

Summary: I recently stayed for a quick trip to Disneyland.  I was impressed by the grounds and feel of the hotel.  Having your girl get excited by the roses in the front is a great way to start a trip. It is solid hotel that takes care of your every need.  I liked the food and service.  The pool was a nice bonus.  Benny at the bar was very helpful with getting me a drink upon arrival and answering my local questions.  The staff made me feel comfortable because they took an interest in assuring me and my girl were good to go with our day at Disneyland. Happy about the shuttle. I thought the rooms were modern and being a tall person I liked all the space.  Elevator was fast, and after a day at Disneyland and so many rides, just wanting to get back and relax - that counts!  Then of course
Manager Response: Dear "Wonderfully Alpha and Omega",  I will certainly share your kind words about Benny with my Food & Beverage Director. He is one of our best employees so this is not a shock.....way to go Benny !!!!!  Yes, our rooms are very modern as we are the newest of the Sheratons in the Anaheim/Garden Grove area. We have a great Pool & Fitness Center by Core Performance, make sure you check it out on your next visit.   We look forward to seeing you again soon !!!!  Sincerely,  Rick B. Ross General Manager

Summary: I stayed at this hotel for my 60th birthday weekend and could not have been more pleased with the amenities and customer service. I had never been to the area so I had a lot of questions for the front desk; they helped me with a confident & friendly attitude, had brochures on-hand which helped a lot. This made the trip that more convenient & enjoyable. We ate in the restaurant and the food was great; I even found some unique items that were delicious!
Manager Response: Dear "This hotel has everything",  Thank you for sharing your 60th Birthday with us at the Sheraton/Garden Grove.....what a true  honor !!!!   Yes, our Front Desk Staff is one of the best in the Business & I will definitely share your comments with them. They are always willing to go above & beyond to make sure all of our  Guest's needs are attended to.  Thanks again & we hope to see you soon !!!!!!!  Sincerely,  Rick B. Ross General Manager

Summary Heading: Great location for baseball, beaches, and Disneyland
Summary: Our family stayed here 4 nights in March.  Having never been to Disneyland, we knew Garden Grove was within an easy drive.  And, for a reasonable fee, the hotel will shuttle you to and from all day long.  After the Disneyland park pass sticker shock, this was a nice surprise not having to deal with overflowing parking lots.  It's also an easy drive to Huntington Beach where we stumbled into a classic car show on the streets of HB!  The Sheraton is a great hotel with friendly staff, clean, and family friendly.  Room service was quick and efficient and rooms were very clean and ready when we returned from the day, usually late.  Overall, a great experience!  Recommend Sheraton Garden Grove any time.  I had also stayed here last summer to watch Angels and new then I was coming back.
Manager Response: Dear "Great location for baseball, beaches, and Disneyland",  Thank you for your Great Review of the Sheraton Garden Grove !!!!!!!!!!! We strive for Guest Service excellence every day with our Guests & I'm very proud of my Team and happy that you had such a good experience, I will definitely share your comments.   We look forward to having you back again soon.....travel safe & GO ANGELS !!!!!!!  Sincerely,  Rick B. Ross General Manager

Summary: I stayed at this hotel for leisure with my family but it has everything to accommodate business travelers as well. The location is convenient to area attractions & freeway access. The staff went above & beyond to make our stay memorable; customer service was top-notch. The bartender in the evening was courteous & genuine as well as the front desk staff & club lounge attendants. If I ran a hotel I would want each one of them working for me. I will definitely choose this property for future L.A. visits!
Manager Response: Dear "Beautiful Hotel",  I am so happy that you got to enjoy a lovely getaway at the Sheraton Garden Grove !!!!  Thank you for your kind words about my Team, I will certainly share them & your enthusiasm. We look forward to having you back the next time you are in the Anaheim/Garden Grove area.   Sincerely,  Rick B. Ross General Manager

Summary: The family and I stayed at this hotel a couple weeks back during a trip to Disneyland and California Adventureland.  The Garden Grove is about 1.5 miles away from Disney, directly on Harbor blvd, but was in a great location.  Around there is plenty of food, access to the freeway, and it's very quiet.    This hotel being fairly new, was in great shape and our room was awesome.  One thing to be said for this place is that it's pet friendly.  Not a problem, but if you're not expecting it; a little weird.  The pool and spa are open 24hrs which is really nice especially after a late night at the parks.  The only complaint I have is not directly hotel related, but affects them because of the contract.  They've hired a shuttle company that doesn't manage its schedule very well.  The
Manager Response: Dear "Nice Hotel - Clean and comfortable",  Thank you for shariing your comments about the Hotel's great amenities & the Shuttle.   Yes, we do partner with an outside company for our Shuttle service & they do get backed up at times unfortunately......especially during peak season such as Spring Break or Christmas.  My apologies for your wait in getting picked up, I will address this with their Operations Manager ASAP. Just so you know for the next time you stay with us, the pick up/drop off location is right in front of the Hotel.....directly across from the Entrance.   Thanks again & we look forward to seeing you soon !!!!!!  Sincerely,  Rick B. Ross General Manager

Summary: This was home for a 3-day Disneyland trip with a 2-kid family. Unlike some behemoth conference hotels, this property is nicely contained and not sprawling.   Sometimes it isn't so much that a hotel has no issues, but what they do when there are issues. Construction in the parking lot limited available parking space but the valet service was made available for the regular parking charge. A clogged tub drain meant showers the first morning were in 3 inches of water in the bottom of the tub, but housekeeping noticed the problem and it was fixed.    I recommend Cocos for breakfast, it is across the street from the hotel. Good food, better pricing than the hotel restaurant, especially for kids meals.   Swimming pool was adequate, about what I would expect from a business-oriented
Manager Response: Dear "Disney Base Camp",  Please accept my sincere apologies regarding the experience you had with our Parking Lot. We are in the process of re-striping the Lot & therfore half of the Lot was coned off & unavailable for use during your stay.   I will definitely discuss the clogged drain with my Engineering Team as we have a Preventative Maintenance Program in place & this should have not been the case during your stay.   Cocos is good, but we have a great Menu here for Breakfast & Mickey Mouse Pancakes for the kids !!!!! Hopefully you can try our Park Grill the next time you stay at our Hotel, excellent food...  Thanks again & we look forward to having you back soon.   Sincerely,  Rick B. Ross General Manager

Summary Heading: Nice Hotel, Great Location, Good Service
Summary: I have been traveling to Southern California frequently for business. I stay at different hotels in this was was during my second trip in April 2011. The location is very good, a few minutes away from Disneyland and bang opposite Target and some good restaurants. I think I was here for 2 weeks and stayed at Club Level room on the higher level a Preferred Guest.  Room was very spacious and squeaky clean. Beds were comfortable as well. Room service was great and quick. Internet was not free but being a Preferred Guest, I got it free.  For Club members, Complimentary breakfast is okay though could be improved a lot, same stuff every alternate day gets boring. Although unlimited refreshments are a great plus.  As complained by other reviewers, parking is a problem and if you reach
Manager Response: Dear "Nice Hotel, Great Location, Good Service",  Thank you for your comments regarding the Hotel & enhancements that you feel could  be made. We strive for excellence every day as we serve our guests & I wll definitely share your insight with my Team.   We do have Refrigerators in the Hotel & a Microwave at the Front Desk strictly for Guest Usage. I'm so sorry that you were not made aware of these amenities during your stay. My Food & Beverage Director will love to hear your comments regarding your Room Service experience.   Thanks again & we hope to see you soon.   Sincerely,  Rick B. Ross General Manager

Summary Heading: Very nice rooms, very accommodating management
Summary: I have stayed here twice on business and actually look forward to the room.  A very clean, new hotel.  I had a non-hotel related problem during a recent stay and management was quite accommodating to me at their expense.
Manager Response: Dear "Very nice rooms, very accomodating management",  Thank you for your great Review of our Guest Rooms !!!!! Yes, they are in very good shape as the Hotel will only turn 4 years old this Summer. I will share your comments regarding your interaction with Management to the rest of my Executive Committee Team, great to hear...  We look foward to having you back the next time you find yourself in the Anaheim/Garden Grove area.   Sincerely,  Rick B. Ross General Manager

Summary Heading: Excellent! Highly Recommended! Staff is awesome!
Summary: Our family has stayed at this specific hotel several times now and we LOVE IT! The staff is very welcoming and the rooms are great.  I highly recommend staying on the Club Level of the hotel as breakfast is included in the Club Lounge.    The Club Lounge is also a great place just to hangout with your party.  If you travel with several families like we do (8-15 people), it is a great place for everyone to meet in a comfortable space.  It offers a computer with internet access, television and a good amount of space to relax.  The rooms, beds, and pillows are comfortable.  We have NO issues with this hotel and will always stay here whenever we come to Disneyland.  As we have Annual Passes for Disney, we will be staying here at least 4 times a year.  Coming back in June (Cars Land
Manager Response: Dear "Excellent! Highly Recommended! Staff is awesome!",  We are extremely proud to be your Hotel of choice when visiting Disnelyland with your Family !!!  Yes, the Club Lounge is an excellent upgrade & well worth the amenities offerred.....including Complimentary Breakfast & Free Wi Fi. We look forward to hosting you & your family once again for the opening of Carsland !!! It will be Disney's biggest attraction to open in years...can't wait !!!  Sincerely,  Rick B. Ross General Manager

Summary Heading: One of the best experiences I've ever had.
Summary: I would like to give my fellow travelers to Disneyland a BIG tip, and that would be to bypass all other hotels and stay at the Sheraton Garden Grove! It was wonderful. Upon entry, my family and I were greeted as if by an old friend. The front desk was kind and playfully joked with my 6 year old. They answered questions about the Disneyland shuttle promptly, and gave us perfect suggestions on what to see at Disneyland. I'd like to give a special acknowledgement to Mr. Rick Ross, the GM of the hotel. He greeted us in the hall of the hotel the next day with a warm smile and asked how our stay was going. The most important aspect was he actually listened to what I had to say. He gave me pointers about the shuttle to Disneyland, and in the end he gave me his business card and told me
Manager Response: Dear "One of the best experiences I've ever had",  It was a pleasure meeting you & your family during your "staycation" & I'm glad that you enjoyed your visit to the Park as well. Please feel free to call me personally the next time you are in the Garden Grove/Anaheim area & I will personally make your Reservation for you.   Thank you for your kind words, I will definitely share them with my team !!!!!  Sincerely,  Rick B. Ross General Manager

Summary: We are Starwood members and often stay at the Sheraton so I am familiar with the Sheraton hotel standards and overall we've been pretty happy with their hotels.  Unfortunately, that wasn't the case with this Sheraton.  It definitely needs some work.    We stayed just one night after extending our trip to Disneyland and needing to relocate to a new hotel as our original hotel, the Doubletree Suites, wasn't able to accommodate our added night.  Price was actually more than Doubletree and not nearly as good at 158+ tax.  Also, their site says it's 1.5 miles from Disneyland which is not the case.    Though the hotel is new, it is already showing signs of neglect; especially with housekeeping and service.  We stayed on the Club Level which one would expect would be a top priority. I
Manager Response: Dear "New but understaffed.....needs improvement",  My sincere apologies for the carpeting in the hallways. We vacuum them twice a day (AM & PM)....but somehow the area in question was obviously missed. We had several large Groups in house during your stay & I know the Club Lounge was quite busy. We've never had more than 1 Server for the Club Lounge before so I will inquire with my Food & Beverage Director as to why this was an issue during your stay & how could we possibly enhance the Guest's Experience better by adding another Server for Breakfast.   It appears that a member of the Group (Baseball Team) in house had a Luncheon in the Club Lounge, but neglected to inform the Front Desk that they were in there. I am familiar with the Pizza Boxes & we did address this as soon as my Houseman cleaned the room shortly thereafter. The Club Lounge is a great Venue, unfortunately when the Hotel is at capacity it can be hard to find an open seat during Breakfast.   I do hope that you give all Sheratons another opportunity to make a 1st Impression, especially the Sheraton Garden Grove. Once again, my sincere apologies for your stay.   Sincerely,  Rick B. Ross General Manager

Summary Heading: Average anaheim hotel below average Sheraton hotel
Summary: I checked into my hotel went to the room and ewww large stain on carpet. I opened the curtains and wow it was like a dingy utility like area where someone could walk. Switched rooms and it was much better. The pool area is a basic pool area but I must say the water temp of the pool was perfect for me I HATE cold water and this was great. Towels were an issue they would take the ones from the rom and replace with only 2 towels. Because I had separate reservations I had to re-check in everyday. What a pain especially when they  re-check you into the wrong room and you don't realize it till you have made your 3rd trip up. Front desk was nice. At night you HAD to valet because they put cones up on the parking spaces so they are filled although they do not charge for valet (theres a
Manager Response: Dear "Average anaheim hotel below average Sheraton hotel",  I am sorry to hear about the challenges that you incurred while staying at the Sheraton Garden Grove/Anaheim South. We pride ourselves on cleanliness so I am shocked to hear about the stained Carpet. We have all of our rooms on a rotation for shampooing & I assume this room was placed back into inventory without being inspected/accepted.   Yes, Towels do become a prime commodity during peak periods when large Ball Teams check into the Hotel. I do apologize for you not getting enough during your stay....but this is not a typical issue that we face.   I am extremely shocked that you did not enjoy our signature Bed, the Sheraton Sweet Sleeper..?? This is widely regarded as one of the best Beds in the Hotel Industry. Once again, my sincere apologies.   I am hopeful that you will give the Sheraton Garden Grove/Anaheim South another opportunity to make a 1st impression.   Sincerely,  Rick B. Ross General Manager

Summary: Very large and comfortable room, very friendly staff, free Internet in the lobby but they charge if you want to use it on your room. They charge for parking but there is street parking on the side streets. No free breakfast but there are free newspapers in the lobby. Located 2 miles from Disneyland/the Convention Center so it's a nice walk to and fro. Airconditioning worked well. You can set your TV to wake you up in the morning. I did not eat in the restaurant but they do serve 3 meals a day. Plenty of restaurants in the area.
Manager Response: Dear "Enjoyed my stay",  So happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay at the Sheraton Garden Grove. We are very proud of our Hotel & know that you have many choices when staying in the Anaheim/Garden Grove area.   Thanks again & we hope to see you again soon.   Sincerely,  Rick B. Ross General Manager

Summary Heading: Disappointing-- thank goodness it was short
Summary: It's hard for me to have to write negative hotel reviews because I am generally an easy-to-please person. It's also hard when I had such high hopes for this stay and was completely disappointed to say the least. I tried looking for the good-- and there was one small beacon of goodness which I will include below-- but overall, I was just incredibly disappointed and very happy to leave. Here's why:  So I read on their website that the hotel is 1.5 miles away from the front gate. I thought this would be no problem to walk because my husband and I run a mile or so every week. However, when we pulled up, we were a good 2.4 miles away from the front gate of Disney because we had our odometer set to measure the distance. This might not seem like that big of a deal, but it was the
Manager Response: Dear "Disappointing - thank goodness it was short",  Please accept my sincere apologies for the items reported in your Review.   Yes, we do have a Parking Fee that is commensurate with the Market & all Hotels in the Anaheim/Garden Grove area do charge for their Shuttle. There are several smaller Hotels that are closer to the Park that do not charge, but we contract with an outside Shuttle Service for transportation to & from the Park.   The week that you stayed we were extremely busy so I do apologize for hectic nature of the Valet Parking situation. We are in the process of obtaining the Lot just to the South of the Hotel to utilize during peak times & Events so this will no longer be an issue.   I am pleased to hear that you enjoyed our Sheraton Sweet Sleeper Bed. I am hopeful that you will give the Sheraton Garden Grove another opportunity to make a 1st Impression.   Please contact me personally the next time you are in the Anaheim/Garden Grove area & I will make ceratin that your next stay is flawless.   Sincerely,  Rick B. Ross General Manager

Summary Heading: Dirty Room, Terrible Pillows, & No Breakfast
Summary: I don't write reviews, but decided that I needed to write a review about this Sheraton location.  During holiday's they are understaffed.  The room we were given was still dirty (towels were on the floor from the previous folks).  We ordered breakfast for delivery in the morning, but it never showed up.  We also ordered newer pillows, as the pillows we had were flimsy, but they never showed up.  I would strongly recommend against staying at this hotel during any holiday season.  The terrible service, $12 parking fee, $9 Internet fee, & lack of staff are not worth it.  Spend your money elsewhere.
Manager Response: Dear "Dirty Room, Terrible Pillows & No Breakfast",  My apologies for what took place during your stay, it appears our Housekeeping department apparently overlooked your room somehow. The Pillows we have are new & re-ordered every month once Inventory is completed to replace any that have aged or are damaged....so I am somewhat surprised as to the condition of the Pillows that you recieved. I can assure you I will speak with my Housekeeping Manager & my Food & Beverage Director regarding your missed Breakfast as well.   I do hope that you give the Sheraton Garden Grove another opportunity to make a 1st Impression.  Sincerely,  Rick B. Ross General Manager

Summary: Yes, the hotel was beautiful, the rooms were comfortable and the location was great, but what really made my stay here memorable was how wonderful the staff treated me. I anticipated standard service but the hospitality was definitely beyond what was expected. I was able to change rooms without a problem, store my luggage all day until check in time, enjoy a wonderful breakfast and grab a shuttle to Disneyland without any worries. The staff really took care of me and I want to say thanks again! I recommend anyone traveling for any reason, to stay at the Sheraton Hotel at Garden Grove (make sure it’s this one because there are like 3 or 4 others in the same area).
Manager Response: Dear "Wow, Great Hospitality",  I am so pleased that you enjoyed your stay at the Sheraton Garden Grove !!!! We love to hear such comments & I will definitely share them with my Team.   Thanks again & we hope to see you back soon !!!!  Sincerely,  Rick B. Ross General Manager

Summary Heading: Worked well for our Disney visit
Summary: Bought these rooms via hotline or priceline....lucked out. Fairly new facility within walking distance of some major restaurants, shuttle to Disneyland, small pool, small lounge, convenient computer site, decent food, great bed and shower.
Manager Response: Dear "Worked well for our Disney Visit",  Thank you for your kind words. Yes, our Hotel is conveniently located near several local restaurants & walking distance to Target. We also have some great Food at our Park Grill, please give it a try the next time you stay with us, you won't be dissapointed....great atmosphere as well.   Sincerely,  Rick B. Ross General Manager

Summary: Stayed there to attend Disneyland. Cheapest spg points among area sheratons. 4000 instead of 7000 at other 2 decent rates. Lobby and grounds very nice, staff helpful. Disney shuttle timely and helpful though crowded. 3 bucks a day per person per day kids under 9 free. Heard shuttle stop at crown plaza down street is free but can't verify. Rooms are large bathrooms average size. Club floor was Excellent best I've seen spaghetti garlic bread fruit cheese and veggie plate for afternoon meal a full dinner! Breakfast also excellent with four hot items. Well worth the 30 buck upgrade they charged my family of four. Internet and parking both cost money also despite free room with spg points a hold was placed on my cards.... All negatives but this seems to be the sort of nickel and
Manager Response: Dear " Easy Upgrade to Club Floor",  Thank you for your kind words about our Hotel, especially the luxurious Club Lounge & all it's daily benefits. This is a huge plus for our Guests & I'm happy to hear that you & your family enjoyed utilizing it daily.   We look forward to having you back the next time you visit the Anaheim/Garden Grove area !!!!  Sincerely,  Rick B. Ross General Manager

Summary: We checked in and our room was clean and ready!.. Staff was very helpful. We loved that you could buy your tickets for Disney right there and that the shuttle was so easy. Great family hotel! we will visit again:)
Manager Response: Dear "Great Trip!",  Thanks again for your kind words about your stay with us at the Sheraton Garden Grove/Anaheim South. I will definitely share them with my team & we look forward to having you back soon !!!!  Sincerely,  Rick B. Ross General Manager

Summary Heading: Dissapointed & not sure where to stay when we go back this Christmas
Summary: I traveled to Disneyland with my 6 year old son last year.  It was a very special trip, just he & I, leaving the rest of the family home.  We enjoyed 5 days at Disneyland and stayed at this hotel.  Most of our service was great, we love Sheraton & all Starwood hotels, except for a disaster happened our final day checking out of the hotel.   I had checked out and was ready to leave, when I realized my son had left something important in the room.  We were heading to the airport to catch our flight & had a cab called for us.  I tried to get into our room, which was a long walk from the elevator, and the key didn't work in the door.  It had already been deactivated.  We had a lot of gear & was already running low on time.  I ran & used a courtesy phone to call down to the main desk
Manager Response: Dear "Dissapointed & not sure where to stay when we go back this Christmas",  My sincere apologies for what took place during your stay. I know this was a very busy week for us here & I'm so sorry that it took so long for somebody to assist you in this case....I am glad that you did not miss your flight though.   Hopefully your confidence in the Sheraton Garden Grove is not shaken as this was an isolated incident. We would love to see you & your family back here again this Christmas, please contact me personally to reserve the room for you.   Sincerely,  Rick B. Ross General Manager

Summary Heading: Club Level is the way to go!
Summary: We had adjoining rooms with our daughter and her family on the 7th floor.  The rooms were clean, modern, and comfortable.  It was also very quiet. Rooms are large and the towels were very thick and soft.  Our room faced Harbor Blvd. and Target was right across the street.  Club Level is the way to go!  Our favorite feature at the Sheraton was the Club Lounge and all of the perks associated with the lounge.  We had breakfast there (eggs, potatoes, bacon, sausages, yogurt, bread, pastries, fruit, coffee, tea, water, and milk).  Water, soda, and coffee also available during the day in the lounge.  The Club Lounge was a good place to go just to relax away from your room and have a cup of tea.  We had a very enjoyable stay.  Tip:  Join the Starwood Preferred Guest program.
Manager Response: Dear "Club Level is the way to go!",  Thank you so much for your kind words regarding the Hotel, in particular the Club Lounge experince you had. Yes, the Club Lounge Rooms/Floor is definitely the way to go.....pampered & comfortable are two words that come to mind :)  The Breakfast is always plentiful & the mood is always relaxing. We look forward to having you back again the next time you are in the Anaheim/Garden Grove area.  Sincerely,  Rick B. Ross General Manager

Summary: We got this hotel through a blind "name your own price" bid on Priceline and were very happy with the hotel.  We stayed for one night this past weekend while we were in town with some other family members on a Disneyland trip.    We arrived at the hotel very early on Saturday since we were meeting my brother and his family, who stayed there on Friday night, to go to Disneyland at 8 AM.  I tried to check in but the hotel was full from the night before so it was still too ealry but they let me leave my car there for the day.  The charge for parking at the hotel is $12/night.  We spent a full day at Disneyland and got back around 11 PM and checked in.  We were given room 301 with a King bed.  The room was clean with nice furnishings and a large bathroom.  The bed was very
Manager Response: Dear "Good choice",  Thank you so much for your positive feedback about our Hotel, I will definitely share this information with my Team Members.   I know that Parking at Disneyland can be a hassle & a tad bit expensive. Please make sure you take us up on our Shuttle the next time you stay at the Hotel. The cost is only $3.00 & drops you off right at the Maingate to the Park. It runs every 30 minutes on the hour as well.   Thanks again & we look forward to having you back soon.   Sincerely,  Rick B. Ross General Manager

Summary: I would like to say that I rarely give bad reviews, and to be honest, this hotel was nice and the location was great.  Unfortunately, two things happened that made me give this one a poor rating.    First, when we checked in, I requested for a double beds bedroom.  We had two kids with us and were staying for four nights.  The lady at the front desk said there was none available.  I couldn't do much except to accept whatever room she gave me, which happened to be at the end of two hallways.  However, throughout the evening, as we roamed the hallways in leaving and coming back to the hotel, we saw people checking into rooms with double beds.  I didn't make a big deal out of this and just let it be.  Our family shared one king bed for all four nights.  Second, and this is what
Manager Response: Dear "Sad but true",  My sincere apologies about the room type that you recieved upon check in. Unfortunately when you book your reservation through a 3rd Party Internet Site, the room type is not guaranteed & when the Hotel is sold out, this compounds the situation unfortunately.   I spoke with my Housekeeping Manager to discuss your lost jacket. Unfortunately the jacket was not in the room when they went to inspect it shortly after your departure? I will search our Lost & Found department personally & notify you if your jacket is located. Once again, my sincere apologies.   Sincerely,  Rick B. Ross General Manager

Summary: This Sheraton was dreadfully understaffed over President's Day Weekend:  rooms were not ready, elevator was dirty, breakfast was not completely set up  (no coffee or cereal bowls, etc) and parking was difficult.  Also, the Wifi in the lobbby did not work on our ipads and there was a  charge of $9. per day for use in the room. The hotel is well located for Disneyland and a sports center and icy hockey rink and the decor of the hotel is pleasing.  However,  it is important that management hire more staff!!
Manager Response: Dear "Understaffed",  My apologies for your experience during your stay over President's Day Weekend.   This is not a typical situation for us as we are always fully staffed & prepared for high occupancy weekends. We picked up a last minute Group & did our best to cover all shifts that were affected by this, but apparently we fell short of your expectations.   I do hope that you give the Sheraton Garden Grove another opportunity to make a 1st Impression.   Sincerely,  Rick B. Ross General Manager

Summary Heading: Probably the best place to stay for Disney....
Summary: Having stayed here twice now and previously at the Hyatt just down the road, this hotel wins hands down. Now it isn't a fancy, 5 star hotel, but what it definitely is, is a friendly clean modern hotel, with the amenities you need as a base for a trip to Disney, Universal etc.  The rooms are a decent size and contain everything you'd expect from a Sheraton Hotel. Housekeeping was always very good and the use of the Executive Lounge on the 7th Floor is a nice touch for SPG Platinum members. Little touches like a (very large!) plate of cookies on arrival was a simple touch, which makes you feel welcome!  We had a car, so didn't use the shuttle, but it was highly recommended by the hotel and given the new Disney parking arrangements which means you need to park and then get a bus to
Manager Response: Dear "Probably the best place to stay for Disney....",  Thank you for your kind words about our Hotel, my Team will be extremely happy to hear that your experience was one of the best you've had in the Disney area !!!!!!  Yes, our 7th Floor Club Lounge gets raive reviews & I'm so glad that you enjoyed the cookies upon your arrival.   Thanks again & we look forward to having you back the next time you are in the Anaheim/Garden Grove area.   Sincerely,  Rick B. Ross General Manager

Summary Heading: The best hotel on the Shuttle Route for Disneyland for ADULTS
Summary: Let me preface this review by telling you we were coming from The Red Lion - so the Sheraton was truly like a Four Seasons or Ritz Carlton in comparison.  The marble floor in the lobby was polished to a high shine and lovely purple orchids flanked the mirror by the guest elevators. No unruly children ran amok in the pool area.  It was heaven.  Omar at the front desk was extremely helpful - suggesting I upgrade the $12 per day parking charge to their Package which included internet in the guestroom and shuttle passes to Disneyland.(for an extra $3 per day it was totally worth it)  We really liked the large walk in shower, clean lines of the marble bathroom and the stylish dark wood furniture which was of high quality. The housekeeping standards were impeccable so I am sure that
Manager Response: Dear "The best hotel on the Shuttle Route for Disneyland for ADULTS",  Thank you for your kind words about our beautiful new Hotel !!!!!  The TVs we do have are great, not 42" obviously.....but still the highest grade TVs on the market. We do run a Buffet in the Restaurant during peak times, it doesn't appear it was during your dates of stay unfortunately....? It is quite expansive & highly regarded by our guests.   We look forward to having you back again the next time you are in the Garden Grove/Anaheim area !!!! Thanks again.  Sincerely,  Rick B. Ross General Manager

Summary: I wanted to share my recent experience with this hotel with you, even though the manager from this hotel said "this is not indicative of the way we operate the Hotel".  I have the memberships with the other hotel chains, so most of the time I stayed with other hotels other than Sheraton. For my last vacation in early January 2012, I decided to try Sheraton Garden Grove - Anaheim South Hotel since I was looking for a nice hotel near Disneyland Resort and with the better rate. However, my three days stays were very very disappointing, dirty sheets, dirty bath tissue, slow drain in the bath tub, a lot of dirt on the floor of the hallway ... which were all encountered at one time by me on the first day of my stay.   Since it was late at night and I had to get up very early next day,
Manager Response: Dear "Lousy Housekeeping",  My sincere apologies for the experience you had during your stay with us in January.   I will certainly look into all matters stated in your Review with my Housekeeping Manager & Chief Engineer to make sure these areas of concern are addressed immediately.   As you can see by our incredibly positive Reviews, your experience is not normal & I do hope you will give the Sheraton/Garden Grove another opportunity to make a 1st Impression.   Sincerely,  Rick B. Ross General Manager

Summary: Stayed here on a short 2 day trip in September. Got the room through Priceline ($69 name your own price). Parking was ample (although a $12 price was pricey). Check in was quick and easy. Our room was gorgeous. You can tell that the property is newer. The furnishings were nice, lots of space for our luggage. There was no closet, but a large wardrobe. The desk was nice too. No fridge was a bummer, but on a short trip not needed all that much. Also no in room safe, which I found odd considering it was a newer property. We had a King room, and the bed was super comfortable. I'm really picky since we have a temperpedic at home, but no complaints here. At first I was concerned because we had a room with an adjoining door, but I never heard the neighbors and rarely heard anyone in the
Manager Response: Dear "Great place",  Thank you for your kind words about our beautiful new Hotel !!!!!   I am so happy to hear that you enjoyed the size of the rooms & bathrooms, not to mention our nice "puffy" towels !!! I am so glad that your experience at Disneyland was a memorable one & look forward to having you back again soon.   Sincerely,  Rick B. Ross General Manager

Summary: This hotel is quite nice. The rooms are really a good size and the restaurant downstairs has great food. Don't waste your money on room service since both times we ordered the fppd was really greasy and not very tasty. The hotel shuttle is really convenient and runs every half hour which makes it really convenient to get to Disneyland and back. We will definately stay here again next trip to Disneyland
Manager Response: Dear "Nice hotel, great location",  Thank you for your compliments regarding the newest Sheraton in the Anaheim/Garden Grove area !!!!!!!!!!   I will definitely speak with my Food & Beverage Director about your comments regarding the quality of the Room Service you recieved. My apologies.....our Food & Service are typically excellent in both areas of the Hotel.   I'm happy that you enjoyed the Shuttle & look forward to having you back again soon the next time you are in town.   Sincerely,  Rick B. Ross General Manager

Summary: I decided to take my wife out for a nice weekend to Disneyland, so not to deal with traffic and parking we decided to book a night at the Sheraton Anaheim South the day before.  It took all the stress, out of going. Not only did we get to sleep in and have a drink before heading off. But we didn’t even have to wait in line for tickets since we bought them at the front desk.  The staff was genuinely friendly; Julio the bellman was extremely helpful and attentive.  Our room was very ample and clean, I’m looking forward to my next stay…
Manager Response: Dear "Stress free Disney Daycation",  Thank you for your kind Review, we strive for excellence every day & Julio is one of our best Employees.....he will love to hear your comments !!!  Please come back soon as I know your next stay will be even more memorable.   Sincerely,  Rick B. Ross General Manager

Summary: 3rd time I've stayed here in 4 years. Rooms are large, location is good and  Disneyland shuttle works well. Room service food has dropped off since my last stay 1/10. Turkey in club sandwich was processed and gross. Room had two large stains on the floor. One was still wet. For under $100 a night it is a good place to stay.
Manager Response: Dear "Good for Disneyland",  My apologies for your Room Service experience. I will definitely bring this up with my Food & Beverage Director as this is not typical of the quality we serve on a daily basis.   I also apologize for the stain in your room. We had obviously just shampooed the carpet & that room should not have been put back into Inventory.....apparently they missed a spot?
