I will definitely bring this up with my Housekeeping Manager as well.   We do hope you stay with us again the next time you find yourself in the Anaheim/Garden Grove area.   Sincerely,  Rick B. Ross General Manager

Summary: We were here for a short trip to Disneyland and it was a nice stay. The room was comfortable and the staff was very accomodating.  It was nice to have the shuttle take us to Disneyland, unfortunately the last shuttle never came when we were ready to come home and waited for over 45 minutes (12:15a-1a) for the shuttle.  We were told that the last shuttle left one hour after the park closed.  There was another hotel shuttle from a nearby hotel that ended up taking us back to the hotel.  We could have just been not paying attention to the pickup times, so I would just recommend double checking with the shuttle driver. We ate dinner in the restaurant on our first evening and the food was great, service was just a little slow.  There was only one server/bartender however we were the
Manager Response: Dear "Nice Property!",  I am very pleased that you enjoyed your stay enough to want to stay with us once again !!!!  I do apologize for the late Shuttle, this is a contracted service & not handled by the Hotel so I will definitely speak with them about this issue. I also would like to apologize for the service being slow in the restaurant. This is not indicative of the way we run our F & B Operation here & will follow up on this as well.   We look forward to seeing you again soon the next time you are in the Anaheim/Garden Grove area.   Sincerely,  Rick B. Ross General Manager

Summary: the room was very comfortable, clean and quiet, ienjoyed good sleep on every night of my stay. i took a top level "club" room that includes breakfast and evening snacks in the package, probably it wasn't worth the extra as the hotel was full and the club room facilities didn't cope well at full capacity.   staff were friendly and helpful - when i arrived i was allocated a room with connecting door and the desk staff changed it for me without hesitation when i asked - and there's a nice bar area to relax in the evenings.  i would probably look elsewhere next time i visit anaheim, but wouldn't be upset if i had to stay here again.
Manager Response: Dear "good accomodation",  I'm happy to hear that you enjoyed the amenities associated with a room on the Club Lounge Floor. Yes, the Hotel was extremely busy during your stay & the Club Lounge can become quite crowded. My sincere apologies if you had to wait in line for Breakfast long.   Yes, our Bar area is quite nice....great sleek design & has a very relaxing atmosphere.   We do hope you choose the Sheraton Garden Grove on your next visit to the area, we would love to host you once again.   Sincerely,  Rick B. Ross General Manager

Summary Heading: Superb service at a great location
Summary: We stayed at the Sheraton Garden Grove while visiting Disneyland in Anaheim.  The hotel was located just close enough to be extremely accessible by the free shuttle (a big selling point for us), but far enough away from the crowds of tourists in Anaheim.  The shuttle ran frequently enough to and from Disneyland for our needs, and was always right where the driver said they would be.  At the hotel, the front desk staff was warm and welcoming.  The General Manager even introduced himself to us and conversed with us directly.  It means a lot to be welcomed by such a wonderful staff.  The hotel was beautiful and very clean.  The rooms were wonderful and you could tell that a great deal of attention was paid throughout.  Our kids thoroughly enjoyed the visit to Disneyland (the
Manager Response: Dear "Superb Service at a Great Location",  I'm very happy to hear that your stay with us was so enjoyable. Yes, we have beautiful rooms that are very well maintained !!!!!! We just celebrated our 3rd Birthday & take great pride in our Hotel.   Disneyland is a great way to spend time with Family. I'm extremely happy that we could be a part of that & contribute to your experience at the Park with a frequent Shuttle.   We look forward to having you back again soon.   Sincerely,  Rick B. Ross General Manager

Summary: Last September my family and I spent a wonderful long weekend at this hotel. We're from Orange County, but now live in San Luis Obispo and visit often. Usually we stay in the South Coast Metro area, but were attending party in Riverside as well as taking care of some business at UCI, so needed a more northern location. We are SPG members, and make it a point to seek the hotels when we vacation for the quality and service and chose this one because of its great state rate. We had a wonderful time. We enjoyed Downtown Disney, Anaheim Gardenwalk, the Block and on a whim my husband decided to take our 6 year old to his first baseball game. The staff helped my husband get last minute Angels tickets and they both had a great time and baseball has been his favorite pastime ever since!
Manager Response: Dear "Great Location, Hotel and Staff",  I'm so happy to hear that you chose our Hotel as a "halfway" point during your Journey in September. I'm very excited that our Hotel offered you many of the luxuries that you encountered during your stay with us.   Downtown Disney, Gardenwalk & the Block are all great Amenities for our guests to enjoy.....not to mention Angels Stadium !!!!! So happy to hear that your 6 year old son was able to see his 1st Baseball Game there, amazing venue for a game.   We look forward to seeing you again the next time you are in the Anaheim/Garden Grove area.   Sincerely,  Rick B. Ross General Manager

Summary: We would highly recommend this hotel as it is extremely nice and the service is impeccable.  The staff was very friendly from check in to check out including the General Manager who was very helpful in answering questions we had about the area and Disney.  The rooms were very nice and the beds were very comfortable.  This hotel looks like a 5 star upgraded Vegas hotel inside as everything is new.  We were very impressed with this hotel including location as it was close to everything.  Most things are in walking distance.  We also used the shuttle service which was very convenient and was right on time both leaving and coming back from Disney.  We will be back here for sure.  Again a big hooray for the staff as it is hard to find good customer service these days.  This is a
Manager Response: Dear "The Place to Stay",  Thank you very much for your kind words about my Team at the Sheraton Garden Grove, they will be very happy to hear your comments as they strive for excellence every day.   I'm happy to hear that the Hotel's location was convenient for you as well, we look forward to having you back again soon.   Sincerely,  Rick B. Ross General Manager

Summary Heading: A Place To Sleep. Nothing Special.
Summary: Here for a one-night stay in January 2012. As a Starwood Platinum, no room upgrade. That's OK because I was told they don't have any upgraded rooms. But a club floor room with a view would have been nice. No mention of my Platinum status at check in. Did not feel truly welcome here right from the start. Average room; nothing special. My rate included breakfast. Had to go back down to get breakfast coupon. NOTE: Breakfast coupon is for food only; NO BEVERAGE. So coffee was three dollars extra! Beware. If you have to be in this area, and need Starwood stay/points credit, then enjoy. If not, there are many other choices within walking distance.
Manager Response: Dear "A Place to sleep. Nothing special",  Please accept my sincere apologies for the Front Desk Staff not recognizing your Platinum Status. This is an anomoly & I will certainly follow up as to why this occurred.   Hopefully you will give us another opportunity to make a 1st Impression the next time you are in the Anaheim/Garden Grove area.   Sincerely,  Rick B. Ross General Manager

Summary: We stayed here for 3 nights and while the hotel was nice there were a few problems. They advertise HD TVs in every room but fail to mention they're not all hooked up to the service so over half of our channels and the movie service didn't work. Since we didn't spend much time in the room this wasn't a huge deal, it was more frustrating that it took two days for the staff to figure out what was going on.  My biggest complaint was with the shuttle service. They skipped us entirely twice, almost causing us to miss our dinner reservation. The evening auditor saved the day when she called us a taxi which they reimbursed us for. The hotel staff was very apologetic so overall it was a positive experience. But I would recommend walking over to the hotel next door if you're taking the
Manager Response: Dear "Nice Hotel.....Poor Shuttle Service",  I'm so sorry that the HD Service was not working in your Room. The Hotel does have HD TV's in all of the Guest Rooms, apparently the HD on the TV in your room went out.....my sincere apologies for not being able to repair it during your stay.   I apologize for the Shuttle as well, this is not indicative of how it normally runs. We use an outside service for the Shuttle & I will definitely reach out to them regarding this issue. I can assure you it will be rectified by your return visit.   Thanks again for staying at the Sheraton Garden Grove & we look forward to having you back again soon.   Sincerely,  Rick B. Ross General Manager

Summary: We stayed here at the end of our 3 week vacation.  We moved to this hotel for our last night in California so that we would be closer to the Disney Parks.  We arrived very early in the morning so that we could go to Disneyland for the day.  The staff was very helpful and took our bags to a secure room so that we could be at the park and then check in when we were finished with Disney.  They also got us on the Disney shuttle that morning.  When we finally did check in the staff was great.  Our room was very clean, spacious and well appointed.  We found the hotel to be very quiet and comfy.  The location was just fine, a short shuttle ride to disney.  There was a few restaurants close by, within walking distance.  We found this hotel met all our needs.
Manager Response: Dear "Pleasant Stay",  Thank you for your kind words, I will definitely share them with my Team. It is always nice to hear such great feedback from our Guests !!!!!!   We hope to see you back again soon, safe travels.   Sincerely,  Rick B. Ross General Manager

Summary Heading: We had to run to our rooms
Summary: I'm surprised that I haven't read any reviews about the putrid smell that was in each of the hallway floors. The second you got off of the elevator, you were punched in the face by BO (with a side of sour Indian Food). We literally had to run from the elevator to the room in hopes it didn't stick with us. Thankfully, the rooms were unaffected. Speaking of the rooms, I would suggest asking for a room that doesn't have a connecting door to another room. We could hear every single thing the family next to us was saying. Everything. Including their baby crying. I hope our TV wasn't too loud for them. It was the only way to drown out their conversations.  We gave the shuttle a little leeway due to it being New Year's Eve weekend, but it definitely needs some work. We were always the
Manager Response: Dear "We had to run to our rooms",  This is very odd, we have never had complaints or issues with an "odor" eminating from any of our Floors? We do occasionally get a strong smell from some of the Landscaping we have on the South side of the Hotel (Pool Entrance) that penetrates this entrance to the Hotel.....but that is very seldom & does not last long at all?   I do apologize for the inconvenience & hope that you will give us another opportunity to make a 1st Impression.   Sincerely,  Rick B. Ross General Manager

Summary: We stayed at the Sheraton from Dec 27-Dec 31 and found it to be very pleasant.  The room was clean and spacious for the four of us.  We have an 8 and 10 year old.  The staff was very nice and helpful.  The original room we were given was next to the elevator and I asked if we could have a different room since I didn't like the location and the staff was very helpful in moving us to a different room.  The  biggest issue with the room was the shower, it was very clean, but we didn't care for the glass door which  slowed us down getting ready for our daily journey to Disneyland.  It slowed us down because only one person could use the bathroom at a time when the kids were in it.  The shuttle was convenient to and from the park, although after 9:00 PM it could get a little crowded
Manager Response: Dear "Pleasant Disney Christmas Trip",  Thank you for your comments. This is the 1st time that I've ever had remarks regarding our Glass Shower Doors? So sorry that this was an inconvenience for you & your family during your stay.   Yes, you stayed during one of the busiest weeks of the year....so I do apologize about the Housekeeping Department's time in cleaning your room. We did our best to make sure that all of our Guest's Rooms were serviced, just takes longer sometimes during peak season when a majority of the Hotel has all families with 4 or more people in the same room.  We look forward to seeing you again soon.   Sincerely,  Rick B. Ross General Manager

Summary: After spending half the day at crowded Disneyland, we drove to our hotel and found a wonderful, quiet sanctuary.  The Sheraton Garden Grove is an excellent, clean, modern, convenient hotel.  The staff were very nice and the front desk service went above and beyond.  Excellent customer service skills!  Our room was perfect, beds were fantastic and we even had a DIsneyland view.  The shuttle service to Disneyland at night was convenient, safe and inexpensive.  The shuttle arrived on-time both departing and arriving.  Excellent restaurants were within walking distance of the hotel.  It was a great place to stay after a long, tiring day.  Next day had to be at Ontario Airport and hotel was a quick 45 minute away.   Thank you again for making our trip to the Garden Grove area
Manager Response: Dear "Sanctuary from the Crowds",  Thank you for your kind words, I will definitely share them with my team.   Yes, our Hotel is ultra modern, quiet, only 3 years old & we have a great Guest Service Team here from the Bellman, to the Front Desk Staff, F & B & Housekeeping....they are all the best at what they do !!  Thanks again & we look forward to seeing you again soon.   Sincerely,  Rick B. Ross General Manager

Summary: I booked this hotel about a week before I was heading to Disneyland, but still managed to find one of the best deals on the "Disney Strip". I was a little nervous because the deal required me to pay in full for the room.  When we arrived I realized that we were definitely not within walking distance of the theme park, which really ended up being a blessing in disguise. It was much quieter than the area around the park and had a Target right across the street in case we forgot anything. Besides, the $3/day shuttle was more than convenient.  As I was checking in a lady was checking out next to me complaining about a stolen wallet. I definitely lean on the "you probably lost it" side of things, but never a fun thing hear when you just arrive. I also didn't have any issues
Manager Response: Dear "Pleasant & affordable Christmas Vacation",  Thank you for your comments regarding your Christmas Vacation spent at the Sheraton Garden Grove. I am happy to hear that you were pleasantly surprised by the surroundings & the amenities that we have to offer.   YES.....crazy busy week for us !!! Thank you for your kind words regarding the Hotel & Service you received.   We look forward to having you back soon.   Sincerely,  Rick B. Ross General Manager

Summary: I stayed here new years eve, 12/31/11.  The common areas are well kept. However, the room I was assigned has seen better days.  The smell of mold hit me like a wall of bricks when I entered the room. I immediately turned on the A/C to circulate the air in the room. The pungent smell took over every square inch of the room. I eventually flagged down a cleaning lady and she provided me with air-freshner - nothing helped! The cleaning lady admitted she knew of the issue in my room and did not know the cause of the smell. She believed my room should not have been rented out.   I tried resolving the issue with the manager and was only offered breakfast for two, despite have a party of four.  Moving to another room was not an option as the hotel was at capacity.  I understand some
Manager Response: Dear "Never staying here again!",  I believe the smell that you encountered was the Carpet as we just shampooed that room & several others in anticipation of such high occupancy on NYE. So sorry that we could not move you as you previously stated, the Hotel was sold out.   My apologies for the actions of the Manager on Duty for not recognizing there was 4 people in your party & not 2 as suspected.   We do hope that you give the Sheraton Garden Grove another opportunity to serve you. This is not indicative of the way that we operate our Hotel as you can clearly see by all of the positive comments on Tripadvisor prior to your Review.   Sincerely,  Rick B. Ross General Manager

Summary: We stayed here over Christmas break while taking our family to Disneyland.  The rooms were nice and comfortable, however the staff was rude and difficult to deal with.  In addition parking was extremely difficult as half of the parking lot was blocked off by cones reserving spots for valet parking.  If you don't mind paying the extra to valet park this is not a problem but if you want to self park it's frustrating to see so many empty parking spaces and have to circle the hotel several times to find an available spot.  There is a shuttle service every half an hour from the hotel to Disneyland.  We paid for this shuttle service, NOT a good Idea!  There were always many more people attempting to ride the shuttle than there was room for, forcing a shoving match by the guests in
Manager Response: Dear "Not worth the frustration",  Please accept my sincere apologies for the experience you incurred with our Shuttle Service. Yes, they are an outside Organization that services several Hotels in the Garden Grove area.....but that doesn't excuse the fact that my Staff nor their their Staff could have been more accomodating with your requests.   Unfortunately the week that you stayed with us is "peak season" as you can imagine & I assume all of the Shuttles incurred similar challenges with other Hotels. Once again, I wish this experience could have been more positive for you & your family. As you can see by the several Reviews prior to yours, many guests rave about our service & the Hotel.   Please give us another opportunity to make a 1st impression the next time you stay in Garden Grove, please stay with the Sheraton. I can assure you the outcome will be much better.   Sincerely,  Rick B. Ross General Manager

Summary: This was our second trip to the Sheraton Garden Grove, and like the first time, our stay was PERFECT! We arrived later in the evening, and were greeted with a warm welcome and a very quick check-in. The hotel’s lobby is very simple, yet nice and inviting, and best of all CLEAN! We have stayed at many Disneyland area hotels, and for what you get this is our favorite. The room was very warm and inviting. We had two queen beds, which were very comfortable. The linens were also a nice amenity that I truly appreciated. When I crawled into bed for the night, it felt like home. The sheets smelled and felt clean and were very soft. I never felt like it was GROSS and DINGY, like in so many other hotels. The bathroom was stocked with enough towels, which were BIG and soft too! The
Manager Response: Dear "Love this Hotel!",  Thank for your positive feedback regarding your stay at the Sheraton Garden Grove, I will certainly share these with my Team Members !!!!   I am very happy to hear that you thoroughly enjoyed all of the amenities that the Hotel has to offer as well.   Thanks again & we look forward to seeing you again soon !!!  Sincerely,  Rick B. Ross General Manager

Summary Heading: Don't stay here.  The staff is rude and uncaring.  They were short beds and we were forced to sleep on the floor.
Summary: When I tried to take a picture of the manager to post on the iTunes to tell our nightmarish story, he threatened to call the police.  .we had reserved an accessible room because my  poor niece is disabled.  Sheraton promised a king bed and a queen rollaway.  We got there and they were out of rollaways and they also were short blankets for us to sleep on the floor with.  They were our of towels also when we first got there and in the morning the restaurant was out of milk.  If this is the only hotel available,  I suggest you go camping instead.  Certainly nobody with a disability should go as they clearly don't care about  disabled people.  Sleeping on the floor was hard on these two middle aged ladies, especially with the heater in the room being broken.
Manager Response: Dear "Don't Stay Here",  Unfortunately when you book your Reservation through a Third Party Travel Agency, the room type is not guarenteed. I apologize for not being able to accomodate your request upon check in.....but the Hotel was sold out & the room type you needed was not available.   We certainly do not discriminate against Handicapped people & accomodate EVERY request if possible. This does become difficult though when the Hotel is sold out & our available Inventory is minimized.   Once again, please accept my sincere apologies & hopefully you will give the Sheraton Garden Grove another opportunity to make a 1st impression.   Sincerely,  Rick B. Ross General Manager

Summary: I stayed at the Sheraton, with a winning bid on priceline (56/nt), saving me over 99 dollars a night! This was back in April, and I am seriously considering doing priceline again so I can get this hotel. Flawless experience, from start to finish. This is a spotless hotel, and the employees are all so kind, including the gift shop, restaurant, etc etc. The room was wonderful, and the bathroom door locked (simple feature, but unusual for me). I stayed at the Hyatt Regency (wonderful), Hilton, etc, and the Sheraton is just as great if not better.  There is an Outback restaurant just a few steps away, and a Target across the street. The pool is great too, and was seldom crowded at all, and I visited during my Spring Break.  Thanks, Sheraton! will be back.
Manager Response: Dear "Wonderful Experience !!!! Will be back !!",  Thank you for your kind words about Team, they will be very excited to hear your Review as they strive for excellence every day & this kind of feedback makes it all worthwhile.   Yes, it is very convenient for our Guests to have a Target right across the street so you can stock up on Disney "goodies" or anything you may have forgotten during your travels. We look forward to having you back once again this Spring....thanks again.   Sincerely,  Rick B. Ross General Manager

Summary: I stayed at Sheraton Garden Grove this past week with my family and cannot say enough about how lovely the overall experience was considering Disney was insanley packed over the weekend due to the holidays.  It was wonderful coming back each night to a spotless hotel with extrememly friendly staff.  And the food in the restaurant was outstanding.  I was fortunate to meet the GM and he treated each guest he greeted like he was welcoming them to his home.  If you are taking a trip to Disney or are in town on business, I would not stay anywhere else.  I come out every year and this hotel has my loyalty.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Excellent facility for business meetings and guest services
Summary: My team travels all over the US to deliver training workshops for groups of 50 100 sales professionals. This hotel is one of the best we have visited. The facility is maintained in excellent condition, the guest rooms are very comfortable, the meals are very good and the entire staff is outstanding! The banquet/meeting staff is one of the nicest and most accomodating we have ever worked with. I would strongly recommend the Sheraton Garden Grove to anyone planning a visit or meeting in that area.
Manager Response: Dear "Excellent facility for business meetings & guest services",  Thank you very much for your kind words about my Banquet Staff. They definitely work very hard with each Client that we have to make sure their Meetings go flawlessly, I will share these comments with the Team.   Thanks again for choosing the Sheraton Garden Grove for your Meeting Space & Sleeping Rooms. We look forward to hosting your Meetings in 2012 as well !!!!   Happy Holidays...  Sincerely,  Rick B. Ross General Manager

Summary Heading: Amazing Rooms and Great Service, Perfect Holiday Trip!!!
Summary: My family and I recently went to Disneyland for my son's birthday trip. I had checked several hotels on expedia and reviewed them through tripadvisor. I was between Red Lion Hotel and the Sheraton Garden Grove. I found a great deal on this hotel ($79 a night with expedia) and saw that they had great reviews so I went with the Sheraton. We were very excited to go and enjoy the holiday themed parks during this season. When we arrived on Monday to Disneyland, it was pouring outside and we had to leave the park eary because I didn't want my son to get sick. I called the hotel to see if I could check in early, and I was greeted by Omar, the guest service receptionist. He was so nice and undersanding about the situation. We were able to check in at noon at both our rooms. When we
Manager Response: Dear "Amazing Rooms & Great Service, Perfect Holiday Trip !!!!",  Thank you so much for your positive comments about our Hotel. Yes, Omar is amazing & one of our greatest assets.....he continually goes above & beyond to service our guests. I will definitely share your comments with him.   We are very proud to have the newest Sheraton in Garden Grove (just 3 years old) & hope that you can return soon !!!   Happy Holidays to you & your family.   Sincerely,  Rick B. Ross General Manager

Summary: I came and stayed at this hotel with my girlfriend from December 1-4. The hotel itself is located about 1 mile away from Disneyland. I went to Disneyland with my girlfriend in celebration of her birthday. As it was her birthday, the hotel staff were kind enough to leave a plate of complimentary cookies which were very yummy. The room cleaning staff were always thorough in everything and courteous as we walked by them in the hallways. Although we went mainly for Disneyland, we left the room at odd times but the room cleaning staff always kept good track of which rooms still needed to be cleaned. With that said, the bottles of water that we drank, and hotel toiletries used up were replenished everyday. The room that we had was on the Club Level, shower only - but pretty big. The
Manager Response: Dear "Excellent Hotel & Staff",  We are very happy to hear that your Girlfriend's Birthday was so special. I'm so happy that we could accomodate your requests & assist in making the experience one that you both will not soon forget.   Thank you for your kind words about the Hotel as well. As the newest Sheraton in Garden Grove (3 years old) we continually hear such positive feedback about the condition, design & appreciate everything you said.   Happy Holidays to you & your Girlfriend & we look forward to having you back soon.   Sincerely,  Rick B. Ross General Manager

Summary: We have stayed here a few times already and happy to come back again.  Rooms are quiet & clean.  Front desk staff are friendly & helpful.  We tried the club floor this time & if you get a good deal on the rate the added breakfast inclusions can be a good deal.  However I have to say the breakfast is pretty non exciting and I wouldn't bother with the upgrade to Club unless it was a super bargain.  The things I was not keen about as regards the breakfast was that it finishes at 9am which is early for holiday travellers & I guess its mainly marketed at corporate so the timing is understandable but it was a rush for us.  Also the cereal has no sneeze guard set up & buffet service always grosses me out a bit if you know can see there is nothing covering the food.  A cloth serviette
Manager Response: Dear "Lovely Friendly Front Desk",  Thank you so much for your comments regarding the Breakfast & Evening Snacks during your stay, I will certainly address these areas with my Food & Beverage Director.  I'm happy that you enjoyed the accessibility of the cold beverages & coffee at your leisure.   Yes, unfortunately the Shuttle is outsourced with a local Vendor & it does reflect on the Hotel when the trip to the Park is less than acceptable based on the condition of the vehicle. I will be making a call to them as well to discuss the items you referenced in your Review.   We hope to see you back again soon the next time you are in the Garden Grove/Anaheim area.   Sincerely,  Rick B. Ross General Manager

Summary: I travel extensively and I have to say I love this place. Friendly staff, CLEAN rooms, great location and peace and quiet. If you are heading to Disneyland Resort, they have a cheap priced shuttle as well (not like the others in the area). I love a good hot shower with good water pressure, had both even on the top floor! Great breakfast too! Stay here, you won't be dissapointed!
Manager Response: Dear "LOVE IT",  Thank you for your kind words, all are very true !!!!!   Our Hotel is special in many ways & you listed several in your Review. The Club Lounge on the 7th Floor is a great deal & well worth the Upgrade.   We look forward to seeing you again the next time you are in the Anaheim - Garden Grove area.   Sincerely,  Rick B. Ross General Manager

Summary: The hotel is located about one mile west of Disneyland on Harbor Boulevard.  There is parking on side and the rear of the hotel.  The property is about three years old.  There is one restaurant in the hotel.  I did not notice any major restaurant within a few blocks of the hotel.  There is a donut shop and ice cream store located within a block of the hotel. There is private bus service from the hotel to Disneyland every half hour.  The cost is $3.00 per person per day with unlimited trips.  The bus parking zone at the park is a couple of blocks from the ticket office at the park. The room was an adequate size.  There were plenty of drawers and a cabinet with additional drawers and hanging space for clothes.   The work area for a computer has an extended desktop. The bathroom
Manager Response: Dear "One Mile West of Disneyland",  Thank you so much for your kind words about our Hotel. I will definitely share your concerns about the Thermostat in your room to my Chief Engineer to see if this specific unit has an issue as this is typically not a comment that we hear...?   Thanks again for your Feedback & we look forward to seeing you back soon the next time you are in the Anaheim/Garden Grove area.   Sincerely,  Rick B. Ross General Manager

Summary: Stayed here while on a business trip.  Breakfast was very good.  Outside pool was nice (not big but sufficient).  Not far from Disneyland which makes it a good location for people wanting to visit the resort (not great if you're trying to avoid children and families!)  Parking was a bit of hassle (depending on what time you get to the hotel and park).  No charge to park the care, but in the morning if there's a rush, it might take a while before you get your car.  Flew in using SNA airport (approx 25 min away) - highly recommend that airport over LAX if you have a choice.
Manager Response: Dear "Great Hotel in Anaheim",  Thank you for your patronage while staying in the Garden Grove/Anaheim South area.  As we know, you have many choices while traveling & are extremely happy that you chose to stay at the Sheraton/Garden Grove.   I will share your comments about our Breakfast with my F & B Director, she will be very pleased. Yes, SNA (John Wayne) is much closer than LAX.....great advice for fellow Travelers.   We look forward to seeing you again the next time you are in the Anaheim/Garden Grove area.   Sincerely,  Rick B. Ross General Manager

Summary: The Sheraton Garden Grove was great for our 3-night stay while visiting Mickey Mouse.   One of the things I liked is that there is a separate charge for parking- it makes it more affordable for those who are flying or taking the train on vacation. Most other hotels roll in parking with a "resort fee", but there isn't a resort fee at the Sheraton Garden Grove! The downside is that there is a $3 per person fee to use the park shuttle. Still, a better value and much more convenient than using Anaheim Resort Transportation, which will leave you waiting for a bus f-o-r-e-v-e-r!  The hotel room was very clean, and the shower stall very large and comfortable- I actually think their bathrooms are larger than most hotels in this class, although there is only one sink in the bathroom. I
Manager Response: Dear "Solid Choice for Disney Travelers",  Thank you for your kind words about Parking & Transportation, we pride ourselves on making sure all of our Guests are taken to the Park on time & in a safe manner via our Shuttle Busses.   We have great bathrooms/showers, no doubt about it.....some great decor & the size of the bathroom itself is very roomy & since the Hotel is only 3 years old.....we have GREAT water pressure in the showers !!!!  We also serve Starbucks Coffee in the Lobby & our Guest Rooms, no need to run anywhere but come downstairs to grab a hot cup of "Joe".   Thanks again & we look forward to seeing you again soon.   Sincerely,  Rick B. Ross General Manager

Summary: Glad I chose this hotel for a recent conference, it was a quiet place to retreat after a long day.. The staff is fantastic, very attentive and helpful!  The bar/restaurant had a nice menu and service was great!
Manager Response: Dear Great Place to Stay !  I'm very happy that our Hotel provided you with a nice, quiet retreat from the "hustle & bustle" of the Convention Hotels. I will share your comments with my team about your experiences in the Bar/Restaurant.   My Staff loves to hear feedback from of all of our Guests, thanks again.   Sincerely,  Rick B. Ross General Manager

Summary Heading: I can't wait to go back
Summary: our stay was great from the second we pulled into the parking lot, starting with the valet. The front desk was amazing, very nice! I had dropped off a basket to surprise my daughter and it was in the room as requested. After a long day at Disneyland it was nice check into a clean and quiet room! The rest of the hotel was also very clean and well kept. The food was delicious and the restaurant staff was very attentive. I was extremely pleased with our stay and we will back soon.
Manager Response: Dear "I can't wait to go back",  Thank you for your kind words about your experience at the Sheraton Garden Grove. We strive for excellence every day in everything we do....from the minute the Valet opens your door to the warm goodbye upon departure.   I'm happy to hear that the room & Hotel was very clean & especially happy that we could make your daughter's special day.....so special !!!!!!!  Thanks again & I hope to you see you back soon.   Sincerely,  Rick B. Ross General Manager

Summary: I have not been impressed with Sheraton over the years but this was a nice change. Very clean and modern hotel. Staff was very friendly.   If you are taking a shuttle from the airport realize that it is 4 times more expensive to take a shuttle to/from Long Beach Airport as it is from Orange County/Santa Ana Airport ($9 versus $35 per person). So if cost of flight is no difference, use Orange County Airport.   I stayed for a short visit. Room was good size. Linens crisp, clean and comfortable. Bed a bit too soft for my liking but not bad. Water pressure in the shower was intense and very hot. Very nice. No tub however.   There was in-room Starbucks coffee and Tazo tea, refreshed daily. There was no closet which is unusual but there is a wardrobe. There is no mini bar but they did
Manager Response: Dear "Nice for a Sheraton"...  Thank you for your kind words, I will definitely share them with my team.   All of our Rooms are equipped with Airmores.....no Closets & the Iron & Ironing Board are kept inside of the Airmore. I assume this is why you could not locate it during your stay? So sorry for the inconvenience this caused you.   YES !!!!! Our Beds are amazing !!!!! They are the famous Sheraton "Sweet Sleepers".....once again, my apologies if the bed was too soft.   We hope to have you back the next time you find yourself in the Anaheim/Garden Grove area.   Sincerely,  Rick B. Ross General Manager

Summary: This is our second time staying at this propety.  We had a room with two queen beds.  I will say the rooms with a single King bed are roomier than the room with the two queens.  My only reason for giving the hotel a rating of 4 is because the bathroom is rather small and doesn't allow much space for moving around if there are two of you trying to get ready at the same time.  My other complaint now that I am thinking about it, is the walls ave very thin.  My son and his wife stayed in the room next to us, she said she could hear us walking around when we got up in the morning and I was being quiet becuase I had others in my room still sleeping.  I could hear noise from the hall and other rooms as I was trying to go to sleep, but because of being exhausted from a day at the park I
Manager Response: Dear Another Great Stay,  Thank you for your comments about our Hotel. Unfortunately I wish I could change the size of our bathrooms to make them a tad bit roomier as I know this poses a challenge when 2 people are trying to get ready at the same time. I will definitely follow up with the Shuttle Company we use regarding your concerns about them running over, this typically is not the case & they are very punctual.   I'm happy to hear that you enjoyed the breakfast, my apologies on the wait......that can happen sometimes when we have heavy occupancy in house.   We look forward to having you back the next time you are in the Anaheim/Garden Grove area.   Sincerely,  Rick B. Ross General Manager

Summary: This is a nice hotel with modern rooms. Stayed two nights in October 2011. Nice flat-screen TV with HDTV channels, king-sizes bed and complimentary coffee. Valet parking - the only option - costs $12. Room service food was surprisingly good.   There is a Target across the street, and the street the hotel is on has many restaurants and amenities. Close enough to Disneyland and other attractions in Orange County.
Manager Response: Dear Nice Hotel,  Thank you very much for your kind words about our Hotel, I will certainly share them with my team. Room Service is a great amenity after a long day at the Park, or just 1st thing in the AM when you don't feel like getting out of Bed....especially when the Food & Service are excellent.   Thanks again & we look forward to seeing you the next time you are in the Anaheim/Garden Grove area.   Sincerely,  Rick B. Ross General Manager

Summary: Stayed one night in Nov .   We are Starwood Gold members.  To get the upgrade , we had to have a Handicapped Room. This is the second Starwood hotel where something was " less than " as far as getting the upgrade.  Funny , when we bought the vacation ownership we were told we would get the upgrade or MORE about 95% of the time. So far we are O for 2 . Well ,  ok 1/2 for 2 since we had the Handicapped Room.  Front Desk girl was nice and tried to be helpful.  Room was clean.  Bed was ok .   The valet was very strange . When we came back from a night out there was no place to park.  We saw one Valet in the parking lot.  We had no choice but to valet , so we parked out front and waited ,   and waited for a valet.  No one ever came out . After about 20 min I went inside and found a
Manager Response: Dear It's OK,  Thank you for your comments regarding our Valet Service. This is an area of focus as of late for my Team & we are working on different tactics in an effort to make it a more streamline process for the Guests. The challenge we face is the allottment of Parking Spaces we have in the Hotel's Lot. This is complicated even further when we are almost sold out with an event in house......you can only imagine the "shuffling" we have to do in an effort to keep it running smoothly.   Thanks again for your feedback & we look forward to seeing you again soon.   Sincerely,  Rick B. Ross General Manager

Summary: The hotel itself was great.  It is rather far away from Disneyland.  We walked it in 40 minutes each way which was ok for us as we are walkers.  The only other thing was there was never enough front desk staff - allow time for chek out?
Manager Response: Dear Good for Disneyland,  So sorry that you had to walk to the Park...? We do have a Shuttle for $3 per person that runs every 30 minutes on the hour to the Park. My apologies on the Front Desk Staff as well. You must have come to the Desk during shift change as we always have 2 people scheduled per shift. They could have possibly been in the back Office for a moment counting their Banks...?  Thank you for your feedback & we look forward to seeing you again soon the next time you are in the Garden Grove/Anaheim area.   Sincerely,  Rick B. Ross General Manager

Summary: We had the pleasure of staying at the Sheraton Garden Grove in Anaheim. The staff and GM of the hotel were exemplary. They made our stay stress free and were very helpful. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone who stays in the Anaheim area. We went to Disney and the shuttle took us to the gate! I recommend upgrading to Club Level, as the food  and service is wonderful. Also, they are a very child friendly hotel :) We will definately be staying here again.
Manager Response: Dear Outstanding,  Thank you so much for staying at the Sheraton - Garden Grove as I know you had many choices in the immediate area. I'm very pleased to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us  & that we made it stress free for you & your family !!!!!  The Club Level Food & Service is exceptional & the view from the 7th Floor is incredible !!!!!  We look forward to having you back soon, safe travels.   Sincerely,  Rick B. Ross General Manager

Summary: The hotel is new, well sound-proofed and well run.  Brand new fitness center, well-situated pool, nice wine list.  On the negative side, they charge for the shuttle ($3/adult/day) and parking ($12/day), while other hotels in the area do not.  I complained about the shuttle fee and did get complimentary passes... All in all, a good value for the money.
Manager Response: Dear "Nice Hotel near Disneyland",  I'm happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us, especially all of the amenities that a new Sheraton offers.   Unfortunately we do charge a Shuttle Fee & Parking Fee......where as other Hotels do not. Instead they charge you a Resort Fee that encompasses all of these items.   Thanks again for your patronage & we look forward to seeing you again soon.   Sincerely,  Rick B. Ross General Manager

Summary: We stayed here for one week at the end of September. It was a family trip to Disneyland. The room was spacious enough for me, my husband and our 2 yr old. It was very clean and the maids did an excellent job of cleaning every day. They also had free internet in the lobby which was great. All the staff we encountered were very friendly. We also used the gym facility which was more than enough for a week stay. And my daughter enjoyed the pool even though I found the water to be really cold. We ended up using the shuttle to Disneyland. It was mostly on time and never really crowded. Although it's not in walking distance to Disnyland, it is across the street from Target and a very short drive to many restaurants. The only thing I wish the hotel room included was a microwave and
Manager Response: Dear "Great Stay",  Thank you for your kind words about our Hotel, I will make sure & share them with my Team.   We are very conveniently located to several Restaurants in the area, several shops, Target & of course only 1 mile from Disneyland !!!!!!!  Thanks again & we look forward to seeing you again soon.   Sincerely,  Rick B. Ross General Manager

Summary: Things I like about this hotel Nice new hotel Huge room Clean Comfy beds Quiet Right across the street from Target  Things I don't like about this hotel Parking fee ($12/day) Shuttle fee ($3/day) No fridge, microwave or safe No free internet in the room Slippery bathtub (even the bathmat wouldn't stick on the tub) No towel rank except one hook behind door Not walking distance to Disneyland
Manager Response: Dear "Nice Hotel",  Thank you for your positive feedback about the Hotel. I will certainly look into the slippery bathtub issue, this is quite unusual to hear as the Hotel is only 3 years old & was built with anti-slip residue tubs/showers? Unfortunately there is a charge for Internet in the Guest Rooms, but it is complimentary at the Link@Sheraton in the Lobby for all Guests.   Thanks again & we look forward to having you back soon at the Sheraton - Garden Grove/Anaheim South.   Sincerely,  Rick B. Ross General Manager

Summary: I would have given this hotel full marks in all respects if I had not had annoying unresolved problems with the wireless Internet service. Since I paid only $87 per night (excluding tax) on a special, this was the best value for money I have ever had in a hotel.
Manager Response: Dear Driesvdc,  I am so pleased to hear that you thoroughly enjoyed our Hotel with the exception of the Internet Connection, please accept my sincere apologies. This is an issue that happens very seldom here & typically is rectified immediately when a Team Member is notified.   Thanks again for your positive Feedback & we look forward to seeing you again the next time you are in the Garden Grove area.   Sincerely,  Rick B. Ross General Manager

Summary: Had a great stay with them! May not work for families with little ones as it is a little far from Disneyland walking, but the shuttle comes every half hour and only takes 5 min. Target right across the st. And plenty of good family restaurants :). The beds were so nice to sleep on. The staff was great ! Didnt charge for any shuttle passes...nice touch! 24 hr gym and pool ... Yahoo... Hot Tub too!!!
Manager Response: Dear michael b,  Thank you so much for your kind words about our Hotel & it's Amenities. We are conveniently located to several Restaurants, Target & of course Disneyland. The Jacuzzi is a nice touch, especially after a long day at the Park....or making Sales Calls.   We look forward to having you back the next time you are in the Garden Grove/Anaheim area !!!!  Sincerely,  Rick B. Ross General Manager

Summary: I stayed at the Sheraton Garden Grove for a businesss trip. Not only were the rooms excellent the service was even better. The staff was my favorite part. They were always willing to help any time I needed anything. The hotel was very clean and always smelled fresh. It is conveniently located near several great restaurants and shops. I would recommend this hotel to anyone staying in the area. I will definitely be back!
Manager Response: Dear Molly M,  Thank you for your compliments regarding my Staff here at the Sheraton/Garden Grove. They work very hard on a daily basis to go above & beyond to make sure all of our guest's needs are taken care of. I will definitely share your Review with my Team !!!!!  We look forward to seeing you again the next time you are in the Garden Grove/Anaheim area.   Sincerely,  Rick B. Ross General Manager

Summary: I stayed at the Sheraton Garden Grove for a business trip.  It is conveniently located with quick access to the Anaheim convention center, and of course DisneyLand.  There are lots of food options around as well.  The staff at the Sheraton were all great.  It was nice to see everyone with a smile on their face all through out the day.  The general manager Rick Ross was very friendly with me as well as all of the guests chatting with them in the mornings during breakfast and in the lobby asking how their stay was.  Having an involved GM makes for a great place to stay.  I really liked the business center in the lobby as well, it was very convenient for logging on to my computer to get a little work done.  My room was very nice, clean, and I like how everything was very up to
Manager Response: Dear Somewhere_in_AR,  Thank you so much for your kind words & it was a pleasure meeting you during your stay. I'm glad that you enjoyed our Breakfast in the morning & the ability to work at the Link on your Laptop.   I will certainly share your comments with my team & hope to see you again soon !!!!  Sincerely,  Rick B. Ross General Manager

Summary: This is a beautiful, clean hotel with fine furnishings, comfortable beds, and friendly staff. Everything seems new. They were able to book my family with two connecting rooms per our request. The only problem is that on our 2nd and 3rd morning, we had no hot water in our rooms. When I called down to complain, they said they were working on it and apologized. That was it! I would have expected room credit for maybe a HOT breakfast? DISNEYLAND TIP: I would not plan on walking to Disneyland from this hotel. They do have a hotel shuttle which is $3 per day/per person(kids?).
Manager Response: Dear sjmurph,  Please accept my sincere apologies for your room not having Hot Water. Unfortunately our Boiler went out during your stay & it took almost 24 hours to get the parts necessary to get it back up & running once again.....cold showers are obviously not much fun.   Yes, we do have a Shuttle to Disneyland that is $3 per person/per day if you choose not to walk.   Thanks again & we hope to see you the next time you are in the Anaheim/Garden Grove area.   Sincerely,  Rick B. Ross General Manager

Summary: We booked this room to celebrate our anniversary at Disneyland.  The hotel is close to Disneyland (less then 10 minutes), but far enough away that you weren't in all the hustle and bustle of tourists entering or exiting the park.  There is also a Target right across the street in case you forgot to pack anything or need snacks for Disneyland!  The parking at this hotel is not great -- we arrived after dinner and there were no open spaces.  We drove around the entire lot and then went back to the front -- it seems odd that such a big hotel doesn't have very many parking spaces.  There was no valet outside, so my husband went inside and we were told to leave our car and give the key to the front desk and the valet person would take care of the car.  We stayed on the 5th floor and
Manager Response: Dear itsjustmesd,  Yes...Parking Spaces can be sparse when the Hotel is Sold Out, so sorry that you incurred difficulty when parking your vehicle. Yes, there is a rental fee for Micro Fridge Units for the Guest Rooms.....but we do offer it. Every bathroom is equipped with a return (fan) unit in the ceiling..? I will look into this obviously....  Overall, I'm glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay & will be back the next time you are in the Anaheim/Garden Grove area.   Sincerely,  Rick B. Ross General Manager

Summary Heading: Newer hotel keeping up with the competition in a Disney town.
Summary: Stayed at the Sheraton garden grove for a week long conference being held at Anaheim conference center. The hotel is about a twenty minute walk tithe conference center and about a 40 minute walk to the actual entrance of Disney land. The hotel has a club floor that has a decent breakfast and ok evening snacks for those with that privilege. The room service has a decent burger and a good chocolate cake. The hotel has a workout room but I did not see it. The hotel has marble everywhere including my room. I really like the glass enclosed shower in my room instead of the regular tub with a shower curtain. My only problem was I had no hot water two mornings in a row at 8am. I did not mentioned it until the second morning after enduring it and they had it fixed the next morning. There
Manager Response: Dear Genuine_Colorado,  Thank you for your kind words (even given the fact that our Boiler went down) regarding your stay at the Sheraton/Garden Grove......I will definitely share them with my team. Happy to hear that you enjoyed the benefits of the Club Lounge as well.   Once again, so sorry about the loss of Hot Water.......it is fixed now !!!!!!  Sincerely,  Rick B. Ross General Manager

Summary: i ordered my rooms through a third party website. I needed two bed and was little bit scare about after reading all the reviews. They had no problem to put me a room with 2 queen beds, waived the parking fee and shuttle bus fee.   The property is reasonably clean, close to Disneyland. We took the shuttle bus back for an afternoon nap and then went to the park again for the fireworks.
Manager Response: Dear Toronto_CanadaJeff,  Thank you so much for your kind words. We will always accomodate our 3rd party guest's requests when the room type is available, no problem..  I'm glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay & trip to Disneyland.   We look forward to having you back soon at the Sheraton Garden Grove - Anaheim South !!!!  Sincerely,  Rick B. Ross General Manager

Summary Heading: Nice hotel but not all there
Summary: Stayed here for 3 nights in room 538. Lets start with the nice. The hotel looks new or newly remodeled. I dont know the history and didn't check prior. The room was clean. Restroom was nice, large, and clean. Bedding was all clean. Shower was spacious. And most important the AC was one of the built ins which was nice and quiet.  What I didn't care for. There is only 1 way in/out of the hotel and its odd. If you’re going northbound on harbor you’ll have to U turn right infront of the hotel or at the next light if you miss the turn lane to no where in the median.  If you’re going southbound then its just a right turn into the hotel. Parking is $12 which includes valet. The issue I have with this is parking was plentiful and was right up close. The parking lot was NEVER full. Why
Manager Response: Dear smokey0066,  Thank you for your positive feedback on our Hotel. Yes, we do have a Parking Fee that is commensurate with the Market. So sorry for the inconvenience, we always charge the same  amount regardless of occupancy so there may have been more spaces available during the time that you stayed with us, but the rate would never fluctuate because of this.  We do have Refrigerators on site for rent, so sorry that you were not informed of this upon arrival..  Thanks again & we look forward to seeing you the next time you are in the Anaheim/Garden Grove area.   Sincerely,  Rick B. Ross General Manager

Summary: Very close to Disneyland, shuttle cost $3/pp per day, multiple rides.The shuttle runs every 30 mins. The parking is $12 cheaper than any hotels closer to the park. The price of the hotel is much lower than any hotels nearby. It's 3 only blocks from the park.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We got back from what was supposed to be a 5 night stay. We ended up leaving after 1, even thought it meant we would eat the cost because we booked through Priceline.  Upon check in you are charged for parking. $12 a day. But since we were staying for 5 days or more, they were only charging us $8. Yay. As others have said, the WiFi is not free, which is almost unheard of these days and the shuttle is not free (the Crowne Plaza's shuttle right around the corners is free). We used the Wifi for one day but the signal was so bad we ended up plugging our PC into the jack at the desk. I called to make sure that we would not be charged twice, and they said no. Upon checking out, there were two charges for internet access. Although the charge was removed, we had to wait 10 minutes so
Manager Response: Dear kentc1978,  I am so sorry to hear that your stay with us was less than spectacular. Yes, we do have a $12 Parking Fee that is commensurate with the market & we charge for Wi Fi as well.....as do most of our competitors. Yes, we do have a $3 Shuttle Fee & the CP does not charge for their Shuttle....this is true.....but they do charge a $12 per day Resort Fee & we do not.   My apologies for the Internet Charge on your Folio & I'm happy to hear that it was removed, so sorry you had to wait at the Front Desk to have this taken care of. We are currently in the process of shampooing all of the carpet in the Guest Rooms as the Summer Season has now wound down.  Once again, my apologies for the condition of the carpet in your room & we hope that you will give us another chance to make a first impression at the Sheraton - Garden Grove/Anaheim South.   Sincerely,  Rick B. Ross General Manager

Summary: This is another Sheraton property close to the park.  It isn't as close as the other, but that is usually where you can find a better deal.  It was a great little hotel and we got a really good package that included park tickets, breakfast, free shuttle and free parking at the hotel.  The two complaints I would have would be the breakfast at the hotel was a bit muddled.  We had no idea where we were supposed to go or what to do.  That may not bother many, I just like to feel like I am not a helpless bystander.  That was pretty minor though.  The BIGGEST gripe was the shuttle.  We were sharing with other hotels so people were literally standing in the isles as we drove.  The trip to the park was a little long too so that was no fun for anyone.  This didn't happen every time, but
Manager Response: Dear clmcam1109,  I'm very happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay at our Hotel & gave us such a good rating. Unfortunately our Restaurant is "tucked" away to the right of the Lobby, so sorry about that..  We do share the Shuttle with (1) other Hotel & therefore it can be rather busy from time to time, especially during peak times. This also makes the Shuttle Times skewed somewhat due to the other pick ups, my sincere apologies if you had to wait longer than expected.   Thanks again for your constructive feedback & we look forward to seeing you soon the next time you're in the Anaheim - Garden Grove area.   Sincerely,  Rick B. Ross General Manager

Summary: Nice hotel, weird set up.  Arrived on time, ready to settle in an have a relaxing stay.  However the pool was out of service, made a call to the front desk and asked about the facility and if we can use the pool and another Sheraton and was told NO.. each location is handled by private owners.  Jacuzzi was available.  Next disappointment. WIFI wasn't free in your room.. Unheard of these days.  WIFI only  available in lobby. Paid for breakfast in advance, only to learn they were under staffed needless to say we didn't get breakfast. Asked to be refunded. Very disappointed with our stay. Sheraton you let us know.  Bad for you we won't be back!
Manager Response: Dear Sabrina T,  So sorry about our Pool being out of service during your stay. We had to drain the pool due to the fact we had to inspect the Drain at the bottom in an effort to remain compliant with the new laws that were passed regarding Pool Safety. We obviously take our Guest's safety very seriously & wasted no time to make sure we were in compliance.   Yes, there is a cost for Wi Fi in our Guest Rooms......but it is complimentary at the Link@Sheraton in the Lobby. So sorry for this inconvenience once again..  I am hopeful that you will give us another attempt at making a 1st impression at the Sheraton/Garden Grove the next time you find yourself in the Anaheim - Garden Grove area.   Sincerely,  Rick B. Ross General Manager

Summary: We stayed at Sheraton for Labor Day weekend and it was a nice hotel.  The location was great because it was right across street from Target, Coco's and a great $1 Store!!  We also loved the free shuttle to and from Disneyland, and the drivers were great.  The staff here at the hotel were nice. Rooms were good size.  We got two queen size beds, and they were comfy.  The thing we did not like at the hotel was there were not refridgerators in the rooms, and if you wanted one, you had to pay a fee:(  Also, the maid we had was not very good . . . she only replenished our coffee and soaps/shampoo/lotions once in the 4 days we were there, and when we saw here while we were in the hallway, she was busy talking on the phone and trying to clean with one hand, which is probably why she
Manager Response: Dear Vic P,  Great to hear that you enjoyed our Hotel so much during your stay in the Anaheim/Garden Grove area. We are very convenient (walking distance) to many restaurants/shops in the area & glad that you found this to be an asset during your stay.   I do apologize however for the service that you did not recieve 3 out of the 4 days that you stayed with us. This is highly unusual unless there is a DND on the Door as we take our Guest's privacy very seriously.....so sorry if not.   We look forward to having you back again soon.  Regards & safe travels.   Sincerely,  Rick B. Ross General Manager

Summary: Stayed here on a recent girls trip to Disneyland! I booked the hotel through Priceline and got what I thought was a decent rate compared to the surrounding areas.   Pros: – beautiful rooms! I really love a modern feel and these hotel rooms had just that. Comfortable bed, nice flat screen tvs (although we didn’t even turn ours on… too busy), a nice shower and tiles throughout the bathroom. Conditioner in the bathroom that was separate from the shampoo!! I loved the furniture as well.  - Same modern feel to the lobby and the restaurant inside the lobby. Staff was friendly and helpful providing extra towels when needed asap. Also answered all our questions whenever we needed over the phone.  - free internet downstairs in the lobby (45 min a day per room maybe? I don’t remember… my
Manager Response: Dear rockalicious331,  Thank you so much for your feedback on our Hotel. We are extremely pleased that you enjoyed your stay with us & all of our amenities.....plus the modern "feel" our Hotel has in comparison to the other Hotels in the surrounding area.   We look forward to having you back soon !!!  Sincerely,  Rick B. Ross General Manager

Summary: We stayed here for one night using my SPG points for a wedding near by in Santa Ana. It's not far from restaurants, and across the street from Target.  Rooms were large enough for the two of us and was clean. Surprisingly the housekeeping brought over a bathrobe. Parking was not a problem for us.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed there the last week in August and the first three days of September. The hotel is great all new and very cozy.  It was so clean and the rooms were great and very large. The staff was friendly and spoke to you every morning with a smile. What ever you needed they would get it for you with a smile . I want to commend Omar who works at the front desk he helped us get the perfect rooms and treated us so good. Likewise Julio who works in the restaurant he was great, we ate their the first morning after our arrival; and the next morning he had our table ready and waiting for us when we came down. Coffee, orange juice, and all the things we like were ready, WOW! what service . The shuttle were great also, we really enjoyed our stay and look forward to staying again.
Manager Response: Dear Archville178,  Thank you so much for your commments about your stay with us the last week in August & the first week of September. I'm so happy to hear that Omar & Julio took such great care of you & your family. They are truly 2 of our best employees so this is not surprising to hear.   I will definitely share your comments with them as well as the rest of my Team here at the Sheraton/Garden Grove !!!!!  Thanks again & we look forward to having you back soon.  Sincerely,  Rick B. Ross General Manager

Summary Heading: Excellent "Good Neighbor" hotel for Disneyland visit
Summary: We just returned from a 3-night stay at this hotel for a trip to Disneyland.  I have been to Disneyland numerous times in the past, but this is the first visit for our kids (2 and 5 yrs old), and we decided to stay off Disney property for cost reasons, and I'm very glad we did!  We booked the "Disney Package", which included 2 adult park hopper tickets (we bought kids tickets at the front desk - same price as Disneyland, i.e., no discount and no surcharge), 2 adult breakfasts each day, parking at the hotel, and round-trip shuttle to Disneyland.  I'm sure most if not all of the Disneyland Good Neighbor hotels offer similarly bundled packages, but here are some of the reasons I find Sheraton Garden Grove to be a good choice.  1) The hotel lobby is clean, well decorated.  Check-in
Manager Response: Dear vetism,  I am so happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us during your most recent visit to Disneyland ! My Staff works very hard to make sure each & every guest is comfortable & happy during their stay, I will certainly pass along your comments.   Odd to hear that you didn't have a Towel Hook on the Bathroom Wall in your room? All of our Guest Rooms are equipped with this item, I will definitely research the room you stayed in & address this immediately.   Thanks again & we look forward to seeing you back soon !!  Sincerely,  Rick B. Ross General Manager

Summary: We were attending a ball game at Angel Stadium and wanted a nearby hotel.  The hotel was clean, nicely decorated and reasonable amenities.    It was an easy trip to the ballgame and cheaper than other nearby comparable hotels.
Manager Response: Dear 100 countries_or_bust,  I'm very happy to hear that your stay with us was both convenient to the Ball Park & well appointed for your taste.   We are very proud to be affiliated with the Angels & their Fans are welcome here anytime !!!!!!  We look forward to having you back the next time you are in the Anaheim/Garden Grove area.   Sincerely,  Rick B. Ross General Manager

Summary: This hotel met all of our needs with clean comfortable rooms, great location, and an excellent staff. We will definitely chose this hotel when traveling to the area next time! Great value and great hotel!!
Manager Response: Dear Joe B,  Thank you so much for your kind words about your stay at the Sheraton/Garden Grove.   I will definitely share them with my team & we look forward to having you & your family back soon !!!!  Sincerely,  Rick B. Ross General Manager

Summary: This property is new, beautiful and cozy! I have no complaints about the Sheraton Garden Grove! The staff were polite and accomodating, the room and bathroom were spotless and the location was very convenient. Located on the same street as Disneyland, there are many attractions and restaurants nearby. They have a free shuttle that will take you to Disneyland and free internet in common areas - don't use it in your room, unless you want a $10 charge on your room bill per day! I had a wonderful stay at this hotel and the fact that it's fairly new probably helped! I would definitely stay at this hotel again and recommend it to others visiting Anaheim or the Disneyland area.
Manager Response: Dear Missa019,  I am so pleased to hear that your stay with us was so memorable & that you enjoyed the Hotel !!!  We strive for excellence every day in all aspects of the Hotel & it's great to hear such positive feedback, thanks again.   Sincerely,  Rick B. Ross General Manager

Summary: This hotel was really average.  It was however really clean and fairly new, but we had a TERRIBLE view of the roof.  I don't know who decided this was a good design for a hotel, but one whole side of the hotel had a really bad view.  The pool was clean, the hot tub was not working.  The shuttle service for Disneyland was on time and the staff was friendly.  There is free internet in the lobby and a nice business lobby.  It was a totally acceptable place to stay in for a trip to Disneyland, really great beds.
Manager Response: Dear El Paso4,  Thank you for your kind words about the Sheraton Garden Grove - Anaheim South, the guest rooms, the Shuttle & especially the cleanliness of your room.  My apologies about the view from your room of the Roof, that certainly was not intentional & hopefully on your next time through we can assure you a room with a spectacular view.   Sincerely,  Rick B. Ross General Manager

Summary: The customer service was impeccable. Whatever we needed- they helped us. The room was amazing. The location was great. Close to everything. And family friendly.
Manager Response: Dear Awesome Customer Service,  Thank you for sharing your experience at our Hotel. I'm extremely excited to hear how happy you are & how much you enjoyed your Trip.   We look forward to hosting you again the next time you are in the Anaheim/Garden Grove area.   Sincerely,  Rick B. Ross General Manager

Summary: I was in Anaheim on business back in October 2010.  I thought I had booked a room in another Sheraton I normally stay at when the family visits Disneyland.  But, to my surprise, I reserved a room at this hotel. This is a beautiful gem on the Disneyland strip.    I love a beautiful building, from the outside to the inside and this hotel was nice throughout.  To be honest, I was so busy with my business conference, I did not explore all the amenities this hotel had to offer.  I normally completely tour a new hotel, but I just didn't have the time during this trip.  I didn't even get a chance to look at the swimming pool!  Room My room was gorgeously decorated--I love dark-wood furniture.  The room was very spacious and well kept. The bathroom was big with a nice wood/glass door.
Manager Response: Dear awdang_99,  Thank you for your great review of our Hotel !!!!! I am very pleased that you liked every aspect of your stay with us & we look forward to having you back soon. I will definitely share your comments with my team.....thanks again.    Sincerely,  Rick B. Ross General Manager

Summary Heading: Just ok.  Good for business trips.
Summary: Like I said, this is a good hotel for business trips.  Room is spacious, had a large desk that would fit large laptop, etc. Room was and lobby was pretty clean.  The pros: Clean room, large walk in shower.  Parking was decent, and they waived the parking fee for us.  Guests can use computers in lobby for free. Target is across the street. The major cons: Only a few floors, so you won't have a nice view, wherever you are.  $12 a day for Internet.  No fridge in rooms.  Maid service only available until 4 pm.  Bus ride to Disneyland was hellish!  Bus was NEVER on time, and when it did finally come, bus would be so full that there was standing room only (and there is a large sign that says "no standing when bus in motion.").  Bus picks up at several other hotels, and Sheraton is
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed here for four nights for our first Disneyland trip.  Couldn't beat the price of $69 a night on Hotwire as everything around Disneyland is expensive during peak season.  Check-in was easy and they allowed us in at 1:00pm which was great.  We ended up with a room with a bathtub that I assume is for ADA people, but we didn't care since we have a three year old who needed baths (it also featured two chairs by the window instead of a desk).  The beds are comfy, solid TV channels, but the lack of a fridge is a bit disappointing for a nicer hotel.  The carpets in the much-maligned elevator were replaced and clean; we never had to wait for an elevator as they were usually empty.  The pool is miniscule and entirely in the sun for most of the day; for little kids it's fine, but
Manager Response: Dear AverySLC,  Thank you so much for your kind words about the Hotel, Staff, Shuttle & cleanliness of the Hotel. I will definitely share these comments with my team & hope to see you back soon.  Sincerely,  Rick B. Ross General Manager

Summary Heading: Second stay not as nice as before
Summary: This is the 2nd time I've stayed at the Sheraton Garden Grove. If you are going to Disneyland, I would recommend the Sheraton Anaheim.  This is a very decent hotel, lobby is nice and modern and the restaurant is a good value. Doesn't seem like being a Gold SPG member gets you anything at this hotel. Room was not upgraded, no club access, front desk refused to throw in free wifi. Really????? Since I was only in the room at night to sleep, didn't blow the experience but it's the little things that make a hotel stand out vs. others. Probably won't stay here again.  Don't quite get the parking charge, there is plenty of parking. This hotel is not close enough to Disneyland where people would park and leave their cars, and walk to Disneyland. It's over 2 miles.  Room was fine, no
Manager Response: Dear Bodarony,  I'm sory to hear about the anticipated Free Wi Fi during your stay. Unfortunately unless you are a Platinum Member & have access to the Club Lounge.....there is a charge unfortunately.   I'm happy to hear that you were impressed with the room & the rest of your stay though, we look forward to having you back soon.   Sincerely,  Rick B. Ross General Manager

Summary Heading: You get what you pay for....
Summary: I booked the hotel through priceline.com for $80 per night. The hotel is very nice on the outside. Appears to be new. Lobby and front desk staff were also very nice.  The hotel is the farthest away from Disneyland. They do offer a complimentary shuttle; however, we did not realize this until after we purchased our shuttle tickets from ART.   The room was spacious. Offers two queen size beds. Shower was small but shower head was nice. There were some stains on the carpet. The biggest issue with the room was the vent. The airconditioner vent is situated to where it blows directly in your face while you are sleeping. We all had sore throats when we woke up.   The other thing I noticed is there is no breakfast buffet. The menu items were somewhat pricey. My family ended up walking
Manager Response: Dear Kalisa75,  I am so sorry to hear about the A/C that unfortunately blew in your face all night, this is the 1st time I've heard this complaint from a guest. I will definitely send Engineering to the room to make sure the vent is angled properly as this should not be an issue.   We typically run a Buffet in the Restaurant during Sold Out weekends to alleviate the rush, assist both the Guests & Servers in completing a quick/efficient breakfast experience as we know most guests are on their way to Disneyland in the AM. I am so sorry this was not offered during your stay.   We look forward to seeing you again the next time you are in the Anaheim/Garden Grove area.   Sincerely,  Rick B. Ross General Manager

Summary: We arrived at the hotel at 1030 am way earlier than our 3pm check in and they were very accommodating, the mgr Martha let us check in our room. We decided to rent a car (last minute) and the bellman made the arrangements for us. Matt at hertz was awesome he set us up with a  convertible. The hotel was clean and quiet.  We had friends at the embassy suites half mile up the road and that hotel was so noisy. The only thing we would suggest is the hotel not accept pets.
Manager Response: Dear ES3060,  Thank you for your kind words about my Team. I am so happy that you enjoyed your stay with us & we look forward to having you back the next time you are in the Garden Grove/Anaheim area.   Unfortunately Starwood's Policy is that we do have to accept pets at the Hotel. Of course they must be controlled at all times & fall under certain weight restrictions. I'm sorry if this was an inconvenience during your stay.   Sincerely,  Rick B. Ross General Manager

Summary Heading: Once again, a very nice stay.
Summary: I stayed here for a conference and, once again, was very pleased with the property.  First of all, the front desk was both friendly and efficient---not an easy thing to do 'in season' and at the height of the check-in hour in the hotel business.  Kudos to them.  The room was a nice size, modern, clean, comfortable and included a mini-fridge,which came in handy.  One night I decided to eat dinner in the restaurant and I had the pasta pomadora ($12.95) and a glass of Cabernet ($5.00).  The food was very good, the sevice was also very good as well and it was very relaxing---just what I needed that evening.  Thank you so much!  Another night I came back late and decided to use their free computers in the lobby to check e-mails, etc.  I went to the nearby bar and ordered a glass of
Manager Response: Dear #1remdog,  Thank you so much for your kind words, I will definitely share them with my Staff.   My apologies for the children that were utilizing the Link obviously without any parental supervision. As you can imagine being so close to Disneyland, we get a lot of families/kids that stay with us.   We look forward to having you back once again very soon !!!!  Sincerely,  Rick B. Ross General Manager

Summary: Stayed at hotel the night before going to Knott's Berry Farm.  Hotel was pretty nice and rooms are modern and clean.  Tried to watch movie on TV but it failed to play.  Called downstairs to report issue and was told to try some other movies to see if they worked.  None would work so we let them know and were told no charges would be applied.  Next morning the manager interrogated us as if we had watched movies.  We told him that we had talked to front desk.  Instead of being apologetic for the problems and trying to make us happy he continued to treat us like we were lying and sent us on our way with extra charges on our credit card.  Called back later apologized but still acted like it wasn't their problem.  Overall it's a good spot as long as that guy is not on shift.
Manager Response: Dear Chitterbug,  I apologize for the issues that you encountered with your TV & the Movies that you tried to watch. There is no excuse for the treatment that you recieved from my Management Team Member & I will definitely follow up to see why it was handled in such a manner.   Hopefully you will give us another try on your next trip to the Anaheim/Garden Grove area.   Sincerely,  Rick B. Ross General Manager

Summary Heading: Comfortable and a great bang for the buck
Summary: I enjoyed my three night stay here.  It is a good value.  The hotel is contemporary.  All areas were clean.  The staff was friendly.  There are five computers in the main lobby with internet access which was convenient.  Sheraton Park Grill is the restaurant at the hotel that serves breakfast, lunch, and dinner.  I ate breakfast there.  I only ordered oatmeal. It was the best oatmeal I have ever eaten.    I would definitely stay again.
Manager Response: Dear 17jwblue17,  Thank you so much for your kind words about the Hotel, my Staff & the incredible Oatmeal in the Park Grill. I will make sure all team members involved know how memorable your stay with us was.   Sincerely,  Rick B. Ross General Manager

Summary: Hotel was clean ! The shuttle to Disneyland was friendly, fast and had great hours. Pool open 24 hours. Food was good and reasonable. Front desk staff was helpful. The wireless was a little tricky but allowed for all of the kids ipods, ipads and computers to connect for one price
Manager Response: Dear WorldWanderer4u,  Thank you so much for stating how clean our Hotel is....as our Housekeeping Staff takes great pride in maintaining this beautiful new Hotel, they will love to hear your comments.
