We look forward to having you back the next time you are in the Garden Grove/Anaheim area.   Sincerely,  Rick B. Ross General Manager

Summary: We stayed here 4 nights because it was near the Anaheim Convention Center where we were attending a conference.  The rooms were quite, it is not close to the Convention Center or even Disneyland (but they have a shuttle to take you there).  The staff was nice and helpful, one problem though, the front desk frequently had a long wait because there was only one person working there.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Our regular Hotel did not have any rooms available for the weekend that we were going to Disneyland, so we booked the Sheraton Garden Grove to try something different! Let me say I was pleasanlty surprised. The staff was very friendly and welcoming. They answered all of our questions, and gave amazing recomendations, for other things to do other than Disneyland. The rooms were clean and spacious. The beds were comfortable and the sheets were soft! (A huge bonus in my book). The walk in shower with glass door was also very nice. The water pressure was good for our entire stay. The only thing we found that was dull and dingy was the carpet int he elevator, however during our stay this was replaced in both elevators. Parking on some nights was tight, but we just took the car up
Manager Response: Dear disneylover1979,  It was a pleasure to read your review about the Sheraton/Garden Grove......thank you for your kind words. My Staff works very hard with all of our Guests to make sure their accomodation is nothing less than stellar.   Please come back soon, we look forward to having you once again !!!!!!  Sincerely,  Rick B. Ross General Manager

Summary Heading: Some small Obstacles that was disappointing
Summary: So I was trying to set up a nice honeymoon suprise for my wife.  I had already purchased my tickets, so I couldn't qualify for the Romance package, and there are no other romance packages that I can purchase on my own.   Wy wife is spending the first time ever in disneyland so I wanted it to be the most memorable.  The hotel said we were neighborhood friends with Disney but Disney couldn't deliver gifts to our hotel because they weren't on the list!?  Such a bummer, even though they had a plaque saying that they are a Disney neighbor, and the staff also said we were the Disney neighbor, but Disney said they were not.  The Hotel staff didn't even bother suggesting other options for us.  They sounded like I was a bother.  Very Poor Customer Service!
Manager Response: none

Summary: The employees were very friendly and helpful getting us transportation to and from Disney as well as the LAX.  Our room was very nice and clean.   There was a Target across the street....convenient.  I would stay again if we were driving.  You can't walk to Disneyland from there.
Manager Response: Dear aloha68,  I am elated to hear that your trip to Anaheim was so memorable & the Hotel was to your liking. We strive for excellence on a daily basis in both service & cleanliness, happy to hear we did everything right !!!!!!!!!!!  Thanks again & we look forward to having you back soon.   Sincerely,  Rick B. Ross General Manager

Summary: Stayed here for 4 nights with my boyfriend as we were going to Disneyland. The rooms were VERY clean so that was awesome, but we were literally only there to sleep. The rooms are spacious, beds are comfy but parking was very limited. The fitness center was also very clean & almost always empty.  a few things that I didn't like: the alarm clock would go off every morning at 5am without me or my bofriend setting it, I'm sure some housekeeper thought it'd be funny. There was always hair on the sheets/pillow cases (im assuming from housekeeping) that was pretty gross. & it was hard to get a warm shower in the mornings for whatever reason. Also I paid for the shuttle EVERYDAY while others did not (it wasnt even included in their package)  But OVERALL we were very satisfied those were
Manager Response: Dear Littoxski,  I'm so sorry for the Smoking Fee that was assessed during your stay but we are a Non Smoking Hotel & take these matters very seriously.    I appreciate your comments regarding the cleanliness of the rooms & apologize for the Alarm Clock going off at 5AM, that certainly was not intentionally set & I will investigate this further with Housekeeping as this is NOT normal.    Sincerely,  Rick B. Ross General Manager

Summary Heading: Disneyland shuttle is not as often as I would like
Summary: I live in San Diego and since the start of the summer season at Disneyland I like to go to the park at opening.  To save me from driving 630 am on the day of, I usually stay in a hotel nearby with shuttle service.  Sheraton Garden Grove had a pretty good deal that included parking and shuttle (both cost extra) and it was still cheaper than the other Sheraton Hotels near Disneyland so we decided to stay here.   We got a room on the club lounge floor and access to the club lounge (cost extra usually but we got it for free with our SPG Platinum status).  The room was pretty standard and clean so no complaints.   The club lounge wasn't all that great.  The standard hot breakfast items (scrambled eggs, bacon, hash browns) were either dry or somewhat old so I stuck more with cereal
Manager Response: Dear ciaocat,  Thank you for your kind words about your stay at the Sheraton/Garden Grove.   Unfortunately we are only contracted for (2) Shuttle pick ups per hour so I am sorry this was an inconvenience during your stay. SPG is an amazing program, thank you for encouraging all of our guests to sign up.....there are some great benefits as a member.   We look forward to having you back soon.   Sincerely,   Rick B. Ross General Manager

Summary: We stayed here for 9 days... We loved it  the service and the rooms were Great!! We got our hotel via priceline.com so we paid 1/2 the price.   ONLY problem is when we upgraded to the club level.. the breakfast and evening snacks were the exact same every day so it got old. But we loved  the club loundge with the TV and couchs, and we loved the unlimited free drinks and pop. They have shuttle to disneyland for a small fee, and have to pay for parking also.   Overall we will stay there Again in a heartbeat...
Manager Response: Dear cc9365,  Thank you for staying with us for 9 days !!!! Glad to hear your stay here was so enjoyable.   We will be "mixing" up our Club Lounge Menu starting July 1st to offer different items, on different days in an effort to offer some variety.   Thanks again & we look forward to seeing you soon.   Sincerely,  Rick B. Ross General Manager

Summary: As a business traveler who spends a lot of time in this area I know this is one of the nicer hotels in Anaheim/Garden Grove (better rooms than the Sheraton Park). The pool is not great but few are in the area (its OK), the best by a long shot is down the street at the Sheraton Park Hotel Anaheim (1/3 of the room there have a view of the Disneyland fireworks as well). FYI the Anaheim Hilton is a dive. However, for platinum business travelers much of the things that made this hotel special are gone. The concierge level food is not nearly what it once was and the little welcome gift of cookies that my kids loved, gone, also the free drink coupon for the concierge level, gone...I ran into an old hotel acquaintance and he informed me that most of the guys I recognized/knew (8-15
Manager Response: Dear JaySFBayArea,  I'm happy to hear that you feel the Sheraton/Garden Grove is one of the nicest Hotels in Anaheim, but somewhat discouraged regarding your comments about our Club Lounge.   We have recently made some upgrades as it is now open 7 days a week & feel that it compliments the Hotel quite nicely. We still offer amenities for all Platinum Members, just  don't always offer Cookies. We have mixed it up a bit with some Fruit, Cheese & Crackers, etc.   Hopefully you will give us another try the next time you are in the Anaheim/Garden Grove area.   Sincerely,   Rick B. Ross General Manager

Summary Heading: Love the Room and stay was comfortable
Summary: One of the best rooms I have stayed in. Very clean. Pros: * Clean and spacious (lighting could be better) * Near Disneyland * Bathroom was clean and spacious  Cons: * Thin walls to hallway, can hear flushing of neighbors (above/below) * Room Refresh: Vacuum was not 100% but decent enough * Pillows can use a refresh. Getting flat * Night guest services. a little rude  Disneyland tickets:  $72/ adult at hotel ($80 on disney website) $3/pps for Bus each way to Disneyland  Internet: $9.95/day (not free!) Parking: $12/night (tight spaces, compact cars OK, Big spaces used for Valet)
Manager Response: Dear citiguy,  Thank you so much for your Cleanliness comments. My Housekeeping Team strives to do their best on a daily basis & it clearly shows through our GSI Scores & latest QA Inspection where we scored a 97% on Cleanliness.   We just placed a Pillow order this month & look to cycle out all of the flat ones by July 1st !!!!  Thanks again & we look forward to you coming back to Disney & our Hotel soon.   Sincerely,  Rick B. Ross General Manager

Summary: ++ Expected Sheraton quality, good location.  -- Bad and expensive WIFI connection, disconnecting each hour.
Manager Response: Dear to_dee1,  Thank you for your exceptional Review !!!!!!!!!! The Hotel is beautiful & my team takes great pride in making our Guest's experience very memorable, especially given the fact we know this is a Vacation destination for many families.   Thanks again & we look forward to having you back soon.   Sincerely,   Rick B. Ross General Manager

Summary: This is our new favourite hotel in Garden Grove.  Nice and new as regards the rooms.  Comfy beds and nicely appointed, quiet rooms.  The hotel has its own shuttle to DL which is super handy and the drivers are friendly and it leaves on time which is great.  The pool is nothing fancy but very useable and does the job for kids keen for  a post Disney swim.  Having a Target store right across the road is just perfect - you can get all your drinks and snacks at a good price before going to Disneyland.  You can use the pcs in the lobby for free if you dont bring your own.  This is a awesome set up as you can quickly log on & check your email whilst waiting for the shuttle to Disneyland.  Good planning from Sheraton - well done.    The only thing I would have liked to make an even
Manager Response: none

Summary: Good: After arriving at the Sheraton lobby, a friendly clerk checked us in. He also explained amenities such as free refrigerator, free valet parking, free shuttle to disneyland etc.  The bell hop was super friendly and moved our luggage to our connecting rooms quickly. The rooms were spacious and tastefully decorated. The free shuttle to disneyland and free valet parking was super convenient. The lobby and corridors were nicely decorated. The hotel looked new and the entire staff was very friendly and helpful.  Bad: Though the refrigerator I had asked for was not set up in the room, the check-in clerk arranged for it promptly after I pointed that out.  We did not receive the morning newspaper on one day. I didn't bother to report it. They charged us for complimentary
Manager Response: Dear avttravel,  Please accept my sincere apologies for not having the Refrigerator in your room upon arrival,  this is a simple Operations task that was obviously overlooked. I am glad that the Clerk reversed the charges upon your departure.   I will make sure & share your positive comments with my Team this week.   Thanks again & we look forward to having you back the next time you are in the Anaheim/Garden Grove area.   Sincerely,  Rick B. Ross General Manager

Summary Heading: There May be Better Choices Nearby
Summary: I admit that I arrived late and left early the next morning, so did see much of the hotel.  I definitely was properly greeted at the front desk and expedited with a key to my room.  The room was standard Sheraton.  I enjoyed the Club Lounge the next morning. Very good selection of food and nice atmosphere.  1 free computer was a treat.    The 4 Sheraton Link computers in the lobby is one of the main reasons I choose Sheraton hotels.   Staff hailed a taxi for me and I was on my way.   I noticed lots of other larger, and more impressive looking hotels and restaurants nearby.  No complaints about the hotel. I expect Sheraton quality and service and I got it.
Manager Response: Dear PAQ,  Thank you so much for your kind words about the Sheraton/Garden Grove & the compliments about my Team, I promise to share them with everyone involved.   We look forward to seeing you again the next time you are in the Anaheim/Garden Grove area.   Sincerely,   Rick B. Ross General Manager

Summary: I stayed at the hotel in February and after communicating with the management of the hotel about my experience, decided to come back for another try.  Franco at the front desk was very personable and helpful.  He answered all our questions.  The room was very nice -- well appointed.  Very different from the room in February.  This room had a refrigerator, and a bath tub with excellent water pressure (YAY!)  I tried the room service this time, and I must say it was an excellent breakfast.  The only negative thing that remains is that the beds are extremely firm.  If you have any kind of back problems, the beds can be quite painful.  I was able to remedy the problem by stealing pillows off my brother's bed.  My brother slept great, so if you prefer firm beds, this will be great
Manager Response: Dear MizMarcie,  Thank you so much for giving us a second chance to make a first impression !!   I will share your comments with my team & hope to see you back soon at the Sheraton/Garden Grove - Anaheim.   Thanks again for staying with us.   Sincerely,  Rick B. Ross General Manager

Summary: I was here two weeks ago with family for one night.  They"re still talking about it and thought I just had to write a review on this site.  I don't normally find myself on this site, but this hotel made me want to jump on board because I had to express what a great time we had.  After a long day of walking, we just wanted to get in and cleaned up.  The entire staff was welcoming and the property was in pristine shape!  Easy parking, nice food and drinks, cool business center, everything you needed was there, and I liked the smooth/fast elevators.  The beds were compfy, clean and we woke up refreshed and happy!  My family was very compfortable and are still mentioning how nice the hotel was.  I felt the price was worth what we got.  I felt happy and think the managers in charge
Manager Response: Dear SvenGambler,  Thank you so much for your kind words, my Team will be pleased to hear that your stay was  so memorable.   The Beds here are amazing, there is nothing like a good night's sleep on a Sheraton Sweet Sleeper Bed !!  Thanks again & we look forward to having you back the next time you are in the Anaheim/Garden Grove area.   Sincerely,  Rick B. Ross General Manager

Summary Heading: Great modern place, perfect with a rental car, a bit inconvenient without.
Summary: Met up with extended family for a Disneyland weekend and we all decided to pick a nicer and newer place at the expense of location.  Hotel room, service and facilities were excellent (free wifi in the lobby as well as available PC's as you wait for your family to slowly come downstairs in the morning), with friendly and very helpful staff.  Rooms were nicely decorated with contemporary furniture clearly a step up from most places, and very spacious.  The only minor room detail that I would say is a slight issue is the bathroom doors which had big frosted glass panels in them and offer little acoustical privacy.  Travelling with extended family, some members were really uncomfortable with that.  Some of us had rented cars (parking fee is $12) and some of us hadn't, so we all took
Manager Response: Dear Spaceman,  Thank you so much for your kind words about the Hotel & my Staff. I will definitley share them during my next Executive Committee Meeting & hope to see you & your family back soon !!!!  Sincerely,  Rick B. Ross General Manager

Summary: My seven year old son and i stayed here for five nights, it was a perfect hotel all the staff were very nice and helpful. We took the shuttle to and from disneyland it was on time everytime. The room was very clean, we ate at the restaurant every morning and some dinners they had very reasonable prices. We really enjoyed staying this hotel.
Manager Response: Dear rozoa1,  Thank you so much for your kind words. I will definitely share them with my Team & I'm extremely happy that we could make your Vacation at Disneyland so memorable.   We look forward to seeing you again the next time you are in the Anaheim/Garden Grove area.   Sincerely,   Rick B. Ross General Manager

Summary: I stayed here with my fiance in late April.  We had no problem with our check-in, but there was a guest at the counter complaining about a charge on her bill that she thought had been cleared.  Apparently she had been dealing with it for a couple of days.    Staff is friendly at the the front desk and bar.  Free internet and printer use in lobby is nice too.  Free valet parking if you can't find a spot, and they were there quite late up till 1am one of the nights.  One night we just moved the cone from the spots reserved for valet and parked there, it was fine.  The carpets in the elevators are pretty gross, and the counter space in the bathroom is small.  In this area you will likely have children staying at your hotel.  It was loud - early morning through midday.  Doors
Manager Response: Dear jdn604,  Thank you for your comments regarding your stay in April.   The new Carpet for the Elevators was ordered last week & will be installed by next Friday. We are all very excited to get this done as it was definitely needed & I'm sorry that you noticed the obvious wear & tear during your stay.   Yes, we are located very close to Disneyland so we do get a tremendous amount of families with young children that stay with us & they are extremely excited to visit the Park. This can sometimes result in additional noise unfortunately & I do apologize for that inconvenience.   Thanks again & we look forward to hosting You & your Fiance the next time you are in the Anaheim/Garden Grove area.   Sincerely,  Rick B. Ross General Manager

Summary: As a businessman who travels 250 days a year. I have experience many hotels around the US and Canada.  From the minute I stepped into this hotel I felt like I was home!  From the Bellstaff, Front desk, Room Service, and Bartender the whole staff was extremely professional and warm.  The hotel Lobby is amazing, the pool is fun!  If you are staying in Garden Grove or going to Disney Parks.  This hotel is a hidden Gem!  Thank you so mucvh for making my stay so great! Bravo!   AJ,  Los Angeles, CA
Manager Response: Dear AJ,  Thank you so much for your kind words, I will definitely share them with my team & we are  extremely happy that your stay was so memorable.   We look foward to having you back the next time you are in Garden Grove.  Sincerely,  Rick B. Ross General Manager

Summary: Had a memorable trip to Disneyland in January 2011.  But the accommodations were just okay.  The room was clean but a bit on the small side.  Furnishings were ok and so was the bathroom.  The shuttle to Disneyland was not very reliable.  It came and went off schedule; that was the predictable part of it:  you could count on it being late.  I must say, though, that there is an unexpected benefit from having a hotel that has a shuttle to and from Disneyland and is not walking distance from the amusement park.  By the end of the day, we were super exhausted so I don't think I would have enjoyed walking back to my hotel nor would my young son have been able to do so after having walked in Disneyland for hours already.    The front desk personnel were lukewarm in their reception;
Manager Response: Dear limwil,  We strive for excellence with our Guest Service & it appears that we missed the mark during your stay in January....my sincere apologies. This is very surprising as my Front Desk Team is very good at recognizing Children as well as their Parents in an effort to make the entire stay as memorable as possible, especially during a trip to Disneyland.  Thank you for your comments. I can assure you I will share them with my Team & we look forward to having you back soon.   Sincerely,   Rick B. Ross General Manager

Summary: We stayed here in the near past, and I can only say I can wait to come back.  I was on a trip with my family to Disneyland so we booked through getaway.com and got everything we asked for, rooms where large, and clean. Staff was friendly and accommodating.  Although are air conditioner broke it was a great hotel, and staff fixed the air conditioning the minute they got the call. Again I can only say that it couldn't be better
Manager Response: trevor4t,  Thank you so much for your kind words. My Team & I are extremely happy that you enjoyed your stay at our Hotel during your Vacation. I will share your comments with my team.   Thanks again & we look forward to having you back soon !!   Sincerely,  Rick B. Ross General Manager

Summary: Run away from this hotel as fast as you can. The hotel staff discriminate against Priceline customers, they lie about the duties they perform or in our case don't perform for you, the rooms are 100% not cleaned and maintained properly, parking is horrible, handicap accesability is disregarded, you will pay for any extra needs such as roll away beds, parking, or other ammenities, and the management staff does not care to hear your concerns.
Manager Response: Dear Mr. Justice,  I'm so sorry that your stay was than expected at the Sheraton/Garden Grove.   As we discussed, unfortunately when you book through a third party internet site, the  room type is never guarenteed.....especially with Priceline. This is typically not an issue if the  Hotel is running low occupancy & has plenty of inventory. Unfortunately the day you checked in we were 96% occupied & Sold Out the remainder of the days so there were no Queen/Queen rooms left at that time.   I did look into the issue with your room not being cleaned & unfortunately there was a DND (do not disturb) on your doorknob for 2 days in a row. My Housekeeping Staff takes these very seriously, especially as they work in a Leisure Hotel & respect the wishes of our clientelle given the market.   Thanks again for your comments, we will continue to strive for excellence with our guests.   Sincerely,  Rick B. Ross General Manager

Summary: So I need to preface this with we did get a phenomenal rate on priceline...but know that if you book on priceline or other sites not Sheraton you will get the last choice of rooms.  We had two king rooms with my parents and sister in one room and my family (7 and 3) in the next room.  Upon checking in they had no double queen rooms available .  After some discussion with the front desk staff was informed that because I booked on priceline I get what I get.  They did comp the shuttle for us which was a $45 dollar savings.  They also suggested that we go across the street to Target and get air mattresses.  At first this seemed crazy...but in the end worked out and saved us tons of money because rollaways were $20/day and not available.  The air mattresses were $13.  So if you book
Manager Response: Dear Wrshpgrl,  I am so sorry that we did not have a Queen/Queen when you arrived at the Hotel. Unfortunately when you book through a third party internet site like Priceline, the room type is not guaranteed but we always do our best to accomodate a room type request at the time of your arrival.....especially if we have that room type available.   I am happy that you did find a solution with the Air Mattresses from Target......although not ideal.   Sincerely,  Rick B. Ross General Manager

Summary: We all had a great time in the room . Now if you need a frig it's $10 a day , we did not. No Microwave . Internet free in business center. $10 a day in room. We went there to go to Disneyland so hanging out in the room we did little of.Parking is $12.00. Did not pay that due to Vacation Pkg we had.( Get Away today ).Staff was extremely friendly and helpful. Shuttle service was great. Only issue is bus don't stay the same . Can get confusing getting back from Disneyland.Down street from Disney and Convention center.Had pay 3 nights get 4th free. Did not have club level. What I expected of a Sheraton.
Manager Response: We are so pleased that you enjoyed your stay at the Sheraton/Garden Grove. I will share your positive comments with my Team & we look forward to having you back soon !!!!  Sincerely,  Rick B. Ross General Manager

Summary: I had originally booked the room for two nights.  The sleep was rough - bed was hard and the pillows were so squishy.. four were not enough for a king bed as they squished down to nothing and would fall between the fake headboard and the bed.   After a the worst night's sleep, it got even worse.  I went to take a shower only to find the water pressure was no better than a drippy garden hose.  I have long hair and it made it virtually impossible to wash my hair.  When I went down to the front desk and asked if we could be switched to a room with better water pressure for the second night, my complaint was completely dismissed.  I was told there were no other rooms.  When I asked if we could just check out and I could be refunded, I was told that wasn't going to happen either...
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great hotel, attentive staff, clean rooms, good value for the area
Summary: From my room I could watch the Disney weekend fireworks at night and enjoy the San Gabriel Mountain snowcaps during the day. Beaches and mountains are less than an hour away.  Great fitness center, hot tub is always at proper temperature,   I'm returning several times over the next few months and will return to this property.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We booked a Club Floor room with 2 queen beds for two nights. The room was quite new and certainly nice enough. The beds were comfortable and the bathroom even had a glass shower screen rather than the plastic shower curtains so common in American hotels. But, oh boy, the service was absolutely woeful! The "Club Lounge" had one very slow 15 inch computer screen for accessing the internet. No phone, no paper, no pens. The club was downright grotty and the breakfast looked like it had been sitting there for days! On Saturday breakfast was not served in the Club Lounge at all and I had to beg the totally indifferent staff for a voucher to take breakfast in the cafe downstairs.   The kids were having fun in Disneyland and -against my better judgement - we tried to extend our stay by
Manager Response: none

Summary: Our stay was mediocre. The location was great, only about a mile from Disneyland..but the hotel room was just average. especially since it was supposed to be a suite.
Manager Response: I appreciate your remarks. Unfortunately we do not have any suites in this hotel and I apologize for the misunderstanding; however, I am glad you had a pleasant enough stay with us.

Summary: We stayed here for 6 nights over the thanksgiving holiday for Disneyland and a family visit. The hotel staff are the most friendly, helpful and courteous I have found in years. Hotel itself is near brand new and immaculate and "sparkling" throughout. Rooms very exceptionally clean, quiet and comfortable. Also the most capable and well trained housekeeping staff I have ever seen. Rooms were well stocked, prepped and tidied each day, despite all our stuff laying around it felt like coming to a new room each evening. Pool is simple but again, very nice.  This hotel advertised a fitness room. It wasn't a room...it was a full gym! Several new commercial quality treadmills, ellipticals, machines and free weights.  Lastly Disney shuttle was free, fast and picked up and dropped off
Manager Response: I sincerely appreciate your comments on behalf of our hotel and staff. We are very happy that you had a wonderful stay with us. Please visit again.

Summary: My family stayed at the Sheraton Garden Grove for just over a week.  This is a really nice hotel, away from Disneyland.  In my honest opinion, it is way too far to walk to Disneyland from this hotel, but the hotel does offer a shuttle. The shuttle was $3/day for one adult, for the entire day.  Of course, it would be nice if it was free, but it seems everyone is charging for shuttles nowadays. We would use the shuttle to take a break from disneyland and have my son take his  daily nap.  You purchase your shuttle tickets at the front desk. My son rode free. We hd no problems taking our stroller on the shuttle.  It was a very spacious shuttle.  It was never full when we boarded.  We also used the shuttles at off times.  Only once, did we use the shuttle near park closing, but I
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind response. I will personally thank the Housekeeping department on your behalf.

Summary Heading: Nice Hotel, ask for a room away from elevator
Summary: Overall a Nice hotel.  Glad we stayed here.  A little further from Disneyland than other places I've stayed.    They do have their own shuttle for $3.00 per day, kids 10 and under are free.  the shuttle only goes to/from Disneyland. we bought disney park tickets at the hotel, and saved $18.  good deal (thanks Sheraton!)  Most front desk staff was very courteous and helfpul.    The rooms were well appointed.  Super clean, modern, and roomy.    breakfast was good.  we ordered off of the menu.    the only issue i had was that when i checked in, i realized i wanted 1 king, instead of 2 queen beds.  the front desk clerk, looked for another room, said they were pretty booked, but was able to find me a room with a king.  i wish she mentioned that it was right next to the elevator.
Manager Response: Thank you for your response and taking the time to do so. Our staff is here to make you feel welcomed and comfortable; we apologize for any discomfort. I appreciate your feedback, and will incorporate it into our next staff meeting.

Summary: Nice, quiet, and clean. Only complaint was 10 charge a night for internet services to your room. However, free internet is available in the lobby.
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing to stay with us. We appreciate your response.

Summary: Stayed here for 4 days at the end of September with my young daughter.    Hotel was fantastic.  Friendly staff, very clean and modern and a shuttle to Disneyland for $3 return a day for adults (children free).  Also didn't hear any noises at night, nice and quiet.  Another bonus was having Target directly across the road for shopping, which for me was fantastic and an extra bonus.  Will stay here again if I came back for a visit to Disneyland.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: I just cannot understand the desk chair!
Summary: So, something that has troubled me lately with some Sheratons, I always intend to write something about it, but forget, until now.  Why do they have these stupid stationary chairs at the desk / workspace area in the rooms?  They are useless?  Some Sheratons have decent desk chairs, while some have old Grandma style chairs that do not have wheels, tilt, etc.  I would like to see all Sheratons have desk chairs like the Hilton Garden Inns, the Herman Miller style.  Anyhow, enough ranting.  Here are some other key points about this room I need to share.  It is nice, seeminly clean, with a balcony.  I liked the balcony.  What I did not like is the fact that when I hopped in bed, I noticed the bottoms of my feet were black.  Meaning the carpet in the room is obviously dirty.  I know
Manager Response: I apologize for the experience you had staying here with us. We welcome all constructive criticism, as it only helps us to get better. Thank you for your remarks.

Summary: Stayed 3 nights in Sept 2010. Very good value for money. Discount rate on SPG site which included free valet parking and free bus passes to Disneyland. Everyone was very helpful and responded quickly and courteously to requests. Less staff (Valtes, Bellmen, Check In staff than bigger properties but everyone very switched on and helpful. Bar is OK and bar staff very friendly and willing to give advice on nearby restaurants etc. Resturant only used for breakfast. Expresso was great, Danish was microwaved and hot outside and cold in middle. Hotel recently remodeled and elevators are noce and spacious. Does not feel as tired as some other nearby properties. Rooms were decent size, clean and have Flat screen HD TVs (unfortunately cable channels are HD and local channels not - sae at
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great hotel, if you don't come with a pet.
Summary: Hotel by itself was great: nice spacious room, cleaning, etc.  Two complaints: 1. $150 pet fee was the highest pet fee I have ever come across.  The Marriott Suites next door only charges $35 per stay.  Inexcusable to have a pet fee so high. 2.  They charge for parking.  This is a suburban hotel; parking should be included.  Again, the Marriott Suites is a better deal with free parking.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This hotel exceeded my expecations.  We had no problems or issues while staying here, and found everything to be excellent.  Things that really impressed me were: the friendliness of the staff, the gym is fantastic (very modern), the pool is clean and quiet, the bathrooms and the rooms (themselves) are pretty roomy.  If I had to choose ONE thing that bothered me?  It'd be the price of the drinks at the bar.  They are pretty pricey, but that's not uncommon.  Overall, this hotel was flawless.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I stayed at the Sheraton Garden Grove for 4 days,I was running the Disney Land Half Marathon. This hotel was exceptional,the staff at the front desk,no matter what hour were friendly,the staff at the restaurant made me feel like I was an old friend. The Hotel was clean,and very comfortable,the room I had was hugh,and the bed made sleep easy. The hotel is  walking distance from a number of restaurants,but the food at the hotel made going out unnecessary. Its about a 10 minute walk to Disney,but for 3 dollars a day you have unlimited shuttle service 2 times an hour to and from Disney. They ahve 4 computers set up in a seperate area of the Lobby,which is very handy if you didnt bring a lap top. If I ever get back to Disney Land I will be staying at this hotel.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Loved our hotel room - 1 king bed with super clean bathroom, bedsheet and carpet!! :)  Everything in the room looks so new and smells good!  We had a good stay and will return to this hotel again on our next trip to Disneyland.  We have to say that the front desk lady was not helpful, friendly or knowledgeable.  She could have been a new hire because 1st - she did not knowledge us as we were approaching to the check in desk 2nd - she doesn't speak loud and clear 3rd - she was having difficult time swiping our credit card and repeated over and over again for maybe 2 minutes and finally gave up and asked her manager to assist.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I really wish I can give this hotel 4 or even 5 stars, because all the staff I encountered (front desk, bell services, and restaurant) were so nice and provided top notch hospitality. However, a few things will make me think twice about staying here again: 1. The public area carpet was always dirty. The carpet was always dirty in both elevators and the area where you got off the elevator on your floor.  2. Not only was the carpet dirty, there was a certain bad odor always permeating on our floor and also in the elevator. The worst was on our floor, which had bad dog breath smell.  3. Poor housekeeping. Our room was dusty. Then there was Doritos and bits of paper littered around the bed, covered up by the bedspread.  There were many things that made us like this hotel: 1. We got
Manager Response: none

Summary: What a nice hotel with an excellent staff. Sheraton Garden grove is a perfect hotel for families visiting disney land, or the area, and not to mention the restaraunt had great food and service. Thanks again Sheraton Garden Grove for accomodating my family, we'll be sure to stay at this property any time we come to Southern Cali.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Not so sure if I would stay again
Summary: Pro's It was nice and new.  Clean and the staff seemed very attentive.  Con's If using this hotel for Disney, it is somewhat far.  And because of that, I didnt appreciate paying for both parking and the shuttle ride.  Parking was $12 and the shuttle was $3/day for anyone over 10 years of age.  To me, this seemed like a rip off.   The shuttle came every 30 minutes and it was a smaller sized bus and after waiting 30 minutes, it was jammed pack.   It also drove further away from Disney to another hotel to pick up even more people.  So with kids, this added wait time added to crankiness.   Leaving Disney was even worse.  After the firwworks, there were so many people waiting  for the shuttle that it didnt accomodate everyone.   And if the bus comes every 1/2 hour ... yeah, we had to
Manager Response: none

Summary: There are not enough good things that I can say about the Sheraton Garden Grove. I wish that I could learn a new language if only for the purpose of being able to say more great things about my stay with them. Here is my story. When I drove into Anaheim for the first night of my vacation I was supposed to stay at the Marriott, after stopping there though and talking with some rather rude front desk people I learned that there had been a miscommunication and that I was without a place to stay for the next two nights. After what seemed like hours of searching for places to stay I decided, with hesitation, on the Sheraton Garden Grove. I walked through the front door with colossal amounts of frustration at how my night was going, however that all immediately vanished. I walked up
Manager Response: none

Summary: Overall, this hotel is very nice, and the location is good.   I didn't appreciate the $12/night parking fee,  but maybe that is typical for the area.  One thing I don't understand, though: Is it asking too much to have a towel rack in the bathroom?  Just one?  Another disappointment: I like having a sink or at least a makeup area outside the bathroom so that while my husband is showering, I can fix my hair away from the humidity that makes it frizz.  Also, we were told that there is no breakfast on Mondays on the Club Floor (where we stayed), and a sign posted on the door verified this.  Only later did we find that this information was wrong.  We were late and missed the free breakfast.  Bummer!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great customer service, fantastic A/C, but hard bed
Summary: My husband and I stayed here June 27-30, 2010 for the Angels vs Rangers baseball game.  Perfect hotel for a baseball game.  The stadium is about a 10 minute drive from the hotel.  I would also recommend this hotel if you are wanting to go to Disneyland.  A 5 minute drive to Disney.  The room itself was just fine.  The A/C was the best I have ever had in any hotel I've ever stayed in.  The bed was too hard for my liking so I could not give this property a "5".  The shower was great, no tub, and the overall room was fine.  The front desk was so helpful and they helped us on numerous occasions with directions to several places.  If you want to travel to downtown LA, DO NOT stay here.  The trafic was a nightmare, so just be aware :) This hotel is nice and I would highly recommend
Manager Response: none

Summary: Wonderful stay at the Sheraton Garden Grove.  Staff were very friendly, rooms were a nice size, and well maintained common areas.  Hotel is located a short distance from Disneyland, and the hotel shuttle was convenient and priced right.  There are a few nice options in the Disneyland area, I would easily look to this as my first or second choice.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Property is newly renovated and clean.  Location not within walking distance to Disneyland and there is a parking fee to park in their unsecured open lot.  For a Sheraton-branded property, very surprised there is no dedicated security staff onsite.  This would be a minimum requirement of any property when traveling with my family.  This may be a cost-cutting measure, but had I known this before my stay, would have chosen another property.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Rooms were really nice and updated.  Fitness center was really nice for a hotel.  We ate at the hotel for breakfast and it was reasonably priced and good food. It was about a 5 minute drive to Disneyland.  I wouldn't stay here with children as the rooms were too small and no refrigerator but for a stay on business or without kids it is a great hotel.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I just stayed here a couple of weeks ago (for the second time in 6 months).  Personally, I like this hotel. The staff was friendly and accomodating, the property is pretty new (about two years old) and generally well taken care of and clean. The rooms are nice size (approximately 20' X 20' without including the bath, entrance way and an alcove). The usual Sweet Sleeper bed (which I really like).  Perhaps the nicest thing about the hotel was that it was quiet!. I was there, by myself, on business and and I was able to avoid the usual noise and crowds that often go hand-in-hand with the Disneyland experience at hotels closer to the park. Of course, that may change once we get past Memorial Day.  Four computers are available in the lobby and I never had to wait to get on one nor
Manager Response: none

We went as high as the Hotel General Manager, Phil Wolfgramm, and he basically laughed at my wife, saying that the hotel wasn't going to do anything to compensate us for our loss.. Summary Heading: Great restaurant. Had the whole place to myself!
Summary: I stayed at the Crowne Plaza next door and wanted to eat at a different restaurant for my last night. The restaurants around the hotels were packed, so I walked over to the Sheraton. The restaurant was empty. I literally had the whole place to myself. Nice! I recommend their clam chowder and the chicken cesar salad was enough for two people.
